story:
Living in a tent is ok for a few nights but....

My friend Shivajee from Katmandu has been affected by the recent earthquake. Fortunately, there was no loss of life for his family but the house is unsafe and needs major repairs. Let's help him repair, so his family can return under a safe roof.

I was in Katmandu in september 2013, and i felt safe then, during my stay. I have many new friends from this country now. We live in a global village. Please help me support Shivajee and his family.

Thank you

Shivajee et sa famille demeure dans une tente depuis le fameux tremblement de terre. La maison fut lourdement endommagé. Mon ami du Népal a besoin de notre appui. Aidons-le à réparer sa maison afin que sa famille puisse retourner à l'intérieur de sa maison, sous un toit qui ne risquera pas de s'écrouler.

Merci!

story:
The Background

Dear Friend,

The U.S. Supreme Court recently heard oral arguments as marriage equality is litigated.  I'd like to take a moment to put into context why marriage equality matters.

Gay, gay, gay.  How many times have we heard it?  Gay, gay, gay.  If a gay individual is talking about his or her life—the thrill of a date experienced, a moment that felt like a threat to one’s safety, the inequity of a job situation, or a verbalization of the loneliness sometimes felt in a moment of isolation, how many times has a gay or lesbian heard in response, "Why do you have to talk about being gay all the time?"

I know why I talk about it.  Because it can be a matter of life and death.

My gay self started celebrating life differently nine years ago when I met my partner.  But here's a catch: I fell in love with a nonnative.  In the U.S.A. on an H1B visa, he was working in the States while paying his own U.S. taxes, and we were shockingly saddened ten months after his move with a notice from the Department of Homeland Security.  His visa (applied before 9/11 and now transferring his visa post 9/11) was being revoked.  He was facing potential deportment from the United States.

Gay, gay, gay.

We wanted—needed—marriage equality.  Not a civil union.  Not a gay marriage.  A civil marriage recognized by the federal and state governments that would keep us together and allow us to keep contributing to our society, our community, our neighbors, and our selves. Alas, we traveled long distances for nearly two years before immigrating to Canada where we could live together.

THE REQUEST

The financial realities of needing to move from the States have been fierce.  Our first year we were both unemployed.  It took each of us several years to re-build our careers, slowly, from the bottom all over again.  While I paid for U.S. health care for a while as an ex-pat, it was not financially possible for long.  Because marriage equality was not offered in the States, we lost our house, our careers, and our health care.

While Canada does provide national health care, wait times can be a challenge.  So can access to particular specialists because of Canada’s limited population.  While the States has a population of 330 million, Canada is one of 33 million.  There are few family doctors and far fewer specialists.

It can be in Canada's interest to delay treatment.

Recently, I was diagnosed with a brain tumor.  While benign, it is also life threatening.   I have spent two months trying to see various specialists in Toronto and gotten access to one, who determined it would be six to twelve months before I could receive my necessary surgical treatment.  Wait times are long.  Others have larger tumors.  And, primarily, given the rarity of this particular type of tumor, there are exceptionally few neurosurgeons and radiosurgeons who know how to treat it. 

But over the past year, balance issues emerged and intensified, and I have become further symptomatic, with tinnitus in my left ear that has grown resounding.  It took me the past seven months of working my way through the Canadian system to get diagnosed with a rare brain tumor that rests along a series of nerves that regulate balance, hearing, and facial function.  I have what's called an acoustic neuroma, with 1 out of every 100,000 individuals identified annually.

After sending my MRIs to a half dozen neurosurgeons in the States, all of them indicate that I need treatment sooner rather than later.

This whole time, as I've been coping with understanding my diagnosis, I kept having this gnawing feeling of "If only."  If only my partner hadn't lost his visa through no fault of his own.... If only we hadn't moved from the States....If only the United States had marriage equality, we would still have had insurance, still had treatment coverage, and still had options.  Granted, issues of U.S. insurance navigation, in-network/out-of-network situations, deductibles, and too many people underinsured or with no insurance, U.S. health care is not ideal.  But I'm convinced that if we still were living in the United States---but are not because of the lack of marriage equality---I would have been diagnosed sooner (preserving more of my hearing), the tumor would have been smaller (more treatment approaches would be possible), and the financial consequences would not be so devastating.

If I were to have my treatment in Canada, I would need to work with a neurosurgeon who has treated very few acoustic neuromas, a wait time up to a year, and knowing that even Canadian doctors have advised me to seek medical attention out-of-country for my condition.  If I have treatment in the United States, what I've determined, I'm working with a doctor who has had 25 years of experience with acoustic neuromas, access in a few weeks to a team of specialists, and the ability to minimize further symptoms, which include hearing preservation, balance-related complications, and most importantly, brainstem compression.

But to do this, I have to pay out-of-pocket for my hospital care, a procedure that will cost up to $30,000.

THE IMPACT

To my Canadian friends, I want to make clear:  we thank you for the refuge you have shown us, and we know my post-treatment care will be provided with love and success in this compassionate country.  We're thankful this country has extended marriage equality for nearly 10 years now.

To those individuals in States where there is not marriage equality, I encourage you to contact your representative and explain that real lives are affected with decisions that they make.  These are decisions that have little consequence on their own lives but huge implications on the lives of others.  

My reality recently has been about understanding acoustic neuromas, learning about how to treat and finance one, and not giving up hope that my partner and I can have the freedom and choice to come home.  

Many people have asked how they can help.  You could help in two meaningful ways.

The first of which is to use the power of your vote and your voice and influence change in the United States by encouraging marriage equality with your congressional leaders.  Show your support of us by voicing your support to your representative.


Second--and I ask reluctantly—you can make a donation, with my sincerest gratitude, here on Indiegogo.  If you opt to contribute to the cause, your meaningful support will go a long way to defer some of our costs.  

Times are tight, reasons are real--for all of us--so the gist of this request is to ask for your support on my marriage and help support me physically, emotionally, and financially.    If you’re not able to make a financial donation right now, please at least use your voice to contact our congressional leaders and demand their support.

My partner and I appreciate your place in the world.   No matter what people call our marriage, it's very real to us and as we have faced this challenging moment, it's reminded us of our marriage vows:  till death do us part.  Thankfully, we suspect we won't be parting ways for a long, long time and look forward to equality in the very near future.  And we look forward to further sharing our lives with you--and your life with us!

Peace, Hope, Faith, and Gratitude,

story:
My Story

My name is Sandra Londino. I am a doula, childbirth educator, registered nurse, certified nurse midwife, and OBGYN nurse practitioner. I have 2 great kids - Paloma is 14 and Samson is 12, and we live in Ithaca, New York.

After I gave birth for the first time I realized I wanted to be involved with helping women and their families experience birth in a loving and nurtured way. Out of this realization grew my desire to help empower women through personalized midwifery and well-woman care, education, and support.

I have been a clinician at Planned Parenthood of the Southern Finger Lakes for almost a year, and while I have greatly enjoyed and benefited from my experiences there, I would like to return to my original goal of providing midwifery care in childbirth. I am also passionate about offering personalized, holistic, and respectful well-woman care.

Philosophy and model of care

As a midwife, I focus on promoting the health and well-being of women and newborns through respectful, compassionate, and evidence-based care that acknowledges the inherent power and wisdom in women’s bodies. I believe that all people have a right to quality health care that respects their dignity and individuality, accurate information that allows active participation in decision-making, and family involvement as desired. The normalcy of women’s biological events is acknowledged by a “high touch, low tech” model of care that emphasizes the therapeutic use of human connection and communication, while appropriately utilizing interventions and technology only when necessary. I provide health care to women throughout the life-cycle: preconception counseling, prenatal care, labor and birth, postpartum care, newborn care, well-woman exams, family planning, menopause, and general health counseling.

I believe that birth is a normal, yet life-changing event, and the best outcomes for mother and baby are achieved with attentive, personalized, and home-based care. The evidence for safety and satisfactory outcomes in home birth is widespread and growing. Women and their families need to have the opportunity to choose midwifery care where and when they desire it.

I believe that menstruation, pregnancy, birth, and menopause are not illnesses. I feel strongly that only medically complicated situations should be managed medically, and that the vast majority of women will go through these natural life stages without complications or problems. I believe and trust that the female body is designed perfectly to prepare for and give birth without outside interference. I affirm the power and strength of women and the importance of their health in the well-being of families, communities, and nations.

I support and welcome clients regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, age, race, ethnicity, physical ability, or religion. All services are provided in a respectful, compassionate, and professional manner.

What I Need & What You Get

I need your help to get Birthroot Midwifery and Women's Health off the ground. Money that you donate will help me to purchase needed supplies and equipment and ensure that I have a well-equipped, clean, and accessible office where I can see clients for prenatal visits and well-woman care. All of the following (and more!) are needed:

  • medical supplies: gloves, gauze, alcohol wipes, bandages, instruments, IV tubing, supplies, and fluids, resuscitation supplies and equipment, emergency medications, underpads, syringes and needles, suturing equipment and supplies, thermometer, doppler ultrasound, blood pressure cuff, adult and newborn stethoscopes, adult scale, baby scale, speculums, urine dip sticks, microscope and supplies, sharps containers, etc.
  • office supplies: copy/fax machine, file cabinets, file folders, client charts, forms for charts, appointment cards, business cards, envelopes, paper, printer ink, checks, etc.
  • educational materials: posters, handouts, books, DVDs, anatomy models, etc
  • marketing: website, promotional materials

Your donation will help me acquire these much needed supplies. Also, I hope to be able to provide care and services to women in my community at a low cost - so I need your help! Every single donation helps, no matter how small. Even if I don't reach my funding goal, Birthroot is already on its way towards providing women in this community with a much-needed service - it might just take me a little longer!

Donate $100 and get your first well-woman exam FREE! Donate $50 and receive a FREE pre-conception counseling visit. See the side bar to the right for other great perks!

The Impact of Midwifery Care is Real

Maternal and infant mortality and morbidity rates are constantly rising in the United States, along with unnecessary and avoidable c-sections and inductions. More mothers and babies die in U.S. hospitals than in many third-world countries, yet the medical establishment in the U.S. continues to go the wrong way toward more and more interference with the natural process – the very thing that is causing the problems.
Home birth with midwives, however, continues to have a very high level of proven safety. Countries that use the most midwives have the best outcomes. Midwifery care consistently results in statistically safer births, less use of traumatic interventions, and higher maternal satisfaction. Research shows that midwives are the safest care providers for the majority of women with normal pregnancies and births!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone has money to contribute -- but there are other ways to help!

  • Please help to get the word out about this fundraising campaign. The more people who know about it the better. 
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools, you can post it on your Facebook page or other social media platforms.
  • I would also love to accept donations of office furniture and/or supplies.
  • Know anything about creating a website? I could use some help with that!

Thank you....I am so grateful for your help! We all benefit when women have access to high-quality, professional, and personalized care.

Safety in Birth Begins With Midwives

*  RESPECTFUL TREATMENT  *

*  PERSONAL ATTENTION  *

*  EMOTIONAL SUPPORT  *

*  CONFIDENCE IN WOMEN’S BODIES  *

*  EDUCATION AND INFORMATION  *

story:
Overview

An in-water wearable monitor to make swimming safer and more enjoyable

The SEAL wearable swim monitor and drowning detection system offers an extra layer of protection.   It issues accurate and unmistakable warnings and alarms to lifeguards and parents so that they can overcome distractions to respond to a swimmer in distress before medical complications or drowning ensues. Drowning is the #1 cause of traumatic death for children under the age of 5, and the #2 cause of accidental death for all kids in the United States. In this extraordinary age of technology, isn’t it time to bring wireless applications to the swimming pool?

 

How the SEAL works

Using its patented SwimSafe™ technology, the SEAL system creates a virtual safety network between swimmers, guards, and parents by wirelessly connecting wearable swimmer and guard/parent bands through a compact, portable monitoring hub. Each swimmer band continually reports the swimmer’s status to both the central hub and to the guard/parent band, and each band contains a unique electronic signature so many swimmers can be simultaneously monitored.

Stage of Development

After completing a fully functioning prototype and then developing an attractive enclosure that has the right form and fit, the company is now in the design for manufacture process ahead of its commercial release later this year in 2013.  

Detection is the key

If the system detects a swimmer in distress, interim warnings followed by a high-intensity audio, visual, and vibrating alarm are triggered on the swimmer band(s), the guard/parent band(s) and the central hub. The SEAL also incorporates warning and full-alert alarms in the event of power failure, out-of-range signal failure, or if a swimmer has unclasped his or her band. Once in warning or alarm state, The SEAL system requires the applicable swimmers to tap the central hub, close the loop, and confirm all is well. Every device in the system is aware of, and will report, the absence of any other device, which means the SEAL is fault-tolerant and fail-safe in helping parents and lifeguards to be more reliable and responsive than they are today.

Guards are swimmers too

Clicking a special orange front cover onto a band instantly configures that band to be notified of every activity and alarm on all the other bands, allowing a parent or guard to swim and move about the pool while simultaneously keeping track of the status of each swimmer connected to its system. Best of all, it protects the wearer too by notifying the hub and other guard bands if they become a swimmer in distress. Since the band covers are interchangeable, the SEAL can be configured with any ratio of swim and guard bands to support all possible scenarios.

The most effective way to prevent drowning is to learn to swim

Most pool alarms on the market today signal if someone has fallen into the water, with the goal of keeping people safe by restricting access to the pool. But it’s hard to learn to swim without getting wet. The SEAL system lets swimmers play, jump, dive, and even hold their breath yet remain safe in the water while wearing a comfortable, wireless swim band.  

Safety never takes a holiday

The SEAL is portable and powered with long-lasting rechargeable batteries in all devices. It can monitor your backyard pool or travel with you on vacations, to your friend's house, to your community pool, or your swim club. The entire system is compact enough to toss into a pool bag. 

Comfort is king

Human factors and ergonomics were judiciously considered and validated to ensure that swimming fun is uninhibited by the band. The SEAL bands are adjustable and comfortable to wear. Swimmers who have tested the band confirm that it is unnoticeable and doesn’t restrict their strokes -- or their silliness.

Expandable as you add swimmers

Families and swim clubs grow. The SEAL system can grow as well. Additional bands and hubs can be added to the SEAL system to ensure protection of your expanding family or swim club. We have also designed a commercial version that can safeguard large numbers of swimmers at one location or travel site.

Every swimmer is different

A single family, or swim facility, can contain a wide range of swimming abilities. The SEAL swimmer band can be set to four distinct levels, from acting as an immersion alarm for the non-swimmer (triggering the moment the band submerges in water), all the way to the highest level for safeguarding elite swimmers or triathletes. Adult recreational swimmers, rehabilitation patients, and active seniors can maintain their exercise regimen with the peace of mind that they, too, have the SEAL on their side.

 

The Design

Front View of Swimmer and Guard neck bands

 

 

Back View of Swimmer and Guard/Guardian Bands

Available in many colors 

SEAL Monitoring Hub

SEAL System: Bands, Hub and Charger

 

Help Us Revolutionize Swimmer Safety

Swim safer. Pre-order the SEAL and save over 50% off retail pricing. Or contribute and be a part of the mission to eradicate drowning and make swimming safer. Donated funds (non-pre-orders) will be used to fund manufacturing and distribution costs of the SEAL system.

We are grateful for your support of the campaign! Every dollar contributed leads to fewer drownings and more swim safety.

One More Way You Can Help

Spread the word! The SEAL Swim Monitoring System is meant to save lives. Post, post, and post some more. Help us get the word out about our campaign. With every post, click, and donation, you're helping to make a product that will save lives and make swimming safer! 

Please click the Indiegogo share tools to help us find contributors and reach our goal! 

 

Press

Just in Time for Summer: New Drowning-Detection Technology

 

 

Summer is Almost Here: Let’s Talk About Pool Safety

 

Sensor system aims to keep kids from drowning

 

The 'SEAL' Swim Monitor Prevents Drowning By Sensing Danger

 

 

 

 The Seal, wearable swimming monitor and drowning detection system

 

 

The SEAL: Wearable Swim Monitoring and Drowning Detection System

 

 SEAL: Wearable Halsband soll die Kids   vor dem Ertrinken bewahren

  

 

    GADGET OF THE MONTH:  THE SEAL – WEARABLE SWIM MONITORING

 

 

 Un collier anti-noyade !

 

SEAL WearableSwim Monitor May Help Prevent Drowning

 

 

SEAL Swim Monitor Could Prevent Drowning

Praise for the SEAL

"This is the first device I've seen which meaningfully addresses the public health epidemic of drowning by offering parents and family members a real-time, reliable, and effective final line of defense.”

-Doug Trocinski, MD, Pediatric Emergency Physician and father of three

 

“[This product] has both an enormous worldwide market potential and the ability to meaningfully impact child health.”

-Richard Hughes, President, HealthLink Europe, North American Office, and father of two

 

“It will be an invaluable asset for lifeguards, coaches, and parents charged with protecting the lives of children.”

-Robert Donaldson, Former NCAA Division I Swimmer and National Parks Service Officer

 

“Enhances child safety and increases the odds of a child’s survival should the worst transpire.”     

-Virginia Holman, child safety writer and mother of one  

 

“[This device] can, quite simply, make the difference between life and death.”

-Kevin Biese, MD, UNC Emergency Physician, Residency Director at UNC and father of three

Contribution Perks!

 

 

The SEAL Team 

Graham Snyder, MD – Emergency Room Physician, CEO of Thermocline Ventures, Inc., and the Co-Inventor of the SEAL. The tragedies he has witnessed in treating both adult and pediatric victims of drowning led him to conceive of and develop the SEAL.

Justin Calvillo – Team and Business Builder. He creates platforms for growth by implementing high performance programs for business strategy alignment and development, leadership and organizational development, capital raising, business development execution, and technology automation.

Salvatore (Sal) Patalano – Sales. Fortune 100 senior executive and serial entrepreneur who has founded and sold several successful IT companies.  He specializes in growth, transformation and revenue creation.

Travis Angle – Project Manager. He has over ten years of experience making the complex simple and executable. He applies his surgical precision for project management and product planning to the design and creation of technology that enriches and simplifies people’s lives.

Charles Hunt – Industrial Designer. He designs consumer electronics products with emotional and market appeal. His designs have won multiple awards, including the iF Product Design award, the red dot design award, and the International CES Design and Engineering Showcase award.

Lena Cox – Marketing. She is communication focused with expertise in marketing management. She believes marketing is a continuous conversation with customers, potential and acquired.

Chris Newton – Project Coordinator. He organizes the team and manages the Indiegogo campaign.

Courtney Mann, MD - Pediatric Emergency Medicine Specialist. Coinventor of the SEAL and child-safety advocate. <not pictured>

Conner Flynn -Marketing and Campaign Co-ordinater  <not pictured>

 

Frequently Asked Questions:   

1. Is wearing the SEAL™ dangerous or restrictive?

The SEAL™ has been designed by physicians with safety, comfort, and freedom as priorities. The band will unclasp if pulled on to help prevent injury.

2. How many swimmers can the SEAL system track? 

12 swimmers can be tracked simultaneously on each residential system and over 100 swimmers can be tracked on each commercial system. 

3. How long can a swimmer swim before the monitor’s battery needs recharging?

On average, monitors will need to be docked for recharging after 6 hours of swimming.

4. Can I use it in a salt water pool?

Yes.
story_txt:
Overview

An in-water wearable monitor to make swimming safer and more enjoyable

The SEAL wearable swim monitor and drowning detection system offers an extra layer of protection.   It issues accurate and unmistakable warnings and alarms to lifeguards and parents so that they can overcome distractions to respond to a swimmer in distress before medical complications or drowning ensues. Drowning is the #1 cause of traumatic death for children under the age of 5, and the #2 cause of accidental death for all kids in the United States. In this extraordinary age of technology, isn’t it time to bring wireless applications to the swimming pool?

 

How the SEAL works
Using its patented SwimSafe™ technology, the SEAL system creates a virtual safety network between swimmers, guards, and parents by wirelessly connecting wearable swimmer and guard/parent bands through a compact, portable monitoring hub. Each swimmer band continually reports the swimmer’s status to both the central hub and to the guard/parent band, and each band contains a unique electronic signature so many swimmers can be simultaneously monitored.

Stage of Development


After completing a fully functioning prototype and then developing an attractive enclosure that has the right form and fit, the company is now in the design for manufacture process ahead of its commercial release later this year in 2013.  
Detection is the key
If the system detects a swimmer in distress, interim warnings followed by a high-intensity audio, visual, and vibrating alarm are triggered on the swimmer band(s), the guard/parent band(s) and the central hub. The SEAL also incorporates warning and full-alert alarms in the event of power failure, out-of-range signal failure, or if a swimmer has unclasped his or her band. Once in warning or alarm state, The SEAL system requires the applicable swimmers to tap the central hub, close the loop, and confirm all is well. Every device in the system is aware of, and will report, the absence of any other device, which means the SEAL is fault-tolerant and fail-safe in helping parents and lifeguards to be more reliable and responsive than they are today.
Guards are swimmers too
Clicking a special orange front cover onto a band instantly configures that band to be notified of every activity and alarm on all the other bands, allowing a parent or guard to swim and move about the pool while simultaneously keeping track of the status of each swimmer connected to its system. Best of all, it protects the wearer too by notifying the hub and other guard bands if they become a swimmer in distress. Since the band covers are interchangeable, the SEAL can be configured with any ratio of swim and guard bands to support all possible scenarios.
The most effective way to prevent drowning is to learn to swim
Most pool alarms on the market today signal if someone has fallen into the water, with the goal of keeping people safe by restricting access to the pool. But it’s hard to learn to swim without getting wet. The SEAL system lets swimmers play, jump, dive, and even hold their breath yet remain safe in the water while wearing a comfortable, wireless swim band.  

Safety never takes a holiday
The SEAL is portable and powered with long-lasting rechargeable batteries in all devices. It can monitor your backyard pool or travel with you on vacations, to your friend's house, to your community pool, or your swim club. The entire system is compact enough to toss into a pool bag. 
Comfort is king
Human factors and ergonomics were judiciously considered and validated to ensure that swimming fun is uninhibited by the band. The SEAL bands are adjustable and comfortable to wear. Swimmers who have tested the band confirm that it is unnoticeable and doesn’t restrict their strokes -- or their silliness.
Expandable as you add swimmers
Families and swim clubs grow. The SEAL system can grow as well. Additional bands and hubs can be added to the SEAL system to ensure protection of your expanding family or swim club. We have also designed a commercial version that can safeguard large numbers of swimmers at one location or travel site.
Every swimmer is different
A single family, or swim facility, can contain a wide range of swimming abilities. The SEAL swimmer band can be set to four distinct levels, from acting as an immersion alarm for the non-swimmer (triggering the moment the band submerges in water), all the way to the highest level for safeguarding elite swimmers or triathletes. Adult recreational swimmers, rehabilitation patients, and active seniors can maintain their exercise regimen with the peace of mind that they, too, have the SEAL on their side.
 
The Design
Front View of Swimmer and Guard neck bands
 

 
Back View of Swimmer and Guard/Guardian Bands

Available in many colors 
SEAL Monitoring Hub

SEAL System: Bands, Hub and Charger
 

Help Us Revolutionize Swimmer Safety
Swim safer. Pre-order the SEAL and save over 50% off retail pricing. Or contribute and be a part of the mission to eradicate drowning and make swimming safer. Donated funds (non-pre-orders) will be used to fund manufacturing and distribution costs of the SEAL system.
We are grateful for your support of the campaign! Every dollar contributed leads to fewer drownings and more swim safety.
One More Way You Can Help
Spread the word! The SEAL Swim Monitoring System is meant to save lives. Post, post, and post some more. Help us get the word out about our campaign. With every post, click, and donation, you're helping to make a product that will save lives and make swimming safer! 
Please click the Indiegogo share tools to help us find contributors and reach our goal!

story:
An amazing woman in pain

My name is Dannette Tillery and I come to you today as a Daughter worried about her mother’s health. I know a lot of people out there say they have the best mom, but I know I do. She has worked her whole life to take care of me and my 2 brothers and she even took care of my critically ill father, home schooled myself and my little brother while working 2 jobs. It hurts to lose one parent and watch them go through pain and it's another thing to worry about the only one you have left in this world, I was a little girl when I lost my father to lung cancer, but I'm an adult now and I want to fight for my mother’s health and well-being. She has no health insurance and cannot go to the hospital for the test that the doctors have told her she needs to get; they suspect that she has MS (Multiple Sclerosis) or RA. We were running a cleaning business but do to the fact that it hurts her to walk and mostly everything else we had to let it go so my brother and I are looking to take on new jobs to keep up on our High mortgage payments and expense, but I do not want to play with my mother’s health and I fear and break down with tears when I think of her being in pain but pushing on. I ask for your help to raise the funds to help her get treatment and test done. She does not know that I'm doing this, she has a lot of pride but I want to do all I can for her.

 

Funding

My mother needs a MRI test which is anywhere from $400-$3500 and on top of that she was told she needs to be tested for MS and RA and that she most likely has one or both from all her symptoms. I would like to get her some good health care so we can keep her health up; which cost a great deal. All the money I raise will pay for her visits to the hospital/test and a health care plan, also any medications she will need to help with the pain.

 

Indiegogo has a feature for perks but all I can offer to you is to post updates on my mothers test results and health, and to thank you from the bottom of my heart for all your help.

 

 You’re Help

Every little bit helps; every $1 makes a difference. Even if I don’t make the goal I will not give up on raising this money for my mother, so I thank you in advance for all your help.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share with others who can donate, and who may also know of helpful ways to get the word out there.

story:
Short Summary

A night of january 2012, I had a dream. I saw myself, a few months later, on the stage of a fitness comptetition, showing off the body of my dreams. But instead of forgetting this image, I realized that the challenge was really tempting.. The next day started the most intense journey of my life!
5 months later, here I am, almost 30 pounds lighter and getting
closer to my goal every day. This competition is in november and like every
big project, it requires funds! I need help to pay for everything related to the world of competition.
Every donation helps!
 
 

What We Need & What You Get

Why 2200$ you ask? The preparation for the competiton starts today. Here are the details of how I am going to use this amount of money in the next 4 months:

Private trainer: 1200$ for the entire 4 months pre-competition preparation. This includes all the training sessions, personalized diet and training plans every month as well as posing classes.

Diet: 600$ An athlete's diet requires a lot of food and supplements to be able to build his muscles in natural and healthy way! All the vitamins, protein powder and muscle/joints/cardio support costs a lot!

Competition: 400$ This includes the registration fees as well as the hotel the night before, the bikini and spray-tan and every visual detail needed on the day of.

If I don't reach my goal, I am still going through with this project. It's a true passion that I discovered, and I want to start this new carreer the right way. I will spend this money from my own pocket no matter what, this is why every donation helps!!


For donations between 25$ and 49$, I will gladly send you a surprise signed picture of me. For donations over 50$, you will get a signed poster and a picture of me on stage during the competition. This last one will only be sent after the competition, of course.

Remember that even the tinest contribution will help me a lot!

The Impact

By donating to my campaign, you will help me make a dream come true, but also help people around me! I have already inspired people from my community to get healthy and start taking care of their bodies.. But I want to help more people! By doing this competition, I will be able to get noticed and eventually get sponsors to help me with clothes, gym, supplemements and even do more important competitions! I want everyone to see that no matter what you look like, it is possible to change your appereance as much as you want and love your body. Being healthy and training is a drug. Get addicted!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

You can share this campaign with your friends and help me get more followers!

If you are from the Montreal area, you can come see me at my first competition in november: the Pro Gym Cup!

 

Thanks for your time!

 

*Fitness photo by Jo Gorsky

story:
Thank you very much for your support with this campaign!

Please feel free to contact us about any follow-up at: emily.garber@medtuit.com

____________________________________________________________



                                          

Our company’s team includes Dr. Lillian Lien, Medical Director of the Duke Inpatient Diabetes Management Service. She is also the creator of the Lien-Spratt insulin dosing nomogram, which is one of several clinically validated tools included in the app. Also we have important content to help improve diabetes care for children, written by Dr. Robert Benjamin, Clinical Director of the Duke Pediatric Diabetes Program at Duke Hospital.

We need your help to bring the knowledge of our expert medical team to an easy-to-use smartphone app, to improve care for the millions of people in the U.S. and around the world who are affected by diabetes. The app allows doctors, residents, nurses, and other medical professionals to input individual patient information and within seconds receive expert guidance on insulin dosing, backed by tested formulas.

Additionally, we can integrate Diabetes Consult with your institution's own diabetes management protocols, with the potential to customize it to suit your unique needs for seamless care.

People with diabetes are more often treated by non-diabetes specialists than by diabetes specialists. An endocrinologist is not always on the care-team to give their recommendations for diabetes management. They could be followed by any other type of medical specialist instead, depending on their reason for going to the doctor.

So we designed Diabetes Consult to help doctors/teams of all kinds provide top-notch diabetes care for all types of patients!

Currently doctors may use hard copy guides to manually calculate insulin dosing which can be cumbersome and time-consuming, as well as leaving more room for error. Or they could seek a consultation with an endocrinologist specialized in insulin dosing. However, tracking down a specialist, particularly in late hours of the night, typically proves challenging because such specialists are scarce (if available at all). These methods have contributed to the error rates as previously described. 

Here's how you can be part of the solution:

Your contributions to our campaign will fund a clinical trial, and other start-up costs as described below, to help us gather information on how our prototype can be improved and tailored to best suit the needs of the doctors who need it most. 

We appreciate your contributions, and want to involve you in the process, whether you contribute financially or by helping spread the word about this opportunity to improve care for the millions of people living with diabetes.

We have already developed the iOS prototype with plans to develop in Android next... but our team needs to secure at least $60,000 to go from here to product launch!

We have set a reachable goal of $10,000 for this campaign and will continue to work hard towards what is needed to bring this important product to the market.

If you are able, please consider a contribution today to support research with this important Diabetes Consult tool. Every dollar helps!

Incentives

While knowing that you've contributed to improving medical care for people with diabetes and potentially saving lives is an incentive in and of itself, we also want to express our gratitude for your generosity!


Huge thanks to our Silver Sponsor, who donated in honor of their many loved ones living with diabetes, and one very special individual in particular:


Thanks to everyone for your support! We are working hard to prepare for the upcoming clinical trial and are finalizing the app for release....

story:
The MilestonePod attaches to your running or walking shoes to track your shoe mileage so you can replace them before they wear down and add to injury risk.

Well... The Indiegogo campaign has ended.  THANK YOU to everyone who supported us, posted about us, Tweeted for us and everything else you did.

Though we did not hit our goal we are very pleased with the campaign.  We received orders on Indiegogo (and offline) for almost 2,000 Pods which includes orders from eight retailers, two races, three racing clubs, 13 countries, one national non-profit focused on wellness and many others.

We are now focused on delivering exceptional products to those who pre-ordered and to building a great company. Keep an eye on our web site, Facebook and Twitter for news. There may even be a surprise feature or two when the Pods are delivered.

You can still pre-order Pods at www.milestonepod.com.

 

Media "Buzz":

xtri: Milestone Tiny Foot Pod that Track Running Shoe Mileage to ...

Mashable: This Gadget Knows When to Replace Your Running Shoes

Kinetic Shift: MilestonePod Tells When Your Shoes are Toast

Greatist: MilestonePod Tells You When to Replace Your Running Shoes

Miss Zippy: When it’s time to swap them out

Shvoong: What's on your shoe?

Calcalist: Simple, easy to read digital display shows how many miles your shoes have gone.

  

 

Studies show that the life of a running shoe is between 400 - 600 miles, after which the cushioning and support breaks down leading to many common injuries.  

Think for a minute about your current running shoes.  Do you know how many miles are on them?  Are you putting yourself at risk for injury? Don't you wish you could easily track those miles so you never have that dead-shoe feeling again?

Let the MilestonePod track your running shoe miles for you! No more cumbersome training logs, no more guessing and no more math.  Simple, easy to read digital display shows how many miles your shoes have gone.

 

 

 

Real World Runner "Buzz":

"I don't usually think about buying new shoes until my hip starts hurting. That's too late. I can't wait to automatically and continuously know the mileage on my shoes." Dr. Scott Laborwit, opthalmic surgeon,  Boston and Philly Marathon finisher, multiple half-Ironman finisher.

"My shoes are critical to my training and preparation. The MilestonePod will definitely help me remain fresh and injury free, not  to mention the data tag feature eases my mind as I have a serious bee allergy." David Anshen, ranked 18th nationally in the 40-44 age group for duathalons

"I am really excited to offer the MilestonePod to our customers. The device will help minimize injuries during running and the digital tag can be a life saver if there is ever an emergency. The low price makes it a no-brainer for the serious runner." Jeff Cohen, owner FeetFirst, Columbia, MD - serving runners for over 33 years.

 

The MilestonePod - for runners, by runners

 

The new MilestonePod (patent pending) allows you to passively track the mileage logged on your running shoes so they can be replaced at the correct time, not too soon (wasting valuable tread) and not too late (potentially causing injury). Although your shoes may continue to look new, the constant pounding from running causes the materials to wear down and stop providing support and protection. This reduction in shock absorption often leads to injury.

It sounds simple but let's face it, do you really track the mileage on your shoes? As runners ourselves, we have multiple GPS watches, devices and mobile applications that track individual runs and training.  Yet despite training for multiple marathons and Ironmans we have failed to accurately track shoe mileage. This inexpensive device (only $14.95 suggested retail) completely eliminates any worry about when to retire your shoes - your knees, hips and ankles are now much safer!

When you purchase your new pair of shoes just lace the MilestonePod to your sneakers and leave it alone.  Over the coming weeks and months it will track every mile you run and provide a constant read-out of the total miles. You can then replace your shoes at the mileage you desire (typically between 400-600) and move the MilestonePod to the new pair of shoes.  A USB connection allows you to wipe the mileage clean and start fresh with your next pair of shoes.

But that is not all... many runners have allergies, take medications and have other bits of information that might be critical for an emergency responder to know. The MilestonePod allows you to input emergency information (blood type, medical history and more) that can be accessed by simply plugging it in to any USB enabled computer or device. It is different from existing bracelet and anklet IDs because it is always attached to your shoe (ever forget your bracelet?), the information can be changed or augmented anytime and you can include much more information.

Suggested retail price of $14.95

 

The Process

Our team has led design and development of complex hardware projects such as the Microsoft Kinect (the most successful consumer product launch ever) as well as high-end virtual reality goggles used by the military. We have completed many of the critical steps for bringing the MilestonePod to market including rigorously analyzing the bill of materials, completing manufacturing drawings, aligning design and manufacturing facilities and developing a comprehensive production plan. So how will we use the funds you contribute via Indiegogo? Below are the major steps:

Design and build an enclosure: As you can see from the pictures we have designed the device itself and have produced early models. We will use part of the funds we raise to develop mass production capabilities to ensure we minimize manufacturing costs.

Layout electronics: As we have done with past projects, our first step with the MilestonePod was to develope the requirements for the electronics and the build prototype units. We have completed the layout of the actual smaller electronics boards (PCBs) that will be used in the MilestonePod.  Our final step is to optimize the design and prepare for mass production. 

Algorithm development: We have already developed and tested advanced algorithms for capturing movement and accurately recording distance. The algorithms must be ported to the final electronics and optimized on the finished product. 

To summarize, the system has been fully designed, the core functionality has been built and tested, the industrial design is complete, manufacturing partners have been identified and algorithms have been developed. We are turning to you through Indiegogo to help fund some of the initial investment required to help make this vision come alive and provide runners a much needed product.

 

 

 

The Team

Our team is comprised of committed athletes, technologists and entrepreneurs. The mission of Milestone is to leverage the wide availability of sensors and other technologies to bring low cost, high value sensor-based products to the casual sports world. Our initial product is the MilestonePod and we will follow this first release with new versions of the MilestonePod and products for other sports.

During our training for various road races and triathlons we noticed that despite our GPS watches, mobile training apps and other running peripherals there were a few items we still could not easily track. So we built a device. 

Here we are:

Tzach has been in the endurance sport business for the last 16 years. He has completed a dozen marathons, two IronMans and has been a part of teams for adventure racing around the globe. He owns a chain of retail stores for endurance sports and therefore has tremendous knowledge of the needs of runners and other athletes. Tzach regularly responds to runners everyday questions including the big problem  - "When do I need to replace my running shoes?" Tzach brings to Milestone 20 years of experience in starting and growing businesses.
 
Meir has been enthusiastic about triathlons and running for more than 15 years. He is a four-time IronMan finisher and has completed many marathons - with a 2:48 PR. Until now, Meir feels he has been too lazy/busy to log the mileage of his shoes (though he owns every GPS watch ever made), and has just used one pair at a time for too long. Meir has managed technology projects for the last 15 years, holding executive R&D positions. He was the first R&D manager of the technology for the Microsoft Kinect sensor. As a serious runner and technology enthusiast, Meir is the perfect fit to bring this idea to reality.

Jason has been an avid runner for the past 12 years.  He has completed six marathons and numerous half marathons and other races. Jason always alternates shoes when training and has never been able to consistently count mileage on any given pair. Jason has been in executive management, sales, business development and marketing for technology start-up companies for the past 17 years. He has been a part of companies that have gone from  pre-revenue to IPO and some that did not succeed. He would like to think he has learned a thing or two about succesfully launching a company along the way.

Dotan has completed four marathons in the past two years (the last one was 40 minutes faster than the first one). During these two years he managed to replace more than 10 pair of shoes but usually not until his knees started aching.  In the past 18 years Dotan has managed technology projects in the field of web based applications and services and has managed development of web portal services and traffic management systems. Among the projects that Dotan has led are the NBA 50th Anniversary CD ROM, the official Olympic Committee CD ROM for the Atlanta Olympic Games and a series of real time 3D games.

 

Testimonials

"MilestonePod is just what my runners and I need. As a coach I feel responsible for the health of my team.  The MilestonePod will help eliminate one major source of injuries; worn shoes."  Ran Shilon, Head Coach “Endure”, the biggest triathlon team in Israel.

"If it already hurts, some damage has been done.  Unfortunately that seems to happen to me regularly.  Continuously seeing the MilestonePod display is going to be a great tool for me to avoid injuries and maintain my health." Adi Ohayon, BPT, Physical Therapist.

"Running is my favorite way of staying in shape because there is no hassle. I just go out and run. I run for 40 minutes 3 times a week, but have no idea how many miles are on my shoes." Einat Goren, Full time mom, Full time runner.

"I always fall in love with my running shoes and refuse to let them go. I need the reminder I will get from the MilestonePod to help push me to get new shoes before the old ones start causing pain." Rotem Levim, Industrial Designer, amateur runner.

"I just like to walk and my routes are never the same, I try to explore as much as possible and don’t care to track the distance every day. With the MilestonePod I will always know the miles on my shoes without having to do anything." Jacky Cohen, Retiree, Tai Chi instructor, walking for many years

The awesome Milestone tech shirt.  Race ready, high quality, really cool.

FAQ

For full FAQ visit www.milestonepod.com

Mileage Tracking:

1.      How does the MilestonePod connect to my shoe?

You know those helpful clips on pen caps? We have an industrial strength clip on the MilestonePod that clips onto your shoe laces and keeps the device securely and snugly fit to your shoes. You can remove the Pod easily if required or leave it attached for hundreds of miles.

2.      So how does the MilestonePod track my mileage?

We use high accuracy sensors/accelerometers to measure the position of the foot around 100 times a second. This measurement combined with an understanding of the motion of walking/running enables us to build a sophisticated but simple algorithms to give mileage measurements.

3.      Will I feel it when I run?

Nope! The MilestonePod weighs in at a measly 6 grams. We have run hundreds of miles with the pod on our shoe and did not feel a thing. You won’t either.

Digital Tag Use:

1.      How is this different than other running ID's I own?

Other than being digital, when most other ID products are bracelets or anklets,  the MilestonePod differs in two huge ways. First, the device is always on your shoe meaning you do not have to remember to wear it. Let’s face it, which one of you has forgotten to put on your ID bracelet?  The second major difference is that because it is digital it can store more information and  more detailed information. Allergic to antibiotics? Enter it.  Recently had a heart procedure? Enter it. Object to certain treatments? Enter that too. All of it can be on the device.

Oh yeah, one other difference... the data you enter on the Digital Tag on the MilestonePod can be changed or updated anytime.

2.     What data can I input?

It is completely up to you.  This could include allergies, prescription information, medical history, insurance information and emergency contact information.  Whatever data you woudl want an emergency responder to know. You do not need to input a social security number or any other personal identifier nor do you even need to input your name. Of course the device is on your shoe the whole time so there is some built in security as long as you don't lose your shoes.

 

Subscribe to MilestonePod Newsletter to stay updated
story_txt:
The MilestonePod attaches to your running or walking shoes to track your shoe mileage so you can replace them before they wear down and add to injury risk.
Well... The Indiegogo campaign has ended.  THANK YOU to everyone who supported us, posted about us, Tweeted for us and everything else you did.
Though we did not hit our goal we are very pleased with the campaign.  We received orders on Indiegogo (and offline) for almost 2,000 Pods which includes orders from eight retailers, two races, three racing clubs, 13 countries, one national non-profit focused on wellness and many others. 
We are now focused on delivering exceptional products to those who pre-ordered and to building a great company. Keep an eye on our web site, Facebook and Twitter for news. There may even be a surprise feature or two when the Pods are delivered.
You can still pre-order Pods at www.milestonepod.com.

story:
Our Campaign deadline is up, but you can still help Team NCEFT Warriors!  Donate directly to NCEFT by clicking this link and using the "Donate Now" button in the top right corner!

 

We're facing fire, they're facing Cancer

On October 27th a group of NCEFT staff, volunteers, friends, and family will run 3.1 miles and attempt 12 obstacles on course during the NorCal Warrior Dash.  The flames and barbed wire we'll face come race day are nothing compared to the challenges NCEFT patients overcome on a daily basis.  From children battling cancer or neuromuscular disorders, to adults recovering from strokes and veterans living with traumatic brain injuries, these patients are true warriors.

With your help we'll raise enough money to fund one NCEFT therapy session for every obstacle we overcome on race day.

 

One obstacle, one life changed

A single hippotherapy session requires a therapist, horse, horse handler, and two volunteers.  A team that large comes with a price, and at $150 a session it can be difficult for some patients to afford the therapy integral to their continued progress.  We're hoping to raise $1,800, enough to cover the cost of 12 hippotherapy sessions for a patient on scholarship.

 

Your donation, their future

For over 40 years NCEFT has used horses to help change the lives of children and adults with special needs.  Refusing to turn away families based on their financial status, NCEFT instead offers scholarships amounting to thousands of dollars each year.  With options ranging from hippotherapy to adaptive riding, interactive vaulting to therapeutic driving, there exists a program for every individual.  A 501(c)(3) nonprofit, NCEFT relies on an army of volunteers and help from generous donors to maintain a program utilizing 15 therapy horses to treat nearly 100 patients a week.

Spread the good word.

Can't donate right now?  Help us spread the word about Team NCEFT by sharing our campaign on Facebook or Twitter.  Not only will your tweets and posts help us to meet our fundraising goal, but they'll bring some much needed exposure to equine-facilitated therapy.

story:
Thank you for visiting my fundraising page and donating to a great cause! I just want to give a quick background about myself and my upcoming trip to Haiti.

 

I am a doctoral candidate currently in my 3rd year of dental school at the University of Washington. Prior to dental school I received my bachelors degree in Neurological Science and Biomedicine at Montana State University. After I finish dental school in 2014 I will be applying to pediatric residency programs, as I have realized my passion for working with children, and heading back to my hometown of Kalispell Montana with my bride, Juli.

 

I have been tremendously blessed in my life to have two incredible role models teaching me the importance of giving back to society, my Mom and Dad. And I hope I can inspire others like they have inspired me.

 

Myself and 5 other dental students, along with an equal number of dentists, will be traveling to Haiti in March of 2013 to provide dental services to Haitians in the city of Port-au-Prince.  The trip is organized through Medical Relief International and previous trips to Haiti consisted of each provider (dental students and dentists) caring for over 300 people each in just a weeks time.  The organization has established two locations in Haiti, Port-au-Prince and Ferrier, in which a local church with 4 standing walls and a roof is utilized as a makeshift dental office.  We will be bringing transportable dental chairs and all the instruments and equipment necessary to perform restorative work, lab work, and surgical procedures.

 

Your donation is so greatly appreciated and will help in sending me to Haiti. You can rest assured knowing that your donation will go towards the betterment of some of the most impoverished people in the world. I will be taking many pictures along the way and look forward to sharing them with you all.

 

Thank you.

story:
One People. One Aim. One Destiny.

Camp Pumziko is a national camp that serves multi-gendered youth ages six through seventeen and is a program of Community Aid Development and the Malcolm X Grassroots Movement. The activities offered teach political, cultural and historical subjects while incorporating outdoor camping skills. CAD’s Camp Pumziko has been training youth for twenty years to become activists in their respective communities.  Because the coordinators are veteran liberation movement activists themselves, the young people gain a unique insight into the Civil Rights Movement and the subsequent movements, allowing them to analyze the strengths and challenges of individuals and organizations.

We are members of the Community Aid Development (CAD) New Afrikan People's Organization (NAPO), the Malcolm X Grassroots Movement (MXGM), New Afrikan Scouts Organization (NASO) and activists in our communities that teach our youth about wilderness survival, self-determination and sustainability of culture and community from an African-centered perspective, all while having fun! Our staff of volunteers fly and drive in from around the nation to support the consistency and growth of our camp.

A vast majority of our campers rely on donations and sponsorship from the community to get them to camp. Our entire staff consists of volunteers and a large number of them take off a week from work in order to attend camp.

That's Why We Need You!

Our goal is $10,000. That amount covers all administrative costs including space, activities, supplies, equipment and food. The camp is fully staffed with volunteers and we have children come from cities around the nation. We have had children and staff attend from Georgia, Mississippi, Lousiana, Texas, Alabama, Michigan, California, Connecticut, NY and more.

Your donations will help us rent a host camp facility, purchase insurance for the week of camp, buy supplies for activities, procure food and provide scholarships to campers with financial need.

If we are unable to reach our goal, we will still be able to offer some scholarships to campers in need.

How You Can Help!

We want to encourage donations of any amount! We appreciate the words of encouragement that have come and the support of donations big and small. To let you know how much your contribution is appreciated, we offer small incentives as our thanks. The groups at camp are separated into ages by these names, Pakas (6-8 yrs), Chuis (9 and 10 yrs), Simbas (11 and 12 yrs) and Panthers (13-17 yrs). Our perks reflect our age groups and include notable mentions, photos, t-shirts and scrapbooks.

Even if you can’t contribute with a monetary donation, you can still help by spreading the word on your social network pages, via email and word of mouth using the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

Visit us on our website at www.cadnational.org or on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/CampPumziko
story_txt:
One People. One Aim. One Destiny.
Camp Pumziko is a national camp that serves multi-gendered youth ages six through seventeen and is a program of Community Aid Development and the Malcolm X Grassroots Movement. The activities offered teach political, cultural and historical subjects while incorporating outdoor camping skills. CAD’s Camp Pumziko has been training youth for twenty years to become activists in their respective communities.  Because the coordinators are veteran liberation movement activists themselves, the young people gain a unique insight into the Civil Rights Movement and the subsequent movements, allowing them to analyze the strengths and challenges of individuals and organizations.We are members of the Community Aid Development (CAD) New Afrikan People's Organization (NAPO), the Malcolm X Grassroots Movement (MXGM), New Afrikan Scouts Organization (NASO) and activists in our communities that teach our youth about wilderness survival, self-determination and sustainability of culture and community from an African-centered perspective, all while having fun! Our staff of volunteers fly and drive in from around the nation to support the consistency and growth of our camp. 
A vast majority of our campers rely on donations and sponsorship from the community to get them to camp. Our entire staff consists of volunteers and a large number of them take off a week from work in order to attend camp. 


That's Why We Need You!
Our goal is $10,000. That amount covers all administrative costs including space, activities, supplies, equipment and food. The camp is fully staffed with volunteers and we have children come from cities around the nation. We have had children and staff attend from Georgia, Mississippi, Lousiana, Texas, Alabama, Michigan, California, Connecticut, NY and more.
 Your donations will help us rent a host camp facility, purchase insurance for the week of camp, buy supplies for activities, procure food and provide scholarships to campers with financial need. 
If we are unable to reach our goal, we will still be able to offer some scholarships to campers in need.
How You Can Help!
We want to encourage donations of any amount! We appreciate the words of encouragement that have come and the support of donations big and small. To let you know how much your contribution is appreciated, we offer small incentives as our thanks. The groups at camp are separated into ages by these names, Pakas (6-8 yrs), Chuis (9 and 10 yrs), Simbas (11 and 12 yrs) and Panthers (13-17 yrs). Our perks reflect our age groups and include notable mentions, photos, t-shirts and scrapbooks.


Even if you can’t contribute with a monetary donation, you can still help by spreading the word on your social network pages, via email and word of mouth using the Indiegogo share tools on this page.
Visit us on our website at www.cadnational.org or on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/CampPumziko

story:
Imagine that you had a way to talk to water.  What would you ask it?


Would you ask your lake if it was safe to swim in?

How about the rivers that we pull our drinking water from? Would you ask if there were chemicals polluting it? 

These same questions were being asked by the brightest minds in science shortly after 9/11.  

The world needed a way to instantly detect chemical toxins, and identify exactly what those chemicals were. That way, action could be taken to stop the spread of pollution before it could harm the environment or you and me.


We want to give water a literal voice, everywhere - and there is a way to do it.


Green Algae


All bodies of water that are exposed to sunlight have green algae. Oceans, lakes, rivers, and streams around the world all have this in common.  

There are thousands of types of green algae, but they have one thing in common; they survive by using photosynthesis to convert sunlight into energy.  They digest light.


*** WARNING: Scientific Content Alert.***


Oak Ridge National Laboratory - one of the country's premier Cleantech research facilities, patented a way to ask algae how it was digesting light.  Think of it as CT scanner for single cell organisms. 


When asked how it's feeling (by using very precise light waves) healthy algae in clean water respond with a specific pattern.  - "Normal"

If a chemical, is present in the water, they respond with a chemical thumbprint that identifies the toxin...like: "Mercury".


End result:  A nearly instant way to detect the presence or absence of chemicals in any body of water, anywhere in the world.



Who are we?

Franco Valentino - CEO (Programmer, CCNA, former AT&T, IBM)
Shawn Genung - CTO (Chemical/Industrial Engineer, MBA)
Ken McKown - Sr. Analyst (Embedded systems programmer)
Toby Myers - Dir. Business Development
Ray Slatton - Founder/COO (Entrepreneur)

Team Page


Our partners:
IBM - SmartCamp Innovations
Launch Tennessee - NEST-TN
Oak Ridge National Laboratory

Shawn, our CTO, worked at Oak Ridge National Labs after college. When Oak Ridge was looking to commercialize the patents, they approached us to develop a device to analyze, Identify, and report water quality in real time.

We jumped at  the chance.  In 2010, we got our hands on all of the documentation we could find about the technology, had meetings with the PhD's that invented it, and set off to build the next great thing in environmental technology.

Even though the process was well documented, it was the first time anyone would try to build a database of chemical thumbprints based on what algae was saying those chemicals looked like. 

As soon as we started testing, we were amazed that nature & technology could communicate so well to solve a problem.

In the lab, we ran algae through thousands of testing cycles to grab the "normal" healthy pattern of water. Temperature, time of day, and even chemicals from the manufacturing process of the tubing we used all affected the response back from the little buggers.

After months of hard work, we had it.  Normal algae light response to clean water. Cool. Stable. It worked.

Now that the testing process was well defined, work began on building the "thumbprints" for the most common water pollutants.  Arsenic, Mercury, Diuron, Carbaryl, families of chemicals like pesticides and herbicides, organo phosphates (Sarin gas anyone?) and many others.

It's disconcerting to see your chief scientist eating donuts next to an open box of Cyanide.

Even if we didn't know what a particular chemical was, the algae still reported in and told us something was polluting the water.

After 2 years of R&D, we're on our 3rd generation unit:

                                               


AquaSentinel Gen III


It's a rosetta stone for water.  It's the first sensor of its kind that has all of these features in one unit:

  • Install in remote locations
  • Small size: 16" high and 8" wide.
  • Run 24/7/365
  • Does not use any consumables - no chemicals or refills to replace
  • Reports via internet and can tweet the water quality
  • Instantly alerts on specific toxins affecting a body of water
  • Is managed remotely from the internet
  • FAQ page


The units are sold to water utilities to protect our drinking water sources. Even though we are a startup, we already protect hundreds of thousands of homes around the country.


BUT, there is a greater use for this new technology.

Imagine if there were AquaSentinels installed in every river, lake and ocean around the world, and you could click on a map, and instantly see what pollution was affecting it. Quantified water. 


What could we all do if everyone knew what was polluting the water, in real time, everywhere? 

That's our socially conscious goal: Highlight water pollution in real time, over the internet, with precise chemical signatures. 

Here's a beta unit in Soddy Lake, TN. that tweets the water quality every hour.  

If any toxins are detected, the system emails and texts an alert with the identified chemical, so everyone on the list knows what's happening.


Big Hairy Goal:

Let's give water a voice everywhere. Each unit costs $50,000, which at first glance sounds like a lot of money.  However, if you price scientific sensing equipment, its very much in line with sensitive optics and related devices. Even some high end cameras cost about as much.


The Plan:

If we reach the goal for this campaign, we'll install a unit in Lake Austin, TX. It's where the city gets it's water.  Why Austin? well, it's the home of SXSW and fantastic BBQ.  It's also the home of the SXSW Eco conference this year.  Together we can show the world how water can talk and let us know when it needs our help.


But what about my city?

This is where it gets interesting.  Here's our stretch goal: For every $50,000 in pledges, we'll install an additional unit in critical bodies of water around the country.  

  • San Francisco Bay, Chesapeake Bay
  • Columbia River
  • Hudson River, Ohio River, Mississippi River
  • The Great Lakes
  • And all the beaches and coastal areas too numerous to list here


We are here to answer all of your questions. You can also email info@secureaqua.com 

Now go pick your favorite perk and let's give water a voice!

story:
Please Read & Support Becky to Reach her Goal: 

Becky's Texas Acupuncture Licensure fund: Becky has completed her NCCAOM 4 major National exams for "Diplomate of Oriental Medicine" yet she is $500+ away from Texas License. Since moving From California to Texas with a ton of unexpected expenses in 2013. She is asking for your generous heart contributions in raising the funds for her Texas Medical Board Acupuncture License. She has completed over 80% of the process and now fee's and funding is next. Even donations of $5 are greatly appreciated. These are a list of her required State Licensure fee's so you know exactly where your donations are going.

  • Texas Acupuncture License: Application Fee's $305
  • Texas Acupuncture JP Exam Fee's$61 
  • Texas Criminal background check Fee $100
  • Texas Fast Pass Finger print Fee's $44.20
  • Texas Temporary License Fee's $107
  • Texas Acupuncture License Registration Fee's $305

Every $ of Contributions goes to Becky's Licensure Fund and also gives you a perk...Hope you love Acupuncture ...If you never tried it..... Great you will love it, Becky is gentle yet effective. For more Details on Acupuncture Wellness Services Please visit: 

http://beckycastano.com/services/

Every $ Contribution doubles in value for Acupuncture and Oriental Medical services by Becky which will be honored up until 2016 in the State of California and Texas. 

So for example:

  • Donate $  5 then $10 will apply towards Acupuncture Wellness Services
  • Donate $ 10 then $20 will apply towards Acupuncture Wellness Services
  • Donate $ 15 then $30 will apply towards Acupuncture Wellness Sevices
  • Donate $ 20 then $40 will apply towards Acupuncture Wellness Services 
  • Donate $ 25 then $50 will apply towards Acupuncture Wellness Services  
  • Donate $ 30 then $60 will apply towards Acupuncture Wellness Services
  • Donate $ 35 then $70 will apply Towards Acupuncture Wellness Services
  • Donate $ 40 then $80 will apply towards Acupuncture Wellness Services
All funds go to Becky's Acupuncture Licensure Funds She intends to visit California, Arkansas, Georgia by 2015.

The sooner Becky pays her Fee's the sooner she can start her Acupuncture Practice and all the Contributions from family and Friends is greatly appreciated. Even $5 contribution's  are appreciated and received with Gratitude.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please get the word out and share with someone who may want to Contibute to a Mother's Professional Goals please make some noise about our campaign.

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you,

Mariano, Becky, Sebastian and Adrian Castaño

story:
INTRODUCTION

Hello, my name is Alex B. and I am in the fifth grade.  I ranked 5th place in the California State Championship in 2013, and because of this I was invited to compete in the US Kids European Golf Championship in Gullane, Scotland (May 27-29, 2014). I am fundraising money to make this dream possible for me.  I would greatly appreciate any monetary donations or any new/gently-used items, to help me move one step closer to my goal.


=MY GOAL=

Fundraise for Scotland Golf Tournament

I am fundraising to cover tournament fees, practice rounds, transportation, equipment, room and board for the event. My goal is to raise $3600.  


=HOW YOU CAN HELP=

●Monetary Donations:

Monetary PayPal donations are greatly appreciated at GolferGirlAlex@gmail.com


●Share

"SHARE" this page on Facebook!!! Click on the Facebook icon beneath Alex's Golf Swing Video.


=WHY GULLANE, SCOTLAND?=

Alex came in 5th place at the 2013 US Kids Golf Northern California State Championship & 3rd place in the 2013 US Kids Golf Bay Area Summer Tour. Alex qualified and was invited to play at the 2013 World Championship in Pinehurst, 2013 Monterey Challenge, 2014 Copperhead Classic 2014, 2014 Desert Shootout at Wigwam GC, 2014 European Championship in Scotland amongst several other tournaments & championships. Due to our economical situation we can only afford for Alex to attend one event, Alex has chosen to go to Scotland, the origin of golf and attend the three day golf tournament in Gullane.


2014 U.S. Kids Golf European Championship

Practice Round - Monday, May 26th
Tournament Rounds - Tuesday, May 27th - Thursday, May 29th
Van Horn Cup - Friday, May 30th

The world’s best young golfers ages 5-18 descend upon East Lothian, Scotland for the prestigious U.S. Kids Golf European Championship. Approximately 550 players from 35 nations compete in Europe’s premier junior golf tournament to showcase the next generation of stars. The championship is held on many of Scotland’s historic golf courses in East Lothian, including Gullane, Craigielaw, Luffness New and Longniddry.


INTRODUCTION

初めまして。私はアレックスです。私は小学校5年生の女の子です。ゴルフ大好きなGirlです。 おおかげさまで、2013年北カリフォルニア州チャンピオンシップで第5位に入賞しました。2013年ベーエリアのサマーツアーで第3位に入賞しました。その結果、今年5月27から5月29日までUSキッズゴルフが開催するヨーロピアンチャンピオンシップに招待されました。世界35ヶ国以上の5ー18歳、550人以上のゴルファーがゴルフのルーツであるスコットランドにあつ集まりプレーする！ 夢が叶うためにドネーションを募っています。


GOAL

トーナメント出場のため費用のドネーションを募っています。 

     ※トーナメント参加費、練習ラウンド費用、交通費 、宿泊費、食費、ゴルフボール、

         ウェアなど、、、、、

＄３６００が目標です。


YOU CAN HELP

●CASH DONATION:

PayPalのドネーションはGolferGirlAlex@gmail.com までお願いします。


=ドネーションのやり方=

「CONTRIBUTE NOW」ボタンで簡単にできます！

Step ❶

以下のリンクをクリックしてください。

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/chip-in-for-alex-b-to-attend-european-golf-championship-in-gullane-scotland 

Step ❷

ページの右中央に「CONTRIBUTE NOW」の赤いボタンをクリックして下さい。

Step ❸

寄付する金額を書き込んで下さい。 寄付金額によってギフトの選択してください。 

*ギフトの必要としない方は赤い「CONTINUE」ボタンをクリックして下さい。

Step ❹

電子メールアドレスを記入して下さい。

Step ❺

クレジットカードまたはPaypal情報を記入した後、赤い「CONTRIBUTE」ボタンをクリックしたら完了です！！！


●シェア

このページをFacebookでシェアする！ Alexのゴルフスイングビデオ下のFACEBOOK SHAREボタンをクリック！


ご質問等はご遠慮なく          GolferGirlAlex@gmail.com          までお願いします。

よろしくお願いします！

応援ありがとう御座います！！！！

Step ❷
ページの右中央に「CONTRIBUTE NOW」の赤いボタンをクリックして下さい。
Step ❸

●シェア

ご質問等はご遠慮なく          GolferGirlAlex@gmail.com          までお願いします。
よろしくお願いします！
応援ありがとう御座います！！！！

story:
My name is Suzanne Johnson, I am a Certified Massage Therapist and Health Educator. My dream is to start an Aquatic Massage and Fitness business here in Santa Cruz, California. 

If you have never heard of aquatic massage, it is done while floating in a warm pool, in the arms of a massage therapist; and with the aid of small flotation devices. The level of relaxation the client experiences is deeper than any other! Comments range from, "... the closest thing to being in the womb again." to "I felt like I was dreaming." These feelings of peacefulness have lasting results. The warmth and near weightlessness of water provide many benefits for the spine, joints and muscles. Along with the Aquatic Massage I will be offering water aerobics for a great low impact and cardiovascular workout!

Contributors will help build my dream of bringing healing and strong health to my clients. Specifically the contributions will help fund an above ground pool, solar pool cover (for conservation) and filtration and pool maintenance equipment. I am choosing to go with the smallest pool possible (round 8'x52" custom made), so as to be conservative with our precious water. I will also keep the pool covered when not in use.

In addition, contributions will go to inexpensive landscaping of the area, ie. wood bark, stepping stones, and drought tolerant plants to surround the pool. Lastly contributions will go to marketing. I will advertise in the snail-mail coupon packets, social media, company website, search engine optimization, and the local entertainment newspaper.

Please check out the Perks listed, which I know you will enjoy, and will express my gratitude!

If I do not reach my Indiegogo monetary goal the funds will still go towards Aquatic Massage and Fitness. I will rent pool time at other venues, and keep trying to raise funds to eventually have my own pool. Thank you!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • I realize not everyone can help financially, but thank you so much for looking at my campaign. If you feel like helping to share this on social media, get the word out and make some noise about it I would be very appreciative and grateful!
    • It is possible to share using Indiegogo tools as well!

    All the best to you and yours!
