story:
I am so excited to announce that Yoga Joy is expanding! On June 1st, 2015, Yoga Joy moves into the Empire building on 169 Main Street in downtown Gloucester, MA.

Ever since I moved back to town and started my yoga studio two years ago, I have been envisioning Yoga Joy in the Empire building. My original intent for opening the studio was simple and clear: to bring healing to my hometown. Now we have the opportunity to expand the healing movement Yoga Joy started right here in this community! I am asking for you to make a donation to help Yoga Joy reach our goal of raising $6,000 to create a cutting-edge, supreme quality, yoga studio with a spa-like ambiance and plenty of beautiful space to expand your Yoga Joy experience.

Together we can build on the authentic community we have created at Yoga Joy, and at the same time revitalize a building that has too long been vacant in our community—the Empire building! As many of you know, the Empire building was once a three-story department store in the heart of town. It closed in 2004, and has been vacant for the past eleven years. The building covers a large portion of its block on Main St. It's a beautiful space, but I’ve heard so many of us saying over the years what a waste it is to see it empty for so long, right in the middle of our town. So you can imagine my enthusiasm when this past week I was given the opportunity to move Yoga Joy into a part of that space—to be shared with a community partner who also values the healing and enlightening potential of yoga.

To me, this expansion is about building on the intimate, soul-centered energy we have in our current humble and loved studio just six doors down the block! To me, this expansion can also be a chance to:

-Provide Cape Ann with the blissful experience of practicing yoga in a room powered by radiant heat

-Bring you three times the space to practice in

-Upgrade the space with the renovations and luxury additions that truly deepen your experience of Yoga Joy’s transformative classes.

With your donation at this exciting and crucial moment of expansion, you aren’t just demonstrating your support for the revitalization of a historic building and the efforts of a hardworking local businesswoman, you’re also investing in a true spa-like experience in your own yoga practice and healing.

I run my business and I teach with my heart guiding the way, and I am in awe of how positively it affects my students. I have been told many stories of how people experience breakthroughs from my teaching, not just in their practice, but also in their lives. The healing movement I began is expanding right here in this community, and I am honored to be a part of it. Through my teaching, two women were inspired to attend the same Forrest Yoga Teacher Training I undertook and they're enthusiastically bringing their new skills and new roles as teachers back into our Yoga Joy community. Another powerful woman was inspired to integrate my Forrest methods into her yoga teaching style and now is responsible for one of the most popular classes on Sunday mornings. I continue to be filled with joy when I hear of these transformations and expansions at a personal level. What an honor to realize that my efforts to pioneer a healing movement through Forrest Yoga are recognized and valued here on Cape Ann.

It is my hope that through the healing modalities offered at Yoga Joy you will continue to join me in my belief that life is more than trials and tribulations. It's a tapestry of community energy. We are weaving it together with vulnerability in our authentic connections. As I reach out asking for your donation with this Fundraising Campaign, I am opening up to the possibility of integrating the highest quality yoga environment I can dream of into the fabric of Cape Ann.

Thank you for your interest, your support, and for putting energetic stock into my vision to co-create positive change through the healing power of yoga at Yoga Joy.

story:
Me and my idea:

My name is Kevin Stafford and I am a Registered Marriage and Family Therapist and Psychotherapist in private practice. I have a passion for helping people with the ordinary and out-of-the-ordinary problems. I have been in private practice in Guelph, Ontario since 1997 under the name Hillside Family Therapy.

I want to focus 25% of my practice serving people who cannot afford to pay private practice fees, do not have access to insurance coverage, and have no (or limited) benefits through an employee assistance program.  

Your contribution to the Mental Health Matters Fund will assist individuals, couples and families to get the help they need and want but can’t afford.  

The people I want to assist with this fund are those who want to make meaningful change in their lives but can’t afford to pay for therapy or whose access to therapy is limiting.

I have over 20 years of experience creating therapeutic conversations with people to help generate new ideas, alternative perspectives and possibilities for their lives. I work collaboratively with people to help them reconnect their lives to the beliefs, ideas and relationships that matter to them. I also help people to understand the effects and influences that problems have on their lives and to find possible solutions for managing and standing against those problems.



How my Idea will work:

At its heart this idea creates a three way partnership to help someone access needed and wanted therapy.

  •  The client: contributes a portion by paying some of the fee, even if it’s only a small amount.
  • The Therapist (that’s me): contributes a portion and absorbs all taxes.  
  • The Indiegogo funder (that’s you): collectively contributes the remaining or “topped-up” portion of the fee.

This chart shows how the funds collected will be used based upon fees paid by the client.

Amount paid in dollars by:

The Client

 The Therapist

The Indiegogo Funder 

Total

$10.00

$30.00

$70.00

$110.00

$20.00

$30.00

$30.00

$50.00

$110.00

$40.00

$30.00

$40.00

$110.00

$50.00

$30.00

$30.00

$110.00

Example:  A client, who can only afford to pay $20.00, will have their fee “topped up” by $60.00 from the Indiegogo Mental Health Matters Fund and I would contribute the remaining $30.00.

  • Funds will only be used to top up clients after the funds have been received and will not be used to pay for missed or cancelled appointments.
  • A record will be kept accounting for the amounts drawn from the fund. I will post regular updates on how the funds are being used on my website (www.kevinstafford.com) and at the end of the year, I will post a complete accounting of how the funds were allocated, and how many clients and sessions were generated. Client confidentiality will be maintained at all times.

With the success of this campaign:

With the success of this campaign, a second campaign could be launched to broaden its reach. The second campaign would bring in more therapists, who would help provide easier access to therapy for more people who cannot afford to pay.  

Where will clients come from?

  • I have a good referral network that consists of family physicians, colleagues in private practice, a university training program and word of mouth.

Breakdown of how the funds will be spent and what they will provide:

  • My goal is to raise $20,000.00 (CDN). Here is a breakdown of where the funding will go:

Indiegogo takes 4% (plus 3% on credit card transactions) 

$ 1,800 (est.)

Amount to be used to “top up” reduced fee clients

$18,200

Fund Goal Total

$20,000

  • The $18,200 will allow approximately 33 clients access to my therapy services at an average of 12 sessions at an average fee “top-up” of $45.00 per session. 



About My Practice and Clinical Experience

While I work with individuals, couples and families with a wide range of presenting problems – from the “ordinary to the out-of-the-ordinary”, there are some things I focus on and have developed a reputation for working with: 

  • Couple and relationship therapy
  • Enhancing connection and communication
  • Reconnecting after a transgression or affair
  • Sexual intimacy

  • Trauma
  • Recovery from childhood abuses
  • Recovery from traumatic events

  • Anxiety, panic

  • Loss, grief, and ambiguous loss

  • Generational family therapy
  • Reconnecting after conflict
  • Sandwich generation

  • Parenting and adolescence

  • Transgenderism and other Queer issues

Out of the ordinary problems. I have developed a reputation of working with clinical situations that may make others say “yikes!” Often these are situations that are marred by shame and guilt and require an extra degree of patience, empathy and thoughtfulness in order to work though.


              

More About My Training

I hold a Master’s of Science degree in Marriage and Family Therapy and was trained at the University of Guelph’s Marriage and Family Therapy Program in the Department of Family Relations and Human Development. This program is accredited by the American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy.


  • I am a Clinical Fellow and Approved Supervisor with the Ontario and American Associations for Marriage and Family Therapy.

  • I received additional therapy training in Canada, Australia and the United States in Solution Focused and Narrative Therapies, sexuality and EMDR.

  • I provide supervision and consultation to colleagues in the field as well as to some clinical teams at the Homewood Health Centre.

  • Over the past 17 years, I have taught more than 30 courses in therapy, family relations, human development and sexuality at both the graduate and undergraduate levels as a sessional instructor at the University of Guelph. 

  •  In 2009, I was appointed by the Minister of Health and Long Term Care for Ontario to sit on the transitional Council for the new College of Registered Psychotherapists of Ontario. This appointment has allowed me to take a leadership role in the development of regulations, standards and policy. 


                  


How else can you help?

  • Spread the word please share this with friends, post it on your Facebook, Linked In or Tweet about me.

  • Break the silence and talk about mental health. If you know someone who is struggling –offer empathy over fear and kindness over judgement, listen instead of trying to fix the problem.

  • Visit my website: www.kevinstafford.com


Some Mental Health statistics:

  • Mental health issues will indirectly (a family member; friend or colleague) affect all of us at some time.

  • 1 in 5 Canadians (about the same in the US) will be directly affected by some form of mental illness. How many friends do you have?  How many people work in your office? How many people in your extended family?  Figure that number out and divide by 5.
  • While mental health does not discriminate based on age, education, income levels or culture – these often help fuel the stigma of having a mental illness or worse seeking help to treat it.

  • The Mental Health System spent an estimated over 4 billion dollars on care in 1998 (latest statistic).

  • Additionally over 6 Billion was spent on uninsured mental health services and time of work for depression and distress – not treated by the health care system.

Source: Canadian Mental Health Association.

  • Mental health has impacts on families as they try and care for and understand a family member with a mental health problem.

  • It has effects on work because of missed work, or reduced productivity because a person is unable or stigmatized from seeking treatment. 

  • It has effects socially because we do not talk enough about mental health, and when someone has a struggle or problem, people often resort to fear, do not know what to do or say and the result is silence.


"Perk" pictures:

Mental Health Matters Bracelet: Handmade from latex free rubber bands by my daughter. The bracelet comes in purple and white and there are 30 of these to be claimed with for a $25 contribution. 


Pine Bench: One of a kind and personally handcrafted by Kevin Stafford. There are two of these benches to be claimed with a $750 contribution.

story:
Teri's Story

In addition to being an amazing mother, wife, sister and aunt, Teri Heitman is an extremely loving, caring and courageous woman who will bend over backwards to help anyone in need. She has been a strong advocate for the local theatre community and has greatly impacted the lives of many.  Now is our chance to help her.

Over a year ago, Teri was diagnosed with cancer for a third time.  She had previously battled cervical cancer and anaplastic large cell lymphoma and won.  In 2012 she was diagnosed with an extremely rare, aggressive form of lymphoma called cutaneous gamma-delta T-cell lymphoma (CGD-TCL).  This is a form of skin cancer that creates plaque-like lesions all over her body and has also attacked the nerves in her left arm so she currently has no use of her left hand and is in constant pain.   

In March of this year, after completing a rigorous chemotherapy regimen which lasted several months, it was determined that Teri’s cancer had gone into remission.  Her physicians had made plans to move forward with two separate stem-cell transplants in the hope that these transplants would prevent her lymphoma from returning.

However, in May of 2013, a PET scan reflected that Teri’s cancer had already come back.  Her physicians determined that there was one more chemotherapy combination that she could try, but it did not seem to work.  After regrouping, her oncologist and a team of cutaneous oncologists at Stanford have decided to try one other chemotherapy drug.  In addition, she decided to pursue some alternative therapies to help her fight this battle.

How Can I Help?

After much research and consulting with friends and loved ones, Teri found two alternative therapies which have been successful in fighting cancer in late stage cancer patients. 

One such therapy is a treatment called Transfer Factor Plus, a capsule that helps boost the immune system and enhance chemotherapy treatments.  Teri has already begun the Transfer Factor Plus regimen that seems to be helping with her energy and the skin lesions.

The other therapy involves two different vaccines, a universal vaccine and a customized vaccine, developed by Dr. Kenichiro Hasumi, a physician in Japan who specializes in cancer immunotherapy. 

In addition to the two therapies, Teri is currently undergoing chemo and is living in a care facility.  She is extremely weak and needs help doing just about everything.  We would love to bring her home so she could be around her dogs and people that make her happy, but the cost of in-home care is very high and not covered by Medicare. 

Unfortunately, the in-home care and both therapies are very expensive and are not covered under Teri’s medical insurance.  

In-home care in her area is $20/hour and we feel she would need care 24/7.  That equals $480 per day until she gets her strength back and can start doing things for herself.

Transfer Factor Plus costs around $600 for a two month supply, and the Hasumi Vaccines will cost $150 every month, plus an initial start up cost of roughly $3400 to create a custom vaccine that will help Teri's cells fight with her rather than against her.  Teri will be required to utilize both therapies for an indefinite amount of time. 

Thus, our goal is to raise $5000 to assist Teri and her family with payment for these ongoing treatments.  

What Do I Get?

Teri has always believed strongly in angels watching over us all and has acted as an angel here on earth to many people.

We would like everyone to become one of "Teri's Angels" so anyone that donates will receive one of the following: a beautiful pair of Teri's Angels earrings, key chain, bookmark (examples below) or a beaded spiral suncatcher (not pictured) - designed and hand-crafted by Teri's sister, Judy with help from Teri's daughter, Kristen.

Other Ways To Help

We would be truly grateful for any support you could provide in helping us to achieve this goal, but we understand in this tough economy that may not be possible.  

Your kind thoughts, healing vibes and prayer are more than welcome.  

Please feel free to share this campaign as well, and, if you or somebody you love is battling cancer and you would like more information on any of these alternative thearapies, please reach out to us using the email address below.

Family and friends (and even the kind words of strangers) can make a huge difference in lifting a person's spirits.  If you would like to send Teri a note, you can do so at terisangels@icloud.com.

A special thank you to Garrett Vander Leun for creating the beautiful Teri's Angels image.

In addition to being an amazing mother, wife, sister and aunt, Teri Heitman is an extremely loving, caring and courageous woman who will bend over backwards to help anyone in need. She has been a strong advocate for the local theatre community and has greatly impacted the lives of many.  Now is our chance to help her.
Over a year ago, Teri was diagnosed with cancer for a third time.  She had previously battled cervical cancer and anaplastic large cell lymphoma and won.  In 2012 she was diagnosed with an extremely rare, aggressive form of lymphoma called cutaneous gamma-delta T-cell lymphoma (CGD-TCL).  This is a form of skin cancer that creates plaque-like lesions all over her body and has also attacked the nerves in her left arm so she currently has no use of her left hand and is in constant pain.   
In March of this year, after completing a rigorous chemotherapy regimen which lasted several months, it was determined that Teri’s cancer had gone into remission.  Her physicians had made plans to move forward with two separate stem-cell transplants in the hope that these transplants would prevent her lymphoma from returning.
However, in May of 2013, a PET scan reflected that Teri’s cancer had already come back.  Her physicians determined that there was one more chemotherapy combination that she could try, but it did not seem to work.  After regrouping, her oncologist and a team of cutaneous oncologists at Stanford have decided to try one other chemotherapy drug.  In addition, she decided to pursue some alternative therapies to help her fight this battle.


How Can I Help?
After much research and consulting with friends and loved ones, Teri found two alternative therapies which have been successful in fighting cancer in late stage cancer patients. 
One such therapy is a treatment called Transfer Factor Plus, a capsule that helps boost the immune system and enhance chemotherapy treatments.  Teri has already begun the Transfer Factor Plus regimen that seems to be helping with her energy and the skin lesions.
The other therapy involves two different vaccines, a universal vaccine and a customized vaccine, developed by Dr. Kenichiro Hasumi, a physician in Japan who specializes in cancer immunotherapy. 
In addition to the two therapies, Teri is currently undergoing chemo and is living in a care facility.  She is extremely weak and needs help doing just about everything.  We would love to bring her home so she could be around her dogs and people that make her happy, but the cost of in-home care is very high and not covered by Medicare. 
Unfortunately, the in-home care and both therapies are very expensive and are not covered under Teri’s medical insurance.  
In-home care in her area is $20/hour and we feel she would need care 24/7.  That equals $480 per day until she gets her strength back and can start doing things for herself.
Transfer Factor Plus costs around $600 for a two month supply, and the Hasumi Vaccines will cost $150 every month, plus an initial start up cost of roughly $3400 to create a custom vaccine that will help Teri's cells fight with her rather than against her.  Teri will be required to utilize both therapies for an indefinite amount of time. 
Thus, our goal is to raise $5000 to assist Teri and her family with payment for these ongoing treatments.  

What Do I Get?
Teri has always believed strongly in angels watching over us all and has acted as an angel here on earth to many people.
We would like everyone to become one of "Teri's Angels" so anyone that donates will receive one of the following: a beautiful pair of Teri's Angels earrings, key chain, bookmark (examples below) or a beaded spiral suncatcher (not pictured) - designed and hand-crafted by Teri's sister, Judy with help from Teri's daughter, Kristen.


Other Ways To Help
We would be truly grateful for any support you could provide in helping us to achieve this goal, but we understand in this tough economy that may not be possible.  
Your kind thoughts, healing vibes and prayer are more than welcome.  
Please feel free to share this campaign as well, and, if you or somebody you love is battling cancer and you would like more information on any of these alternative thearapies, please reach out to us using the email address below.
Family and friends (and even the kind words of strangers) can make a huge difference in lifting a person's spirits.  If you would like to send Teri a note, you can do so at terisangels@icloud.com.

A special thank you to Garrett Vander Leun for creating the beautiful Teri's Angels image.

story:
Belén Clean Water Campaign: Providing Education and Clean Water 

We are CGCHealth. We’re working hard to assist the people of the Peruvian Amazon so they can achieve their community's life goals. Our goal is to magnify the voices within those communities so they can reach the ears of those with the power and privilege to help effect the change they wish to see in their world.

CGCHealth works within existing social structures in Iquitos, Peru to enact change. We make the needs and wishes of the people the starting point, working from the bottom-up, while always respecting the local cultures that are represented within the communities of the Amazon.

CGCHealth conducted a needs assessment in 2012 and met with many community leaders (Apus and Agentes) within the Amazon. They stated that the health of the community was a major concern. When asked what they believed the root of the health problem was they consistently responded, “No tomamos agua limpia”, “We don’t drink clean water.” So we are starting there: at the root of the problem.

We are working to solve the root of the health crisis in a community named Belén.  Belén, located on the banks of the Itaya River, is a community of nearly 50,000 people whose voices have been overshadowed and forgotten, their needs have become secondary to those considered to be of a higher social status and more worthy of proper attention and aid. The people live happily in their tightly knit communities, however, and are eager to help themselves reach a future that they desire.

CGCHealth is a tool that can help the people of Belén reach their goals, their desires, and their futures. We have the power and the privilege to be in the position to teach free classes on what is asked of us and use that privilege as an NGO to bring in people from governmental organizations from all over Iquitos to come teach free classes about how to get a national ID, prevention of diseases, treatments for common illnesses, how to get clean water and the list continues to grow.

With the $10,000, CGCHealth members will team up with UNAP Medical Students to teach a four-day health course to a total of 180 families of the Belén community throughout the next year. We hope to be able to educate and provide filters to 15 families per month. At the end of each course, the families will receive a water filter system to implement in their homes. Water should always be free and clean but the people of Belén need our help to make this a reality.  

What Is Being Asked of You

                                                                          Centro de Salud 6 de Octubre

This Summer, CGCHealth set out to Iquitos, Peru to initiate a Clean Water Campaign with 50 families in the small and impoverished communities in Belén. We worked in the Centro de Salud 6 de Octubre. People with illnesses due to water contamination were offered a four-day course organized by CGCHealth. Along with the help of students from the University of Kansas and Medical Students from Universidad Nacional de la Amazonia Peruana (UNAP) in Iquitos, we educated the families about the symptoms, prevention, and treatment of illnesses common to Belén. At the end of the course, each family received a water filter and two buckets to use at home. The hope was to reach 50 families within the month of June. During the first week, 5 families showed up, 7 families by the second week, and by the third week, 150 families showed up with the hope of attending the heath education course and receiving a filter! This interest far exceeded our expectations or hopes for this program! All the families had come by word of mouth with an eagerness and desire to gain a better understanding about their health and the importance of clean water. We need your help to ensure that no family is denied access to clean water.  Turning away one family is one too many.

The people of Belén are enthusiastic and hungry to learn about ways to keep themselves, their families, and their community healthy! Community members continue to ask CGCHealth team members when the next health course will be! CGCHealth hopes to support the desires of the community of Belén and continue the health course the rest of the year, reaching and educating 20 new families each month!

The funding we are asking for will go towards purchasing water filters and buckets for each of these families. This is where we immediately need your help so we can bring the community of Belén what they want and need the most for their health and for their futures—clean water!

  • Water filter $45 USD + 2 buckets $10 USD = filter system $55 USD
  • $10,000 ÷ $55 = 180 water filter systems
  • 180 filters distributed to families of (on average) 5 means:
      • 180 x 6 = 1080 people with clean water for 10-15 years!!!

 

The Impact

 

Clean water is a seriously powerful tool to positively impact the lives of the men, women, and children of Belén. With the $10,000 USD we at CGCHealth can help to bring Belén the health education and clean water they desire! The 80 families CGCHealth has worked with so far have become spokespersons for health and clean water. They have become participants in town hall meetings with the Mayor of Belén, Hermogenes Flores Gomez, to voice their most prevalent needs, concerns, and desires for their community. But, as they say here, Belén RUGE por agua limpia—Belén ROARS for clean water! Neither we nor the community want to stop here! Clean water must be made available to all! It is a human right that must be instilled.

Children watching water filter to drink.

With clean water Belén can expect to be effected in the following ways:

  • Children will become better educated not having to miss days of school home sick
  • Parents will be able to work to earn their family a better living
  • Parents and children will have a higher “baseline” level of health and become more effective community members
  • Children will become better nourished and have energy to actively learn, grow, and create
  • Parents will become better able to care for and nurture their young children with more energy
  • With more active community members, Belén will be able to charge forward to reach the future they hope to see for their children
  • With less government money being spent on medical expenses due to water borne illness the health posts will have the ability to care for the very ill patients or begin new projects to advance the communities goals for their future (Trashpickup! Sidewalks! Water canals! Latrines! Security!)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We understand that monetary donations are not always feasible. We ask, however, that you pass the message on to friends and family. Help us to bring the voices of Belén to those with the power and the privilege to help Belén reach the future they wish to see.

  • Make some noise about the campaign! Post the hyperlink to your facebook!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Water well project

    My name is Ibrahim. I am a medical student living in Norway. Through many years I have asked myself the question; why is it that we in the west are neglecting the same rights that we supposedly fight for? The freedom to express, the freedom to eat and drink, freeing oneself from slavery etc. Me and my colleagues thougt that we should do something about it, taking it one step at a time.

    Many people take it for granted that we are able to have access to clean water all day, every day and year around, not thinking of those who have to travel for miles, often times dehydrated due to the intense heat, just to be able to get some water for themselves and their families. Even when they access the water, it most certainly never is clean.

    Our vision is to change that. We want to be able to provide clean water, year around. 

    We believe that with the access of clean water, we can not only save the life of severely dehydrated people, but we would also reduce the risk for spreading diseases and better the personal hygiene, all of which increase the life standards of thousands of people. Also the sosio-economic aspect would greatly increase.

    So you may ask yourself, how can you yourself benefit from this? 
    When, not if ;D, we reach our goal, which we will with your help, you will be looking back at this project smiling, knowing you contributed for the sustainable developement. 

    Remember that even though we are destined to live for a few years, there will be generations after us, maybe in need of greater help, which we in the future may not be able to provide, if we dont start acting today.

    Every donation will help us a step. Size does not always matter! :-)

    If you cannot help us financially, you could share this on social media; Facebook, Twitter, Google+ etc. Also, try to spread the word about, not only this project, but other projects to help out the people in need.

    We will be working with Kimse Yok Mu (http://www.kimseyokmu.org.tr/). Check out their website!

    Fight for the right to drink clean water!

story:
We at TrackForce need your help in producing the ability for all parents and senior caretakers to track their loved ones. We also want to give law enforcement the ability to locate, secure and bring home these missing children and seniors in a fraction of the time it takes to develop and follow leads. With TrackForce it will take the 'guess work' out of where the missing person is! 

In the US alone, the FBI reports that there are more than 800,000 reported people missing. There is nothing more emotionally troubling than when a child or any loved one goes missing. With a "Wearable" tracking chip, this will save many from harm by shortening the length of time missing. And as we all know, when the clock starts ticking, time is against us! 


Our programming engineer will enhance our base Grid to widen the search radius as well as implement 'Ping Reporting' as discussed in the video.

 Then, we need to interview with potential and qualified Manufacturers that can produce not only the chips but also the water resistant covers in multiple colors. We have the prototypes, now its time to take it to the next step! 

 Then, once the manufacturer is secured, we will then go into the Logistics/Marketing phase. This is how we will strategically get the TrackForce App and tracking chip to the end users at the best possible price. 

Say a parent purchases the tracking chip, in the packaging in which it comes in, there will be a link to the App and also a barcode in which they can scan into the App download. They will create their own unique password and sync the chip with the app.  

Your contribution will not only bring parents and caretakers peace of mind, but one day, will bring someone home to safety! Avoiding the "what if's" we all fear when someone goes missing. In addition, we have given some nice perks and may be adding more! And knowing that you were a "Silent Partner' in the production of what we hope to be a parental "Must Have" should give you pride and also make you feel at least a little bit like a hero. Wait til the first time you hear on the news about a missing child being recovered because of a TrackForce Tracking unit! 


We aren't just making someone's life easier with this product, we are LITERALLY changing what could have been a tragic event into one with minimal harm done. And its People like YOU who have taken the time to read this and watch the video that make the difference! Its YOU that's the hero! Not us. We couldn't do this without you. Plain and simple. So Please donate ANY amount and help us get closer to our goal. That's what this site is all about,making it happen! 

We understand that not everyone is in a position to help But your hearts in the right place. And that speak volumes about you as a person. Maybe you can share this with a few friend or people at work. Remember that Indiegogo has the "Share Tool" which would help us get the word out. And Any little bit helps! Its a TEAM effort. :) Thanks for your support!

story:
Introducing Big Ass Light Bar

The most hardcore portable light ever made, Big Ass Light Bar features a water-resistant design, shock-absorbing components and chemical-resistant materials. And Light Bar's function matches its form – it is the brightest battery-powered LED work light ever created.

Features

The World’s Most Versatile Handheld Area Light

Light Bar was born in an auto shop, but it sure as hell doesn’t have to stay there. Whatever you do and wherever you go, Big Ass Light Bar will keep the lights on.

  • Auto Shops
  • Oil Rigs
  • Contractors
  • First Responders
  • Military and Police
  • Hiking and Camping

Bright-Ass Light

Featuring an output of up to 5,000 lumens, Light Bar’s light angle exceeds 180 degrees, illuminating entire areas — not just what’s in front of you. Six different brightness settings give you total control over the light output.

(Practically) Everlasting Light

When the sun goes down but the job isn’t finished, you need a light that will always turn on.

Light Bar’s compact rechargeable battery provides up to 48 hours of continuous light, or up to 1.5 hours at maximum brightness. Easily swap out a spent battery for a charged one, and get back to business in a matter of seconds.

Take It to Hell and Back

At Big Ass, we build things to last. That’s why we built Light Bar to exceed the most demanding standards imaginable, using components that will endure corrosion, drops and years of daily use.

Light Bar is IP66 Rated to be insulated from dust and particulates, and is washdown-ready.

Chemically resistant components stand up to diesel, gasoline, lubricants, penetrants (PB B’laster) and everything in — and under — the kitchen sink

The overmolded battery, grip and end-piece absorb any blow, ensuring your light will always turn on when you need it.

Intelligently Designed

Whether it’s in your hand or on a tool bench, Light Bar is designed to stay put. Its octagonal shape is roll-resistant and keeps the light stable on any surface, and the overmolded handle provides maximum grip when you take your light on the go.

 

Tech Specs:

  • Length: 23.6 in
  • Width: 2 in
  • Weight: 3 lbs. 14 oz
  • Operating Voltage: Removable 14.4-volt battery with charge indicator; 100-125 VAC, 50/60 Hz
  • Operating Temperature: -4°F to 113°F (-20°C to 45°C)
  • Lumen Output: 80 lm, 500 lm, 850 lm, 1500 lm, 2800 lm, 5000 lm
  • CRI: 80+
  • CCT: 5000 K
  • Lifespan (L70): 60,000 hrs
  • Single Charge Battery Life: 48 hrs, 13 hrs, 7 hrs, 4 hrs, 2 hrs, 1hr
  • Options: Wall mount; additional batteries

  • Specification Sheets: View our Spec Sheet Here  

The Team:

Before joining Big Ass Solutions, Keith McKay spent seven years as an automotive technician. Existing handheld and area lights were a constant headache. They broke easily, used outdated technology and were either tethered to power cords or relied on underpowered batteries that produced a weak light.

When Keith started working at Big Ass, he realized that he could do better. He started researching on his own time, evaluating existing products and talking to American workers about what they wanted in a light. After six months, Keith enlisted the help of a small team of Big Ass Solutions' star engineers to create the brightest, toughest handheld light ever made. They brought the Big Ass Light Bar from concept to working prototype in just two years, often working through lunch and on weekends on this passion project.

What began as one man’s mission to build a light that gets the job done transformed into something more – a unique invention that sets a new quality standard for lighting technology.

Keith: Product Manager

When he's not busy dreaming up new products, you might find Keith playing ping-pong in the Big Ass break room.

Dan: Senior Electrical Engineer

Dan won the Mr. Kentucky Overall Bodybuilding title in 1998. Light Bar's ultimate strength test? Dan's biceps.

Kevin: Mechanical Engineer

We can always tell when Kevin is having a good time at one of our idea/beer drinking sessions because he starts turning a bright shade of red.

LeAnna: Electrical Engineer

Being a kick-ass engineer isn't enough for LeAnna. She also moonlights as a bartender at one of our favorite local watering holes. 

Brian: Senior Design Engineer 

When Brian isn't designing the baddest light around you can find him in the kitchen baking up a storm for his family and friends.

Jason: Electrical Engineering Team Lead

Want someone to design you a badass light? He's got it. Want someone to pour you a beer he brewed himself while you play with said light, he's got you again!

David: Mechanical Design Engineer 

David not only helped design this amazing light, he also designed and built his home.

Josh: Electrical Engineer 

In college, Josh sent experimental hardware to the International Space Station as part of a NASA project. He sent some satellites into orbit, too. No big.

FAQs:

How do I contact the campaign team?

We would love to speak with you about Big Ass Light Bar! Email me, Adam Bowe, at adam.bowe@bigasssolutions.com or call me at 844-863-2907.

Where does our product ship?

Big Ass Light Bar ships within the United States. We plan on certifying the product for worldwide shipment soon. 

What will I need to use my Big Ass Light Bar?

Big Ass Light Bar comes with everything you need to get started. Where you take it after that is up to you!

How do I check my order status? 

Contact Adam Bowe at adam.bowe@bigasssolutions.com with questions.
story_txt:
Introducing Big Ass Light BarThe most hardcore portable light ever made, Big Ass Light Bar features a water-resistant design, shock-absorbing components and chemical-resistant materials. And Light Bar's function matches its form – it is the brightest battery-powered LED work light ever created.Features     The World’s Most Versatile Handheld Area LightLight Bar was born in an auto shop, but it sure as hell doesn’t have to stay there. Whatever you do and wherever you go, Big Ass Light Bar will keep the lights on.
Auto Shops
Oil Rigs
Contractors
First Responders
Military and Police
Hiking and Camping
Bright-Ass LightFeaturing an output of up to 5,000 lumens, Light Bar’s light angle exceeds 180 degrees, illuminating entire areas — not just what’s in front of you. Six different brightness settings give you total control over the light output.(Practically) Everlasting LightWhen the sun goes down but the job isn’t finished, you need a light that will always turn on.Light Bar’s compact rechargeable battery provides up to 48 hours of continuous light, or up to 1.5 hours at maximum brightness. Easily swap out a spent battery for a charged one, and get back to business in a matter of seconds.Take It to Hell and BackAt Big Ass, we build things to last. That’s why we built Light Bar to exceed the most demanding standards imaginable, using components that will endure corrosion, drops and years of daily use.Light Bar is IP66 Rated to be insulated from dust and particulates, and is washdown-ready.Chemically resistant components stand up to diesel, gasoline, lubricants, penetrants (PB B’laster) and everything in — and under — the kitchen sinkThe overmolded battery, grip and end-piece absorb any blow, ensuring your light will always turn on when you need it.Intelligently DesignedWhether it’s in your hand or on a tool bench, Light Bar is designed to stay put. Its octagonal shape is roll-resistant and keeps the light stable on any surface, and the overmolded handle provides maximum grip when you take your light on the go. Tech Specs:

Length: 23.6 in

Width: 2 in

Weight: 3 lbs. 14 oz

Operating Voltage: Removable 14.4-volt battery with charge indicator; 100-125 VAC, 50/60 Hz

Operating Temperature: -4°F to 113°F (-20°C to 45°C)

Lumen Output: 80 lm, 500 lm, 850 lm, 1500 lm, 2800 lm, 5000 lm

CRI: 80+

CCT: 5000 K

Lifespan (L70): 60,000 hrs

Single Charge Battery Life: 48 hrs, 13 hrs, 7 hrs, 4 hrs, 2 hrs, 1hr

Options: Wall mount; additional batteries
Specification Sheets: View our Spec Sheet Here  
The Team:Before joining Big Ass Solutions, Keith McKay spent seven years as an automotive technician. Existing handheld and area lights were a constant headache. They broke easily, used outdated technology and were either tethered to power cords or relied on underpowered batteries that produced a weak light.When Keith started working at Big Ass, he realized that he could do better. He started researching on his own time, evaluating existing products and talking to American workers about what they wanted in a light. After six months, Keith enlisted the help of a small team of Big Ass Solutions' star engineers to create the brightest, toughest handheld light ever made. They brought the Big Ass Light Bar from concept to working prototype in just two years, often working through lunch and on weekends on this passion project.What began as one man’s mission to build a light that gets the job done transformed into something more – a unique invention that sets a new quality standard for lighting technology.Keith: Product ManagerWhen he's not busy dreaming up new products, you might find Keith playing ping-pong in the Big Ass break room.Dan: Senior Electrical EngineerDan won the Mr. Kentucky Overall Bodybuilding title in 1998. Light Bar's ultimate strength test? Dan's biceps.Kevin: Mechanical EngineerWe can always tell when Kevin is having a good time at one of our idea/beer drinking sessions because he starts turning a bright shade of red.LeAnna: Electrical EngineerBeing a kick-ass engineer isn't enough for LeAnna. She also moonlights as a bartender at one of our favorite local watering holes. Brian: Senior Design Engineer When Brian isn't designing the baddest light around you can find him in the kitchen baking up a storm for his family and friends.Jason: Electrical Engineering Team LeadWant someone to design you a badass light? He's got it. Want someone to pour you a beer he brewed himself while you play with said light, he's got you again!David: Mechanical Design Engineer David not only helped design this amazing light, he also designed and built his home.Josh: Electrical Engineer In college, Josh sent experimental hardware to the International Space Station as part of a NASA project. He sent some satellites into orbit, too. No big.FAQs:How do I contact the campaign team?We would love to speak with you about Big Ass Light Bar! Email me, Adam Bowe, at adam.bowe@bigasssolutions.com or call me at 844-863-2907.Where does our product ship?Big Ass Light Bar ships within the United States. We plan on certifying the product for worldwide shipment soon. What will I need to use my Big Ass Light Bar?Big Ass Light Bar comes with everything you need to get started. Where you take it after that is up to you!How do I check my order status? Contact Adam Bowe at adam.bowe@bigasssolutions.com with questions.

story:
Hello, my name is Sharon Bradford. I have been a paraplegic for 25 years. Because of the length of time I was in the wheelchair, I started to lose muscle in my legs and strength in my right arm.
The rehabilitation institute of Chicago (RIC) and my doctor suggested a stand-up wheelchair because it would be better for my health. One day a stand-up wheelchair company brought a stand-up wheelchair to my house to fit me for it. I was very excited to stand up for the first time in many years. Being motorized, it made me feel more independent than I had been for a long time. Unfortunately, I found out that my insurance company refused to cover the expenses. Getting this wheelchair will completely change my life.




Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
LiV is an indoor air quality monitoring device.

  • Use it in your living room
  • Use it to test the air quality in your bedroom
  • Use it in your greenhouse: higher levels of CO2 make plants grow bigger and faster 
  • Use it in your garage: gasoline and diesel engines give off large amounts of CO2
  • Use it in that small conference room at work


Carbon dioxide or CO2 is a good indicator of indoor air quality. Carbon dioxide is a natural component of air. By volume, dry air contains nitrogen, oxygen, argon, a small amount of carbon dioxide and even smaller quantities of other gases. The amount of CO2 in a given air sample is commonly expressed as parts per million (ppm). The outdoor air in most locations contains about 380 parts per million carbon dioxide.

Inside a building, people and plants are the main sources of CO2. Whenever we exhale, our lungs release CO2. Plants also release CO2 at night due to cellular respiration.

Higher levels of indoor CO2 indicate that not enough fresh air got into the building and consequently it is possible that other pollutant and allergenic agents such as Volatile Organic Compounds (e.g. formaldehyde) are also present in the air.  




The “heart” of LiV is a sensor expansion board that plugs into a Raspberry Pi. The “brain” of LiV consists of a set of Python scripts that use open source code contributed by the great Raspberry Pi developer community.

                  


That’s right, LiV is entirely open source: software and hardware! Even the case is open source: you can print it on your 3D printer!

                                 


LiV on gitHub   : software, hardware & case.  Download. Modify. Improve. Make Liv Yours.

story:
Every time we reach a specific milestone we’ll contribute our technology to a charitable tennis foundation, bringing tennis and education together to change lives.

Thank you for supporting TuringSense’s vision!

Tennis, throughout its centuries-old history, hasn’t fully harnessed the power of technology to elevate playing and training — until now! TuringSense created PIVOT to fill this gap. It’s the world’s first wearable for tennis with innovative multi-sensor, full body motion analysis that helps you master complex movements, avoid injuries, and best the competition. 

 

What’s more, PIVOT incorporates Hall of Fame coach Nick Bollettieri’s unique training techniques into its coaching system. Bollettieri has coached many leading players including Andre Agassi, Jim Courier, Monica Seles, Maria Sharapova, Jelena Janković, Sabine Lisicki, Sara Errani, Venus and Serena Williams, Martina Hingis, Anna Kournikova, Kei Nishikori, and Boris Becker.

 

PIVOT is a breakthrough in technology! While current products attach one sensor to a tennis racquet, PIVOT uses multiple sensors to recreate joint and body movements. You can master swings on the court and guard against injuries without wires or expensive cameras. Regardless of skill, PIVOT is going to take your game to a whole new level. It is truly a game changer!

Each player’s swing is unique. PIVOT understands your distinct movements and how you generated each swing. Its detailed bio-mechanics analysis and continuous comparison with your reference stroke lets you identify and improve specific factors of your game – factors even the naked eye can't see.
 

 

Enjoy Tennis Injury Free

The toughest moment for a player is an injury. But you can avoid injury, play longer, and recover from injury more quickly with proper technique. PIVOT actively studies your form and recognizes patterns that cause chronic injuries. It notifies you of improper technique AND shows you how to correct it.
 

Practice Anywhere and Review Results Instantaneously 

PIVOT is wireless and provides results instantaneously. Take it anywhere, anytime. Play on the court or practice your stroke at home. View your sessions in real-time or access them later.

 

 

No Camera: No Problem

We took mobility a step further. No cameras or expensive labs are needed. Coaches and parents don’t have to set up multiple cameras or be limited by recording angle. PIVOT is a completely natural and unrestricted way to record performance. You get an accurate 360 degree replay of every stroke.

 

Remote Coaching Made Possible  

With data in the cloud and instantly available on mobile devices, PIVOT makes possible accurate, convenient remote coaching. This means coaches can instantly view player performances and effectively provide feedback from a thousand miles away.

Cutting-Edge Sensors

PIVOT records full body movements by leveraging multiple 9-axis sensors and proprietary data capture software. Each sensor has an accelerometer, gyroscope, and magnetometer to process up to 1000 data samples per second. This means PIVOT will capture every one of your specific movements.

Mobile and Wireless

PIVOT’s sensors are extremely small and lightweight. Each sensor is the size of an acorn and weighs just as little. By using patented wireless and sensor fusion technology, the Hub sensor gathers and transmits the motion capture data to the cloud—all within a second.

Bio-mechanic Analysis

Our team of bio-mechanics experts, sport science coaches, and Nick Bollettieri have spent years understanding the complexities of human motion and its effects on athletic performance. The result: an advanced bio-mechanics analysis algorithm that translates raw data into a personalized assessment of technique and form. Our cloud infrastructure handles the heavy computing and data storage to bring the best analysis to you.

Don't just monitor your racquet, take a look and understand how your whole body impacts your swing. With PIVOT you get a complete analysis of your session in an easy to understand way. Get detailed statistics on footwork, body positioning, generation of power, and much more.

Motion Library

Our motion library is a key learning center with limitless possibilities. You can mark your favorite swing as your “signature” motion. While practicing the stroke, you get instant feedback and see a 3D comparison with the selected reference motion, all on your mobile device. We'll also be adding signature motions and teachings from professional players and coaches like Nick Bollettieri. Furthermore, with our open source platform, your coach can communicate and program these training lessons and guides for you.

Instantaneous Feedback

PIVOT helps you stay on top of your game by instantly transmitting results to your mobile device. Seconds after swinging, you and your coach will be able to view your movement and adjust your stroke accordingly. Set your signature motion and train your muscle memory with our instant visual and audio feedback. Feel the immediate gratification from our real time progress alerts when you finally achieve the correct stroke form that you practiced all day for!

3D Playback

PIVOT’s 3D playback is the result of our advanced motion capture technology. Replay any of your past swings at normal or slower speeds to truly understand your performance. Take advantage of a 360 degree viewing angle so you never miss any details again. 

December - New Harness Testing

January - Shipping

Our team is comprised of:

  • Seasoned and successful entrepreneurs with over 100 years of combined management experience
  • Hardware and firmware experts with manufacturing experience 
  • Biomechanics and algorithm experts in developing 3D full body motion capture and analysis 
  • App developers with experience in developing the simplest and easiest to use UI (user interface) 
  • Cloud experts to develop the infrastructure for mobility 
  • Athletes: Advanced tennis players (level 4.5 and above), golfers (single handicap), swimmers (division I college), martial artists (3rd degree black belts and higher)
  • Coaches: We are partnering with Nick Bollettieri which will give us a wealth of coaching techniques built into PIVOT

story:
Short Summary

Casey and Kaleb have qualified to attend US Quidditch Cup 9 in April! However, they are unable to receive assistance from the same source as the rest of their team. 

  • Casey began playing in Fall 2013. This is Casey's last season playing competitively.
  • Kaleb began playing in Fall 2014.
  • Both players are awesome agender people who do things. Good things.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • 100% of funds raised will go directly toward Kaleb and Casey's plane tickets to nationals.
  • The funds will be split 50/50 because this is a group effort and we don't want to leave anyone behind!

The Impact

The world needs more Kaleb and Casey at USQ nationals, and the world needs more sweets and dungeon-crawling. This campaign will make both happen in perfect harmony.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay!

  • Share this campaign far and wide!
  • Please include a personal note in your shares about how great they are and how you want them to go.

story:
Sunzee is a must-have for anyone spending time under the sun, whether doing extreme sports or plain day-to-day activities with your family.

 

SunZee is so user-friendly, any 5 year old can use it!
Simply squeeze out the exact amount you need using 2 fingers
and re-apply high quality sunscreen every 80 minutes.
To replace an empty capsule, simply slide in a new one.

Each capsule holds 3ml of sunscreen, enough for two full re-applications

 

 

 

The formula used in SunZee's sunscreen capsules is the same as in Safe Harbor Face & Neck 40 SPF. Check out their "IN THE NEWS" section for reviews. SunZee's sunscreen is specially formulated for outdoor activities:

 

SunZee Wristband and Neoprene case are a one time purchase with a two year warranty.

 

 

 

We have spent years researching and building countless prototypes in order to accomplish our mission to bring the best, most user-friendly, wearable sunscreen dispenser for the world to enjoy.   

We hope to make sun protection accessible and fun to use, solve an existing problem for millions of outdoor lovers and help educate millions more.

 

 

To date, SunZee has people across outdoor sporting communities excited. We are building a global network of affiliates around our common cause. Companies such as Disrupt Sports and Sea Surf Sun Surfing Academy, Helio follow KS UV tent and more are joining our efforts to build a global community around sun protection.

 

 

 

 

We want to say a special SunZee thank you to some of the many people who helped us along the way
 

 

 

Surely you know someone that needs better sun protection. Sharing is caring - Share SunZee with your friends and family!
story_txt:
Easily apply the exact amount of sunscreen to your face and neck to stay protected for hours more. SunZee is always in sight so you never forget and always within reach so it super easy to re-apply. The simple, single hand use means you can use it on-the-go during any activity

story:
IVY WILD Story Begins here...

Hey, Founder Sherine here...

IVY WILD is a hair products company based in Birmingham UK which caters for curly and kinky hair types Support us as we seek to bridge the diversity gap within the hair industry through products and education.

In 2012, I was part of an entrepreneurial store whilst at university studying Architectural Technology for my then hair extension business - Bonnie Lush. Through the years, I have gravitated towards the educational aspect of haircare and using my knowledge of the industry to make a positive impact. Influenced by my own experiences after suffering from traction alopecia, my frustrations of ill-health within the haircare industry and a lack of regulatory body in the UK has led me to transform the way hair is perceived, encouraging people to identify with hair type rather than race.

Our hair is made up of FOUR different hair types: Straight, Wavy, Curly and Kinky
THREE of these hair types have a curl pattern. What that means is, if you aren't curly yourself, you definitely know someone who is!
There are TWO issues with this:

1)The public waste money on products for their hair type
2)Not all professionals share the differences/similarities in hair types

By supporting this business you are:

  • Sherine has 4 years of experience that she is ready to invest in her startup company
  • Supporting Sherine as an individual who has started a company with a dream and passion for hair care that CARES about the direction of the entire hair industry. 
  • Contribute to the launch of our first hair products event.
  • Allow the business to experiment, trial and test new products that are made specifically for wavy, curly or kinky hair types.

What We Need & What You Get

£3000 to go towards:

  • The rollout of FOUR new additional products alongside our award-winning EDGE CONTROL
  • Our product launch party ('invite only' guestlist)
  • NEW packaging for all five products
  • Cosmetic Testing of our products
  • A new website design

Your support will be reciprocated with the opportunity to receive one of our attached product packages first. The choices include:

SETS:

DRENCH SET = HYDRATING SHAMPOO + MOISTURISING CONDITIONER

This bundle is a combination of our products guaranteed to repair your weak and damaged hair. 

FULL RANGE = HYDRATING SHAMPOO, MOISTURISING CONDITIONER + DAILY MOISTURISING LOTION + HEAT DEFENCE SPRAY + EDGE CONTROL

All products at an introductory price

THREE MONTH SUBSCRIPTION= HYDRATING SHAMPOO, MOISTURISING CONDITIONER + DAILY MOISTURISING LOTION + HEAT DEFENCE SPRAY + EDGE CONTROL 

Three-month subscription, all products sent to your door once a month for three months so you don't run out!

PRODUCTS:

EDGE CONTROL - infused with Castor oil

HEAT DEFENCE SPRAY - infused with Argan oil

HYDRATING SHAMPOO - infused with Argan oil

MOISTURISING CONDITIONER - infused with Argan oil

DAILY MOISTURISING LOTION - infused with Argan oil

TICKETS:

x1 Entry ticket to the private IVY WILD launch party with VIP guests including Influencers, Photographers, Entrepreneurs and more. 10% of your ticket will be donated to charity.

Our Impact

  • To transform and impact the hair industry in a positive way.
  • The main two areas of focus that we would like to influence are education on hair types within salons and professional establishments ensuring that ALL hair types are catered for, and encouraging more hairstylists within the black hair industry to register as a State Registered Hairdresser via the Hair Council.
  • To create educational opportunities for individuals and professionals within the hair industry
  • Sherine Walrond, founder of IVY WILD has featured on ITV BBC Three, Newstyle Radio, The Times, BBC WM and has hosted her own events centred around hair health & sisterhood

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

One of our challenges has been the entire rebrand of what used to be called Bonnie Lush and redirection in the interest of our clients and customers. Sherine had the brand Bonnie Lush since 2012 and realised that she needed to break a sentimental tie in order to create the brand Ivy Wild.

We aspire to reach more people all over the world with our products as well as expand our range.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone can contribute via our perks, however, if you would like to help in other ways, here's how you can help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Follow us on social media - @IVYWILDHAIR
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for reading and supporting!
story_txt:
IVY WILD Story Begins here...
Hey, Founder Sherine here...
IVY WILD is a hair products company based in Birmingham UK which caters for curly and kinky hair types Support us as we seek to bridge the diversity gap within the hair industry through products and education.
In 2012, I was part of an entrepreneurial store whilst at university studying Architectural Technology for my then hair extension business - Bonnie Lush. Through the years, I have gravitated towards the educational aspect of haircare and using my knowledge of the industry to make a positive impact. Influenced by my own experiences after suffering from traction alopecia, my frustrations of ill-health within the haircare industry and a lack of regulatory body in the UK has led me to transform the way hair is perceived, encouraging people to identify with hair type rather than race.

Our hair is made up of FOUR different hair types: Straight, Wavy, Curly and KinkyTHREE of these hair types have a curl pattern. What that means is, if you aren't curly yourself, you definitely know someone who is!There are TWO issues with this:
1)The public waste money on products for their hair type2)Not all professionals share the differences/similarities in hair types
By supporting this business you are:

Sherine has 4 years of experience that she is ready to invest in her startup company
Supporting Sherine as an individual who has started a company with a dream and passion for hair care that CARES about the direction of the entire hair industry. 
Contribute to the launch of our first hair products event.
Allow the business to experiment, trial and test new products that are made specifically for wavy, curly or kinky hair types.


What We Need & What You Get
£3000 to go towards:

The rollout of FOUR new additional products alongside our award-winning EDGE CONTROL
Our product launch party ('invite only' guestlist)
NEW packaging for all five products
Cosmetic Testing of our products
A new website design

Your support will be reciprocated with the opportunity to receive one of our attached product packages first. The choices include:
SETS:
DRENCH SET = HYDRATING SHAMPOO + MOISTURISING CONDITIONER
This bundle is a combination of our products guaranteed to repair your weak and damaged hair. 
FULL RANGE = HYDRATING SHAMPOO, MOISTURISING CONDITIONER + DAILY MOISTURISING LOTION + HEAT DEFENCE SPRAY + EDGE CONTROL
All products at an introductory price
THREE MONTH SUBSCRIPTION= HYDRATING SHAMPOO, MOISTURISING CONDITIONER + DAILY MOISTURISING LOTION + HEAT DEFENCE SPRAY + EDGE CONTROL 
Three-month subscription, all products sent to your door once a month for three months so you don't run out!

PRODUCTS:
EDGE CONTROL - infused with Castor oil
HEAT DEFENCE SPRAY - infused with Argan oil
HYDRATING SHAMPOO - infused with Argan oil
MOISTURISING CONDITIONER - infused with Argan oil
DAILY MOISTURISING LOTION - infused with Argan oil
TICKETS:
x1 Entry ticket to the private IVY WILD launch party with VIP guests including Influencers, Photographers, Entrepreneurs and more. 10% of your ticket will be donated to charity.

Our Impact

To transform and impact the hair industry in a positive way.
The main two areas of focus that we would like to influence are education on hair types within salons and professional establishments ensuring that ALL hair types are catered for, and encouraging more hairstylists within the black hair industry to register as a State Registered Hairdresser via the Hair Council.
To create educational opportunities for individuals and professionals within the hair industry
Sherine Walrond, founder of IVY WILD has featured on ITV BBC Three, Newstyle Radio, The Times, BBC WM and has hosted her own events centred around hair health & sisterhood


Risks & Challenges
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.
One of our challenges has been the entire rebrand of what used to be called Bonnie Lush and redirection in the interest of our clients and customers. Sherine had the brand Bonnie Lush since 2012 and realised that she needed to break a sentimental tie in order to create the brand Ivy Wild.
We aspire to reach more people all over the world with our products as well as expand our range.


Other Ways You Can Help
We appreciate that not everyone can contribute via our perks, however, if you would like to help in other ways, here's how you can help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Follow us on social media - @IVYWILDHAIR
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for reading and supporting!

story:
Most sanitizers dry out your hands, leave your hands sticky, and smelling like harsh chemicals.

 

 

But what if sanitizer left your hands feeling soft & silky?

 

 

 

 

Killing 99.9% of germs has never been this fresh.

At Dr. Shultz's we believe that sanitizer and staying clean should uplift your mood. A pump delivers the perfect amount as the delicate and subtle smell of fresh neroli revitalizes you.

 

 

In a nutshell, it's better all around.

 

 

 
 

 

We designed Dr.Shultz's to fit into your lifestyle. Whether you’re grabbing a quick bite, just pumped gas, or shook the gross coworker's hand, Shultz has the best solution for sanitizing your hands, leaving you, and your hands refreshed. 

 

 

 

 

 We are Val & Ian, a team of highly-dedicated designers, marketers, product developers, and entrepreneurs whose goal is to produce everyday products that make people’s lives better.

Our team is made up of two core members: Valentin Garkov and Ian Moore. As children, the two of us were friends and dreamers. As we grew up, not much changed, though we began creating more frequently. We took different paths to get to where we are today, but our unique interests in design, manufacturing, advertisement, video, entrepreneurship, occasional idiocy, and crowdfunding have prepared us to take on this unique opportunity.

 

 


 

Dr. Shultz Hated Regular Hand Sanitizer.

Dr. Shultz stopped using hand sanitizer because it dried his hands so bad, becoming an unpleasantly unfresh version of himself: "The Germ". He reinvented sanitizer with the secret formula to get the job done by killing 99.9% of bacteria, all while leaving your hands feeling and smelling great with essential oils. Fight your germ with the Doc's secret formula. Freshen up.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We have a problem - only 9% of the plastic waste in the US is recycled.

 

 

So we rethought it, and figured glass bottles are better.

We give you free product for sending back our bottles.

 

 

By saving three Shultz bottles and sending them back, we keep the world a little cleaner together.

 

     

     

     


     

    We love spreading the freshness! Contact sales@docshultz.com for more info.

story:
Hi my name is Kristy Lockhart and my best friend has been diagnosed with Lyme Disease. It took her years and 50 doctors to finally recieve a proper diagnosis.
I wish to do everything I can to help her. This is a desperate plea to everybody to please help me financially get her back to the U.S.A for another round of treatment.
In Canada proper testing and treatment are not available. The majority of people with Lyme disease are misdiagnosed for years and by the time it is discovered it is almost too late.
The very first visit to the USA that day cost me $1500. Thanks to YOU and your generous donations I was able to provide this for Heather. Monthly treatment (not including her antibiotics) suggested from the lyme doctor is hundreds of dollars on potent specialized probiotics that have to be special ordered, certain vitamins and minerals, supplements as well as a very strict NO yeast/gluten/wheat/yeast/sugar diet. Everyday she has to also juice a variety of greens so her body can absorb the nutrients properly. One teaspoon of sugar/honey/sweetner/etc can suppress Heather's immune system for 6 hours. Also she recieves treatment as well from a wonderful Lyme literate Naturopath.

4 years ago she had a gym membership, walked 5 miles a day, hiked, spent time in nature, and constantly doing photo shoots. Now, she can't walk more than 20 minutes, becomes so fatigued far too quickly, has difficulty breathing, chest pains, migraines, her joints swell up so bad she can't write or type, difficulty folding laundry, doing dishes and playing with her cat. Something in her body is malfunctioning as her entire body is covered in edema. This far into her treatment though has reduced some of these symptoms. So it is very important for her treatment to continue.

 Heather means everything to me. I can't put into words how much I love her. She is an amazing artist/photographer (www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl) and a genuine pure soul and there's nothing I won't do for her. Meeting someone like this only happens once in a lifetime, and I fear her lifetime will be over soon if her medical treatment is unable to continue.

Donating to this compaign will ensure proper medical care and treatment and lodging while undergoing this care. It doesn't matter if it's $1 or $1000 every little bit helps. Even if you have no $ to donate, please will you post this on various social networking tools to spread the word?

Even while ill, both she and I helped out with other fundraisers (Rideau Valley Wildlife Sanctuary) by donating hundreds of dollars worth of her art to be sold to help treat injured wildlife. She went to college to learn how to take care of the disabled, now she is disabled.

She left home at 15 and she has no blood relatives who can help her, and she hasn't worked for the last 3 years due to being so ill. I am a single woman and the ONLY person who has been helping her for years, please can you help me help her?
My best friend, Heather, has seen 50 doctors in the last 4 years (including 3 neurosurgeons, infectious disease doctors, rheumetologists, dermotologists, neurologists) which she was left with no definitive answers as to the root cause of all her symptoms, until now. Lyme disease, if not detected in the early stages becomes chronic lyme and ends up attacking the heart, kidneys and liver.

We are givers and this is very hard to ask for help. To prove this, for certain denominations I will print and mail to you your choices from Heather's photography gallery. If you love wildlife and nature or creative works combining the beautiful female form with nature, you are sure to love Heather King's artwork.
Please do not place an order through RedBubble as you will be charged for the prints and you have already generously donated to this campaign. Please use Redbubble as a gallery and email me directly what prints you would like. Any questions or for a list of the prints you would like, please email me here lockhart_ottawa@hotmail.com

I promise you if you were to meet Heather you would love her almost as much as I do. I have never met another soul with such an enormous loving heart as hers.
Please helps us
love
Kristy

story:
Bernadette "Nadet" Dolipas is a dear friend, classmate, colleague and family. Rather rudely and totally unexpected, she was told she had stage 4 cancer of the lungs early October 2013 (a few days ago). 

Nadet is a community leader and has a passion for helping other people in need. Her latest cause is helping Cordillera achieve food security and people empowerment through the collective promotion and development of sustainable agriculture. 

As her friends and family, we would like to help her in turn. We are aiming to raise funds towards the cost of her cancer treatments including chemotherapy, medicines and others. The doctors estimate that the total cost of treatment would be PHP 600,000. This would pay for the hospital costs, doctors' professional fees and medicines.

It would also be helpful to get the word out about this campaign. Please share this link in your facebook, twitter, email groups, friends. There are share tools in this fund raising site that you can also use.

Thank you everyone. 

==

By the way, friends of Nadet (from Anido, San Jose, SLU Med School, and work) who are based here have been meeting recently. Napagkaisahan to hold a series of activities din. First of which will be a dinner on October 26, 5-9 PM to be spearheaded by her San Jose batchmates. Whoever is in Baguio then, see you at the City High Auditorium. 

==

More on Nadet:

  * She was one of the founders/organizers of the UP Anido, a regional organization for Cordilleran students based in UP Diliman.

  * She was a Psychology student, stayed in Kalayaan Dorm batch 91. She was active in UP politics and she was affiliated with both ISA and SAMASA.

==

(Reposting from Imelda Tabiando) Bernadette Dolipas-Capuyan is a down to earth and passionate person. She is a community organizer of the Montanosa Research and Development Center (MRDC) serving the oppressed and poor people in the interior communities of the Cordillera. Recently, her doctors diagnosed her with stage 4 lung cancer. For many who ask if she is a smoker kaya siya nagkacancer, the answer is NO; she does not smoke, most probably, she got the illness from second hand smoke or due to her genetic predisposition. Let us support her in her fight against cancer. Help us raise funds for her chemotherapy, other medical expenses and needs. Friends, her family and we are sponsoring a "DINNER FOR NADET" on October 26, 2013 at the Baguio City National High School Auditorium from 5pm to 9pm. Tickets are from Php300.00-Php 1,000.00. For tickets, kindly send us a message. Thank you.
