story:
My name is Michael Shaw. I am a 20 year fitness professional and the owner of New York Personal Training. In short, I have dedicated my life to creating superior fitness and nutrition programs as a means to improve the quality of life for anyone who is willing to learn. Recently, as the result of an Achilles tendon injury, I was forced to give up my passion – competing as an amateur triathlete. Inactivity being an impossibility, I hit the books determined to create a challenging training program that was productive for me (a 45 year old who still believes his best years lie ahead) as well as anyone else who chooses to reward their gift of life with 100% commitment to living it. In the end I created a system so powerful and revolutionary that its initial success inspired me to create a virtual training studio (VTS) that will allow me to touch lives of people from all walks of life, all over the world.

In addition to making physical fitness available to virtually anyone with an internet connection or mobile device, the VTS creates a career opportunity for an international pool of personal trainers. Thus, enabling me to touch the lives of the dedicated fitness community, of which I have proudly been a representative for two decades.

The World Health Organization reports that:

·  Worldwide obesity has nearly doubled since 1980.

·  In 2008, more than 1.4 billion adults, 20 and older, were overweight. Of these over 200 million men and nearly 300 million women were obese.

·  35% of adults aged 20 and over were overweight in 2008, and 11% were obese.

·  65% of the world's population live in countries where overweight and obesity kills more people than underweight.

·  More than 40 million children under the age of five were overweight in 2011.

·  Obesity is preventable.

The main obstacle isn’t gym equipment. It isn’t willingness to exercise and eat right. It isn’t even socio-economic. The biggest hurdle to overcome for most of the world’s citizens is a lack of access to reliable information. As  with almost everything, education is the great liberator. In the words of one of my heroes, Anthony Robbins, “If you want to be successful, find someone who has achieved the results you want and copy what they do and you'll achieve the same results.” The VTS affords us the opportunity to be the model that millions of people may copy. It allows us to fulfill our privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to change lives with our gift. Your contribution will help us help countless people, not just today, but for years to come.

How will your funds be used?  Why do we need $500,000?

The VTS must recreate the client experience of our brick & mortar studio. This begins with the intake of information. Programs must be written that give value to participant’s answers, tag them within a specific category, and then assign them the proper training and nutrition program. The nutrition program must be segmented for different regions and food customs. For each trainer in the VTS we must create a text and video documentation of every exercise in their 16 week program. The program then needs to be segmented into 48 “Workouts of the Day,” or “WOD’s.” Additionally, a CRM (customer relationship management) program must be created to stay in constant contact with each person who visits the VTS. The CRM interfaces with the Social Media management team, who creates local, regional, national, and international communities in which participants can engage each other, ask and answer questions, share experiences, and celebrate their success. Finally, or actually initially, we must get the word out – create campaigns and affiliations that let the world know we exist.

The project will initiate immediately, making use of funds as they are raised. Any costs exceeding the amount raised in this campaign will be funded privately. As with any worthwhile campaign, participation should be rewarded. In the spirit of our initiative we want you to reap all of the benefits of great health and fitness. Donations will be rewarded with VTS passes ranging from 1 month to lifetime.  Imagine – you get to help people all over the world AND gain access to the best trainers in the world. It’s the ultimate Win-Win!

About Michael Shaw:

Driven by his commitment to innovative training and a dynamic entrepreneurial spirit, Michael Shaw has been thinking outside the box and constantly re-defining the parameters of personal fitness since launching his career in 1993 as a part time personal trainer at New Jersey based Cross Training Fitness Studio. Shaw later purchased CTFS in 1998. In 2003 Mr. Shaw founded New York Personal Training with a dual mission of creating an environment in which each candidate could feel inspired, and each trainer could hone their craft and thrive. As expert fitness professionals, NYPT committed to providing superior individualized programming to fitness enthusiasts of all ages and backgrounds. 11 years later NYPT is one of the most sought after training facilities on the east coast.

Mr. Shaw’s other accolades include competing as an amateur bodybuilder; 2ndplace 1997 Mario Strong Eastern Regional, 4thplace 1997 Mr. Universe Amateur; completing four Spartan races; and raising thousands of dollars for Lymphoma and Leukemia research by participating in and completing the 2012 and 2013 NYC Aquaphor Triathlon as a member of the fundraising organization Team in Training.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your contribution is appreciated…whether it be dollars or time. Please share our mission with your social network.– Share our mission on your Facebook page and post it to the New York Personal Training Page (you have to “Like” the New York Personal Training Facebook page first), and we will reward you with a one month pass to the VTS.

video documentation of every exercise in their 16 week program. The program

Additionally, a CRM (customer relationship management) program must be created
to stay in constant contact with each person who visits the VTS. The CRM
interfaces with the Social Media management team, who creates local, regional,
national, and international communities in which participants can engage each
other, ask and answer questions, share experiences, and celebrate their
success. Finally, or actually initially, we must get the word out – create campaigns
and affiliations that let the world know we exist.
The project will initiate immediately,
making use of funds as they are raised. Any costs exceeding the amount raised
in this campaign will be funded privately. As with any worthwhile campaign,
participation should be rewarded. In the spirit of our initiative we want you
to reap all of the benefits of great health and fitness. Donations will be
rewarded with VTS passes ranging from 1 month to lifetime.  Imagine – you get to help people all over the
world AND gain access to the best trainers in the world. It’s the ultimate Win-Win!
About Michael Shaw:
Driven
by his commitment to innovative training and a dynamic entrepreneurial spirit, Michael Shaw has been thinking
outside the box and constantly re-defining the parameters of personal fitness
since launching his career in 1993 as a part time personal trainer at New
Jersey based Cross Training Fitness Studio. Shaw later purchased CTFS in 1998.
In 2003 Mr. Shaw founded New York Personal Training with a dual mission of
creating an environment in which each candidate could feel inspired, and each
trainer could hone their craft and thrive. As expert fitness professionals, NYPT
committed to providing superior individualized programming to fitness
enthusiasts of all ages and backgrounds. 11 years later NYPT is one of the most
sought after training facilities on the east coast.
Mr.
Shaw’s other accolades include competing as an amateur bodybuilder; 2ndplace 1997 Mario Strong Eastern
Regional, 4thplace
1997 Mr. Universe Amateur; completing four Spartan races; and raising thousands
of dollars for Lymphoma and Leukemia research by participating in and
completing the 2012 and 2013 NYC Aquaphor Triathlon as a member of the
fundraising organization Team in Training.
Other
Ways You Can Help
Your contribution is appreciated…whether it be
dollars or time. Please share our mission with your social network.– Share our
mission on your Facebook page and post it to the New York Personal Training
Page (you have to “Like” the New York Personal Training Facebook page first),
and we will reward you with a one month pass to the VTS.

story:
Last year I was diagnosed with breast cancer.  I was very lucky that it had not spread to my lymph nodes. I had a double mastectomy and in the process of this year of surgeries and chemo my fiance left me.     

I am moving on with my life.  I have very much wanted to have a family for a very long time.  I am unable to have a child and plan to adopt from foster care.  There is a four year old little girl who I would like to adopt and this is moving very fast!  

I am currently paying off what insurance did not cover which is about $10,000. I do not have money to make necessary repairs to my front deck and back yard which are both unsafe.  These need to be done asap so that I can pass a home study.   

 I need help to make this dream come true.  

You can help make two dreams come true.  A child to have a safe and loving adoptive home and for me to provide that space for a child.

Please share this with anyone who can help!

Thank you!

story:
In our day and age there is still a heavy social stigma on those that suffer from mental illness, and more so in our part of the world. The Tijani Al Mahi Psychiatric Hospital in Omdurman, Sudan, which was established in 1971, is largest hospital in the country that provides mental health diagnosis, treatment and counseling to hundreds of patients; and they need your help!

My uncle Al Tijani Al Mahi, was one of the forefathers of psychiatry in Africa and his wish was to provide the necessary diagnosis, treatment and counseling to mental health patients across the country and to chip away at the taboo which still haunts perception of mental illness patients.

I am currently working with my mother, and other family members to collect funds that will solely be used to by necessary medicine and supplies for patients at the hospital. 

Every EUR 100 helps us buy medicine that covers the needs of 10 patients for a month!!! With your help we hope to raise EUR 1,000 that can cover the needs for these ten patients for a year!  

Every pound, dollar or euro that you can spare means allot to us and will also make sure to send a brief report and some pictures once we have a chance to disburse your kind support. If you have any questions please feel free to email me at any time!

-------------

My Name is Hussam El Tayeb and I am currently based out of Frankfurt, Germany

story:
Mom's Heartbreaking Battle with Cancer

The “World's Best Mom” is facing the fight of her life.  Our mom, Cheryl Swanson, has always given the best of herself to everyone.  But now, at the sweet age of 66, her life has taken a turn for the worst. 

Just a couple months ago, Mom had respiratory problems, which her family doctor had diagnosed as pneumonia.  She was given antibiotics, but she did not improve.  When she returned to the doctor he ordered an x-ray, followed by a CT scan.  He found a couple suspicious areas on her lung and her liver.  He referred her to a lung specialist, who then referred her to an oncologist.  The oncologist performed a biopsy on her liver, which confirmed the heartbreaking news that our mom had stage IV small cell lung cancer (the most aggressive type).  This included a large tumor in her right lung, two smaller ones in her left lung, numerous tumors throughout her liver, and had also spread to her lymph nodes and adrenal glands. 

The oncologist informed her that without chemotherapy she would only have three days to three weeks to live.  Overwhelmed by the fear of not seeing her children again, she believed that chemo would be her only chance.  Within the hour she received her first chemo treatment.  After four days of extreme pain and sickness, our father rushed her to the hospital where she stayed in ICU for almost a week.  Her oncologist informed us that there was really nothing else they could do and sent her home to die.  But we were NOT giving up …

As soon as we learned of our Mom’s diagnosis, my sister and brother rushed to Arizona from Michigan and I flew out from Hawaii.  Mom looked like she only had hours left to live; pale white, could barely breathe or move, and so very thin!  She regained her spirit knowing that we were all here.  I came here on a mission and with a plan to use natural alternative cancer treatments to save our Mom’s life. 

We brought Mom home from ICU and immediately began in-home cancer treatments.  She felt so much better being at home with us.  We wanted to get Mom into the Gerson Clinic in Mexico, but could not afford the $16,000 cost for the three-week treatment.  Instead, we decided to try to implement the Gerson therapy at home.  It has been difficult to follow the Gerson therapy as completely as is done in the clinic. Our daily treatment regimine consists of as many fresh carrot juices as we can get her to drink, many coffee enemas, lots of organic raw foods, and daily intravenous injections of B-17 (laetrile).  Although Mom has improved somewhat, she still has a long tough road ahead. 

It’s very difficult for us to ask for financial help.  We don't expect you to feel sorry for Mom or our family, but this has been a shock to us all and has left us in a very desperate situation.  Dad has quickly used up his small savings and is now facing possible bankruptcy.  He and Mom have been barely surviving on their small monthly checks.  Their financial situation has caused them great distress, and now this horrible reality we have been faced with is more than we can bear. 

Feeling like a financial burden raises Mom's stress level, which negatively affects her healing, and has caused Dad much emotional distress.  Myself, my sister, and my brother were all struggling financially before we left our homes to come out here.  We have now been here about three weeks, dedicating ourselves fully to saving Mom's life.  This has completely drained our financial resources, leaving us no other options.  That's why we need your help. 

Always giving of herself and deeply concerned of others, Mom feels guilty receiving help, no matter how desperate the situation.  She is trying to keep her positive spirit through all of this, even during her coffee enemas and carrot juices.  As soon as she is able, Mom hopes to be able to help others in desperate situations ... but now she needs your help.

What We Need

  • Mom's hospital bills and medical expenses (not covered by Medicare)
  • Home treatment supplies and equipment
  • Home health care nurse (when we are not able to be here)
  • Expenses involved in order for us to be here, away from our homes and jobs
  • Gerson Clinic (when we exceed our campaign goal)
  • Airline miles (send email to: RobinRae11@gmail.com)

How YOU Can Help

Please donate whatever you are able.  Every little bit will be deeply appreciated.  Some of the funding we receive over our campaign goal will be used to help others in similar situations.  We are all about paying it forward! 

We totally understand if you are not able to donate at this time, but you can still help in a BIG way.  Please post the link to this campaign (found at the top of the page) on your Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other social networks.  You could also send the link with a brief message to your email contacts.  You are a lifesaving ANGEL for Mom no matter how small the action! 

Our family sends the deepest gratitude from the bottom of our hearts and we send many blessings of health and happiness.  Namaste'

**ATTENTION: We are aware that there many scams by people who post phoney fundraiser campaigns, and we want to do everything possible to assure you that our mom's story is true.  If you are skeptical or concerned in any way, please send me an email at RobinRae11@gmail.com  I will provide you my direct contact info and any necessary verification of our mom's cancer diagnosis.  Also be reassured that ALL funds will be used ONLY for the purposes listed above.

story:
Achieve Better Posture with Zami Life

                          



A big thanks to everyone for supporting our Indiegogo ‪Crowdfunding‬ campaign. We more than tripled our goal raising a whopping $110, 450 in two months! We didn't know quite what to expect but after sleepless nights and hard work, Indiegogo enabled us to validated the ‪Zami Life‬ concept and products. This is the beauty of crowdfunding - a way to get a product off the ground and into the hands of people around the world. We want to thank Indiegogo  and YOU for all the support.

We are still offering savings in the Pre-Order stage InDemand.  Check them out and continue to support Zami Life!

Thanks,

The Zami Team


                                                               
                                        So... Why is Zami so good for my health?



"Zami is not just your regular stool. Use your Zami for especially, designed Zami exercises and stretches!"





Why We Created the Zami Stools





What does the Zami stool actually do for my spine? Here are some scans from the Diers scans that were the result of someone sitting on a regular chair, compared to a Zami stool. The natural protectiveS-curve in the spine that we have when we stand is the same as when we sit n a Zami stool.


The Products

Zami Essential Stool - Promoting Good Posture

Wood

This truly organic design represents natural beauty at its finest. The wooden Zami is made of the highest quality natural pressed wood. Knowing that wood designs can be difficult to match your interior, we provide three options ready for you to select: beech, walnut and oak. 

               


Zami is the solution for sitting problems, arising from working long hours behind screens. Zami is essential for your health, improving your posture and strengthening core muscles. Medical research has proven that active sitting is key to digestion and lowering your cholesterol levels. The Zami stool and its patented form are all developed to support active sitting.

We will connect closer to shipping so you can let us know if you want the beech, oak or walnut. 

The Zami Essential Zami designs come in wood and aluminum. The design features a unique patented double convex form. 

 


Zami Smart – The Best Solution for Active Sitting

Zami Smart Stool is the result of years of research on ergonomics and is designed to improve posture and promote active sitting. Made from the highest quality European sourced materials, this patented, double-convex form is the first sensor-enabled stool that gives you real-time feedback on your posture. The stool communicates to the Zami mobile app and collects data providing intelligent feedback and insight into your posture and daily sitting habits. Unlike most ergonomic solutions, Zami provides a sense of luxury and simplicity and looks great in any home or work interior.


After an initial short setup to determine your weight and other vital metrics, pressure sensors in each of the four legs determine your weight distribution and accurately determine your posture. This information is transmitted via Bluetooth to the Zami mobile app, which gives you immediate feedback about how to correct your posture. 

Utilizing the sensors, the mobile app also provides you information about your sitting, including:

  • The time spent sitting (active and passive)
  • Quality of sitting (posture) and exercises to improve your daily sitting habits
  • Behavior during sitting (restless sitting or fidgeting, potential pressure point issues, etc.)
  • Calorie Expenditures
Details

Height: 52cm (20.5 inches) Length: 51cm (20inches)  Width: 38cm  (15 inches) Weight: 5.1 kg      

The Zami Smart Stool has coated black steel and oak wood legs, and a genuine European sourced leather cushion seat. There is also a foot rest so is a great height for anyone.


The Zami App – Connected to Zami Smart

You will receive immediate feedback from the app if you are not sitting right, not taking appropriate breaks or are sitting too long. The app also comes with suggested exercises and general healthy lifestyle suggestions. The long-term goal is to integrate Zami Life products with various other health and fitness options to give a complete picture of your health and lifestyle, providing an integrated experience.

      


The Zami app will track your sitting history, allowing you to get an overview about your sitting. This information can be presented to your physician when you need to do a post-facto analysis or plan for sitting and posture improvement that can be monitored along the way.


The Team

Zami is a self-funded company from the  town of Arnhem, Netherlands. Orthopedic Surgeon Piete Van Loon and Designer Ruud-Jan Kokke  created the Zami as a solution to sitting related back pain prevalent in todays society.


Zami Life Chief Mobility Advisor


Meet our Chief Mobility Advisor, Dana Santas! As an International health and wellness expert and the creator of Radius Yoga, Dana has dedicated her career to helping people move, breathe and feel better. She’s the yoga expert for CNN Health as well as the sports performance mobility trainer for numerous teams and athletes in MLB, NHL, NBA, NFL, PGA and WTA.   


     


“The symmetry correction, in conjunction with the facilitation of the natural lumbar curve has a profound impact on restoring functional diaphragm use for better breathing quality." -Dana Santas







Zami Life in the Press

               


Support us to further revolutionize sitting


Corporate Partners 

   

Together we can create work environments that are health conscious, socially responsible, and integrate modern design.

In modern society most people spend the majority of their day sitting behind a desk and computer-screen. Passive sitting for prolonged periods takes a toll on our health, leading to a vast array of health problems - including back pain. Work related losses from back pain are estimated to cost U.S. employers well over $100 billion each year (Phillips, Slosar, Youssef, & Andersson, 2013).

Extensive research has also shown that sitting in regular office chairs - even ergonomically designed chairs – does not promote good posture. In contrast, the Zami design reduces the amount of (your body's) surface area that comes in contact with the stool – without a backrest or armrests – and enables your body to effortlessly give way to its center of gravity and optimal posture.

                    

As an employer, it is important to promote a healthy work environment. With Zami, companies can correct problems associated with poor posture and inactivity in the workplace, and thus improve morale and increase productivity. Since employees can share (and compare) real time feedback about their posture, the Zami Smart mobile app can not only be used to foster teamwork and establish organizational culture, but the information can be presented to one's physician or HR department to track and verify posture improvement. Offering employees the opportunity to be a part of something new, innovative, and most importantly that will improve their health, is also a great way to attract the best talent to your team.

The Zami Smart Stool is the world’s first smart stool – and now companies have the opportunity to be an active part of 'The Future of Sitting.' See our Corporate Partner Smart Bundle. 

For more information on creating a custom Corporate Partner Smart Bundle, contact us at info@zamilife.com.

                                     



Health Benefits of Zami

The health benefits of sitting on a Zami design stool vs. a regular chair include:

  •   Enhances posture immediately upon sitting
  •   Trains muscles to maintain proper posture
  •   Decreases back pain and injury risk
  •   Encourages circulation, minimizing edema and varicose veins
  •   Increases ability to breathe
  •   Strengthens pelvic floor function 
  •   Lessens physical and mental stress


The Science behind Zami

The science behind Zami's health benefits comes from the chair’s patented double convex design and narrow sitting surface, which:

  • Immediately aligns pelvis in neutral position to facilitate natural curves of spine
  • Requires proper kinetic muscle chain firing and neuromuscular feedback to        maintain posture
  • Demands 360 degrees of integrated core muscle activation for stabilization 
  • Promotes “active” sitting and movement of legs around wide, open base for    enhanced circulation and decreased lower-body lethargy
  • Positions diaphragm’s attachment to lumbar spine and ribcage for optimal  respiratory and postural function 
  • Sets pelvis symmetrically, aligning the diaphragm and pelvic floor for  synchronous function
  • Restores neuromuscular efficiency of proper skeletal alignment to eliminate   compensatory muscular tension; initiates functional diaphragmatic breathing to mitigate the stress response, lowering heart rate, blood pressure and cortisol  (stress hormone) production

INDIEGOGO REFERRAL PROGRAM

Thank you for supporting Zami Life. We are as excited as you to create beautiful, healthy and innovative products.

Please take a few minutes to help us spread the word through email and social media, and earn referral rewards.  

Here’s how it works:

You earn $50 in Zami credit towards our campaign every time one of your referrals purchases a Zami! The amount of credit you can earn is unlimited!

Once the campaign is over, we will apply this credit to your account, giving you a refund off your purchase OR credit on the purchase of a new Zami Wood, Aluminum or Smart.

Example

If 5 of your friends purchase a Zami then you will be credited $250!

YES, that’s right… you can get yourself a free Zami Essential by sharing our campaign!

Find out how to get started by clicking HERE or at the bottom of the page to read how to use your unique code to be apart of our referral rewards program!


Our sincere thanks for your support – The Zami Team

In contrast, the Zami design reduces the amount of (your body's) surface area that comes in contact with the stool – without a backrest or armrests – and enables your body to effortlessly give way to its center of gravity and optimal posture.
                    
As an employer, it is important to promote a healthy work environment. With Zami, companies can correct problems associated with poor posture and inactivity in the workplace, and thus improve morale and increase productivity. Since employees can share (and compare) real time feedback about their posture, the Zami Smart mobile app can not only be used to foster teamwork and establish organizational culture, but the information can be presented to one's physician or HR department to track and verify posture improvement. Offering employees the opportunity to be a part of something new, innovative, and most importantly that will improve their health, is also a great way to attract the best talent to your team.
The Zami Smart Stool is the world’s first smart stool – and now companies have the opportunity to be an active part of 'The Future of Sitting.' See our Corporate Partner Smart Bundle. 
For more information on creating a custom Corporate Partner Smart Bundle, contact us at info@zamilife.com.
                                     



Health Benefits of Zami
The health benefits of sitting on a Zami design stool vs. a regular chair include:



  Enhances posture immediately upon sitting


  Trains muscles to maintain proper posture


  Decreases back pain and injury risk


  Encourages circulation, minimizing edema and varicose veins


  Increases ability to breathe


  Strengthens pelvic floor function 


  Lessens physical and mental stress



The Science behind Zami
The science behind Zami's health benefits comes from the chair’s patented double convex design and narrow sitting surface, which:



Immediately aligns pelvis in neutral position to facilitate natural curves of spine

Requires proper kinetic muscle chain firing and neuromuscular feedback to        maintain posture
Demands 360 degrees of integrated core muscle activation for stabilization 

Promotes “active” sitting and movement of legs around wide, open base for    enhanced circulation and decreased lower-body lethargy


Positions diaphragm’s attachment to lumbar spine and ribcage for optimal  respiratory and postural function 


Sets pelvis symmetrically, aligning the diaphragm and pelvic floor for  synchronous function

Restores neuromuscular efficiency of proper skeletal alignment to eliminate   compensatory muscular tension; initiates functional diaphragmatic breathing to mitigate the stress response, lowering heart rate, blood pressure and cortisol  (stress hormone) production



INDIEGOGO REFERRAL PROGRAM
Thank you for supporting Zami Life. We are as excited as you to create beautiful, healthy and innovative products.
Please take a few minutes to help us spread the word through email and social media, and earn referral rewards.  
Here’s how it works:
You earn $50 in Zami credit towards our campaign every time one of your referrals purchases a Zami! The amount of credit you can earn is unlimited!
Once the campaign is over, we will apply this credit to your account, giving you a refund off your purchase OR credit on the purchase of a new Zami Wood, Aluminum or Smart.
Example
If 5 of your friends purchase a Zami then you will be credited $250!
YES, that’s right… you can get yourself a free Zami Essential by sharing our campaign!
Find out how to get started by clicking HERE or at the bottom of the page to read how to use your unique code to be apart of our referral rewards program!



Our sincere thanks for your support – The Zami Team

story:
Medical Mission trip to Kenya, Africa

For those who don't know, after almost 20 years in the banking industry, I decided to pursue a different career path. This month I am finishing up my first year in the RN nursing program at Palm Beach State College in Lake Worth, Florida. Earlier this year, my mom, who has been a nurse for almost 50 years, decided to take part in a medical mission trip to Kenya. My school schedule is allowing me to join her. 

The trip we are going on is organized by Global Village Ministries. This accredited non-profit organization hosts three trips a year to Kenya. They also assist in the operation of a year round shelter called Olmalaika Home that provides a home and protection for young Maasai girls who are at risk for ritual genital mutilation and forced early marriage.

I believe that in addition to providing help for people who need it, I will gain some valuable experience that I wouldn't get anywhere else.

What I Need & What You Get

To date, through the help of generous family, friends and fellow students, I've raised nearly $2,400. This amount will cover the in country expenses of the trip and part of the airfare. 

The funds I am raising with this campaign will go directly to pay for the remainder of my airfare.

Every supporter, financial or otherwise, will receive my sincere gratitude. However, as this is a fundraising campaign, there are some perks available to those who are able to contribute:  

  • Anyone who donates $5 or more and gives me their address will receive a Thank You postcard mailed from Kenya.
  • I plan on taking a ton of pictures during the trip. I will create a gallery of photos from which donors of $25 or more can choose a print. The print will be signed, dated and matted to a standard frame size. 
  • For anyone who is able to contribute $50 or more, I will bring back a small keepsake souvenir as a token of my appreciation. If you have a certain item that you collect or would like to have, please let me know and I will do my best to accommodate your request. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially. Even so, you can still make a difference by spreading the word about my campaign via Facebook or your other social media and, if you are willing, giving me positive recommendation.

Thanks for taking the time to look at this and I look forward to sharing lots of pictures and stories from the trip.

story:
Our Story

Established in 2011, the Gaels of Fundy Pipes & Drums is proud to represent the “Fundy Shore”, and is the first pipe band to represent south-west Nova Scotia.

Pipe Major Stuart MacDonald had a dream of introducing the art and craft of playing Highland pipes and drums, and the creation of a pipe band, to the Digby area. The formation of the Gaels of Fundy Pipes and Drums in January of 2011 saw that dream turn into reality.

Interesting facts about the Gaels of Fundy:

  1. The name “Gaels of Fundy Pipes & Drums” refers to…
  • Our collective Gaelic heritage; and
  • A reference to past weather events known to the Bay of Fundy throughout our history.

2.  The tartan worn by the band members is the “Flower of Scotland.”

3.  In memory of Ian Russell, the Gaels of Fundy have emblazoned our bass drum with his family crest. Ian was critical to the formation of the Gaels of Fundy Pipes & Drums, and was not only involved in establishing the pipe band, but was a great supporter who will always be remembered.

4.  The Gaels of Fundy Pipes & Drums have been well received at various events in Digby & Annapolis Counties, including:

  • International Gathering of the Clans, Annapolis Royal
  • The Annual Army Cadet Review, Weymouth
  • The Canadian Cancer Society Relay for Life, Digby
  • The Canada Day Parade, Weymouth
  • The Cherry Carnival Parade, Bear River
  • Escorts for the King’s Orange Rangers in the Scallop Days Parade, Digby
  • Nova Scotia Day – Annapolis Royal
  • 2011 Remembrance Day Services – Digby / Bear River
  • Annual Robbie Burns Dinner, Cornwallis
  • And a variety of private and public functions, including weddings, conferences, special events, and funerals.

5.  The Association of Gaels of Fundy Pipes & Drums is a registered non-profit association. Membership is open to playing, and non-playing members who have a love or an interest in Highland pipes & drums. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down;

  • We need to replace older [very heavy] drums with more modern lighter weight drums
  • Our unique perks. Get excited! For every $100.00 [confirmed] donation, we will send you a "Gaels of Fundy "License Plate"
  • Where the funds go if we don't reach your entire goal? Same place - less drums.

The Impact

Your contribution will not only see Ian's Legacy live on but will ensure that the older players can "Hang in There" and carry the dream to our communities and encourage younger "enthusiasts to "step up to the music".

story:
As of Dec. 10, 2014, AguaClara LLC is officially a Certified B Corporation! It's proof of our commitment to use business as a force for good.


Our Partners

     

    


From Lab to Field



The AguaClara technology was first created at Cornell University, and we've had a lot of success over the past 10 years working with Honduran communities to build and improve systems ever since. However, all too often our work was hampered by uncertainty, never quite knowing where funding for the next project would come from. 

That's why we created AguaClara LLC. We needed a way to bridge the gap between R&D in the lab and implementation on the ground. We believe we've designed a technology that can revolutionize the water sector, and it's been tested and proven in communities throughout Honduras. Now we want to spread the word, with a clear-cut plan that demonstrates what we have to offer, how we offer it, and why it's worth investing in as we make our journey to India.

Past <=> Future

The Honduran countryside

When the AguaClara student program at Cornell was first put together, there weren't many--besides us--who believed our vision was possible. Water treatment systems designed for communities all over the world..."But what happens when the parts break down? Who will operate and maintain it? And how can you reliably provide safe water when there isn't even reliable access to electricity?" These were the questions that filled our minds.


We understood the challenge. We knew what the constraints were, and we believed in a human-centered design process that didn't just happen in the lab, but out in the field with the people, our end users. They taught us that a complex, high tech solution was doomed to fail. After all, what use is technology without electricity?  

To build the infrastructure of the future, we had to look to the past. We had to think about technology before electricity.

The Force of Gravity

When you think about renewable energy, what comes to mind? Solar, wind, biomass, hydroelectricity? How about...gravity?


In Honduras, where the AguaClara technology was first tested, the rain falls heavily across vast, mountainous regions. The evidence of water's intention to flow downwards is everywhere. It moves of its own accord as long as there's just the slightest of slopes, and by designing our technology to take advantage of that natural force, we were able to create something that works entirely without electricity.


AutoCAD rendering of an AguaClara plant

An AguaClara plant in Tamara, Honduras


That's why you can say we're taking the technology of the past and adapting it for the future. In this way, we're designing something that actually works for the developing world, due to its simplicity and self-powering mechanisms. 


(We're just covering the basics here. If you're interested in the more technical details behind our systems, click here.)


The entire plant can be managed by one operator at a time. Unlike your average modern treatment plant, you don't need a secondary degree to figure out how to run it. Thus, the operators can and should be selected from members of the community being served. That's job creation + community ownership!


 

Left: Technician Antonio Elvir (left) and AguaClara engineer Drew Hart calibrating the chemical dose controller. Right: Many of the engineers who go through the AguaClara program are women. We work to encourage that culture of inclusion everywhere we go.


We want the community to understand and appreciate the importance of clean water and what it is we're offering long before we ever break ground in their town.


Simplicity also means using all locally-available materials. There's no room for specially fabricated components in these plants: they break far too easily and are too difficult for the community to fix or replace. The suppliers for every aspect of an AguaClara plant are based in the country where it's built. In other words: we support local.

Sarah working with the plant operator to drill openings in locally-sourced pipes

Basically, we tried to think of everything. 

But new challenges are always on the horizon.


Shooting for the StaRS


That's why we need your support!

AguaClara LLC's focus is now in India, where some 104 million people lack access to clean water and an estimated 1,600 people die from diarrhea everyday (WPP Annual Report 2012). 

We're continuing to adapt our gravity-powered treatment systems in new contexts, for example in multi-village schemes and where the source of water is underground. We've been piloting our StaRS (Stacked Rapid Sand) filters in two villages in the state of Jharkhand, but we need additional funding to expand our capacity on the ground in order to really create something viable. 

       

Left: AguaClara LLC co-founder Maysoon Sharif, in front of the StaRS filters in the village of Gufu. Right: AguaClara treatment plant tower in Gufu.

We also plan on establishing an office in India: a space where our engineering team can collaborate on design work and hold meetings with our potential partners. For the past year, we've been sharing very limited office space with our local implementation partner. It's about time we set up our own facilities, to increase our productivity as we seek to take the StaRS filters to scale. 


Here's the breakdown of how we plan on using the $200,000 over the course of the next year:


  • Establishing an in-country office in India ($20K)
  • Hiring 2-3 new AguaClara engineers ($60K-$100K)
  • Finishing the pilot StaRS filters in Jharkhand ($20K)
  • Leasing or purchasing a vehicle to make on-site visits ($5K)
  • Developing a curriculum for training AguaClara engineers and technicians in India ($25K)
  • Finalizing the move of AguaClara HQ to the San Francisco Bay Area ($2.5K)
  • Supporting ongoing research and development in Honduras ($30K)


AguaClara engineers Jonathan Christensen (left) and Walker Grimshaw (right) are continuing to innovate on our systems in Honduras


"We Floc Together"


We've done our best to provide you with some unique perks of the highest quality, ones that communicate our values and demonstrate our appreciation for your support. That means offering clothing that is well-made and ethically manufactured, as well as water products that both reduce waste and improve quality. It also means showing love for the community that comes together here on social media and on our website. Finally, it means offering you the chance to create a legacy that not only supports the mission of universal access to safe water on tap, but a more inclusive world for everyone.

Note: After you claim a perk, you will soon be contacted by a member of our team who will gather your information based on what you selected.


$25 Perk (and everything above): A Special Thank You On Our Website


Crowdfunding campaigns are all about community, and we have nothing but a deep appreciation for the community that supports us. We want to honor you by creating a special, permanent page on our website that acknowledges everyone who contributed $25 or more to our important work in India. (If you are contributing on behalf of someone else, please let us know her or his name.)

$50 Perk: Engraved 1.0L Water Bottle


Represent AguaClara and the mission of universal access to safe water on tap every time you take a swig of clean water. Bottles come in either smoked pearl or dark blue (pictured).



$50 Perk: Limited Edition "We Floc Together" T-shirt


That's not a typo: "flocs" are what form at an early stage of the treatment process, as water passes through the flocculator. It's when particles in the water collide into each other and get gradually bigger and heavier, to the point where they're heavy enough to settle on the bottom of the tank while the water continues to flow by. Basically, if flocs don't form, then you know the process isn't working. That's why we want you to join our floc!



$80 Perk: AutoCAD Open Source Pullover


It's an understated sweater that speaks for itself. 

(Although you'll probably still have to explain it to people.)




$100 Perk: The Soma Water Filter


A message from our friends at Soma:
Soma is the beautiful and sustainable glass water filter. In light of our campaign and overarching mission, Soma has generously provided their unique water filtration system at a discount for the AguaClara team and our supporters. For more information on Soma and it’s capabilities, please visit www.drinksoma.com. 


    $500 Perk: Win a Trip to Cornell!


    We're limiting this contest to only 100 entries, so make sure to claim yours soon! We'll also cover your flight as long as it's within the USA.

    Cornell University in Ithaca, New York


     

    Left: The Statler Hotel, part of Cornell's world-renowned School of Hospitality. Right: Inside the AguaClara labs at the School of Civil & Environmental Engineering.


    $5,000 Perk: Your Name On Our Office (Sold Out)


    For two generous donors only, we're offering the chance to have our new office in India named in your honor. The legacy of this campaign and AguaClara's work in India will be indelibly tied to those names, and serve as a permanent reminder of the people who helped us become a success. We can't thank you enough.


    $7,500 Perk: A New Scholarship Fund for Cornell Students


    Claim this perk and we will create a new scholarship fund in your honor that allows a different student from Cornell each summer to live and work with our team in the field! We got our start at Cornell, and we want to invest in the leaders of the future that are now working their way up. Students are aching for both real world experience and the funding that makes it possible, and with your help, we'll be able to provide it to them for years to come.


    $10,000 Perk: A New Scholarship Fund for Young Women in Engineering


    Claim this perk and we'll create a scholarship fund in your honor that allows a different young woman from the SF Bay Area each summer to live and work with our team in the field! You might have noticed, but our entire engineering team is made up of women. It's not a big deal--that's just how it is. But we don't pretend that it isn't hard for women to thrive in male-dominated fields. We want to give aspiring engineers the chance to pursue their dreams in an environment that works for them. With your help, we can make it possible.


    More Information


    Can I donate from outside the USA?

    Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. We can also accept payments via PayPal.


    What payment methods do you accept?

    Our preferred payment method is PayPal, but Indiegogo also accepts all major credit cards.


    Is shipping included?

    Yes indeed! And that includes international shipping, as well.


    Can I expect to receive my perks before the holidays?

    We are going to try our absolute best. We only have a small team working at our new HQ in the SF Bay Area, so procurement, shipping and handling will take some time. Nevertheless, if you specifically plan on giving these perks to your loved ones for the holidays, please let us know and we'll work hard to get them to you ASAP.


    I have more questions. Who do I ask?

    Please visit http://aguaclarallc.com/contact-us to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.


    We're committed to being open source--that's how the technology improves, that's how more people get access to safe water on tap.

For more information on Soma and it’s capabilities, please visit www.drinksoma.com. 






$500 Perk: Win a Trip to Cornell!

We're limiting this contest to only 100 entries, so make sure to claim yours soon! We'll also cover your flight as long as it's within the USA.



Cornell University in Ithaca, New York




 
Left: The Statler Hotel, part of Cornell's world-renowned School of Hospitality. Right: Inside the AguaClara labs at the School of Civil & Environmental Engineering.



$5,000 Perk: Your Name On Our Office (Sold Out)

For two generous donors only, we're offering the chance to have our new office in India named in your honor. The legacy of this campaign and AguaClara's work in India will be indelibly tied to those names, and serve as a permanent reminder of the people who helped us become a success. We can't thank you enough.



$7,500 Perk: A New Scholarship Fund for Cornell Students


Claim this perk and we will create a new scholarship fund in your honor that allows a different student from Cornell each summer to live and work with our team in the field! We got our start at Cornell, and we want to invest in the leaders of the future that are now working their way up. Students are aching for both real world experience and the funding that makes it possible, and with your help, we'll be able to provide it to them for years to come.



$10,000 Perk: A New Scholarship Fund for Young Women in Engineering

Claim this perk and we'll create a scholarship fund in your honor that allows a different young woman from the SF Bay Area each summer to live and work with our team in the field! You might have noticed, but our entire engineering team is made up of women. It's not a big deal--that's just how it is. But we don't pretend that it isn't hard for women to thrive in male-dominated fields. We want to give aspiring engineers the chance to pursue their dreams in an environment that works for them. With your help, we can make it possible.




More Information



Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, not bank or debit cards. We can also accept payments via PayPal.

What payment methods do you accept?
Our preferred payment method is PayPal, but Indiegogo also accepts all major credit cards.

Is shipping included?
Yes indeed! And that includes international shipping, as well.

Can I expect to receive my perks before the holidays?
We are going to try our absolute best. We only have a small team working at our new HQ in the SF Bay Area, so procurement, shipping and handling will take some time. Nevertheless, if you specifically plan on giving these perks to your loved ones for the holidays, please let us know and we'll work hard to get them to you ASAP.

I have more questions. Who do I ask?
Please visit http://aguaclarallc.com/contact-us to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.





We're committed to being open source--that's how the technology improves, that's how more people get access to safe water on tap.

story:
80% of medical technology is developed for only 10% of the world


The Quick Pitch

Sisu Global Health is a medical technology social venture, which seeks to increase the quality of life for people in the developing world while growing as a self-sustaining business. Over the past few years we have developed connections and worked with doctors in Ghana to address serious needs. 

Recently, we were approached by the medical community in Zimbabwe, asking us to test our primary device, the Hemafuse, in their hospitals. This is an additional opportunity for us to train doctors on our life saving devices. Unfortunately, all of the grants and awards we have received to date have been focused on Ghana, and we do not have the funds necessary to make a trip to Zimbabwe as well. You can help us overcome this problem by supporting our trip to Zimbabwe to train doctors on our devices. Fund our campaign today to bring life saving technology to people in need!


Who We Are

Sisu Global Health is a medical technology company focused on the developing world. We create medical devices through significant input from doctors with which we have developed lasting relationships. Our products address the needs all major stakeholders have identified and ease the need for some scarce resources, including electricity and donor blood. Our devices are simple and seeks innovative ways to address challenges the developed world does not have. We do this by selling our devices at a fair and marketable price- which allows us to scale healthcare impacts at a much higher rate.


The Tool

Our first device is an auto-transfusion device for blood called the Hemafuse. For those without medical degrees, auto-transfusion simply means that instead of using a pint of donor blood in an emergency situation, our device allows us to recycle and filter a person's own blood from an internal bleed. Emergencies with internal bleeding can occur in blunt trauma events, like car accidents, or the leading killer for mother's in their first trimester: ruptured ectopic pregnancies.  

This is big news for the many places in Sub-Saharan Africa and other developing countries which have huge donor blood shortages. Skilled doctors in Sub-Saharan Africa are already trying to alleviate this problem by performing their own form of auto-transfusion: a soup ladle to spoon blood from a patient and gauze to filter the blood. This certainly saves some lives, but we can agree that something better is needed. 


The Ask

We are asking for $45,000 to fully fund a trip to Zimbabwe to train doctors in the use of our device so that they can test the device in their hospitals. By buying one of our perks you will enable us to expand the initial scale of our device's impact. This funding level will provide for various budgeted items including:

  1. Travel to/from Zimbabwe for up to 3 people
  2. Hiring a documentarian to record training procedures
  3. Lodging while in Zimbabwe
  4. Purchasing an anatomically correct human simulator
  5. Large group training sessions with Zimbabwean doctors 
As the above video notes, we have been working for several years in Ghana. Our main supporters have come from this one country and it will be our launching point. Recently a Zimbabwean doctor contacted us and asked if the Hemafuse could be tested in Zimbabwean hospitals. This proactive call for testing now means we could get on the market much faster and be saving more lives. 
 

The goal of $45,000 is the minimum amount we need to fund this project, however, anything over this amount will be used to sponsor an advisor, increase the size of our training sessions, and allow us to raise awareness of our product in Zimbabwe.


Testing and Safety

The Hemafuse is a patent-pending device that has undergone rigorous lab testing for safety in major institutions like Michigan State and the University of Michigan. The Hemafuse and Sisu Global Health have also been endorsed by USAID, Gates Foundation, Grand Challenges Canada, UKAID, and the government of Norway through Saving Lives at Birth: A Grand Challenge for Development. We also have letters of support from Ghanaian teaching hospitals to the National Blood Service of Ghana to international NGO's. 


The Wrap-Up

We are a social venture targeting the underserved populations of the world. By supporting us, you are helping us reach these populations sooner to enable us to save more lives. 

80% of medical technology is developed for only 10% of the world

Support us today to bring needed devices to the other 90% of the world!


                           Our Website           @sisuglobal       

Partners

story:
We thank everyone for your amazing support to healthy water, please see below for our most recent updates.

Quick Facts  

  • The Stanford Water System is a compact and portable water purifying system using Reverse Osmosis technology. Reverse Osmosis is capable of removing contaminants that filter pitchers like BRITA can't, including lead, mercury, arsenic, fluoride, pharmaceuticals, coppers and many others (see our comparison table below and video below)
  • Connects in seconds to outdoor spigots and standard faucets for water purification (see our 30 seconds videos).
  • Disconnects in seconds for storage (see our 30 seconds videos below).

Quick Overview of the Stanford Water System

It's all started with a father who was looking for a easy and affordable way to filter water for his family at home, and help others at the same time. Looking at these above pictures, which glass of water would you drink? And which one would you let your child consume? It’s surprising for most of us to imagine that clean and safe water is an issue here in the United States. Is that really that bad? Seeing is believing, we ran two water contaminant tests comparing water filtered from Stanford Water System and water from other filtration methods including carbon pitcher and bottled water. 

HOW-TO VIDEOS

Many people asked us how easy it is to use the Stanford Water System unit. The answer is, it’s super easy to connect and disconnect to both outdoor spigots and indoor faucets. Watch the following 30-second-videos and you will see:


You can also connect your Stanford Water System unit to the outdoor spigots, which means clutter-free kitchen:


WATER CONTAMINANT TESTS 

Seeing is believing, we ran some experiment comparing Stanford Water System and other water solutions including carbon pitcher and bottled water. In each experiment, we used the T.D.S Tester and a precipitator. 

  • T.D.S Measure to test the total dissolved solids in the water. The lower the number is, the cleaner the water is. In this test, Stanford Water T.D.S number was 18PPM while the Pitcher Water number is 241PPM.
  • Precipitator Test (or T.D.S Demonstration Device) to reveal the contaminants in the water. An electrical charge will be sent through the water. This charge creates the ions to be unstable; resulting in the oxidization of the dissolved solids, and the green, cloudy clumpy scum that is produced is the byproduct of that reaction. Water with higher contaminants will be more reactant and become darker.

Stanford Water System vs. Bottled Water

Note: We did this experiment in South Bay, California. The TDS number of the water before using the Stanford Water System is 27PPM.


Stanford Water System vs. Carbon Pitcher 


Note: We did this experiment in Discovery Bay, California. The TDS number of the water before any filtration is 470PPM.


See what other early funders say


And we are proud to get the support from the Health & Wellness community and these amazing parent bloggers...

STILL NOT CONVINCED? LEARN MORE:

F.A.Q.

(Frequently Asked Questions) For feedback and support, please visit http://livingsunlight.com

1. How do I use this?

It's simple, the Stanford Water Purification System is designed for use with outdoor spigots, standard sink faucets, or standard shower hookups. We are currently working on producing more types of adapters so that the Stanford Water Purification System can be used on all water connections.

2. How long can one filter last me?

To protect the R.O. membrane, the carbon block pre-filter should be replaced every 3 months or 100 gallons of treated water.

3. How much does one filter cost?

We sell 3-pack carbon filters along with the one included in the base units, last a year for $39. And the RO membrane need to be replaced once a year for $40.

4. How about other maintenance?

Your Stanford Water Purification System unit was designed to be virtually maintenance free. Simply follow these recommendations and your unit should last for years:
  • Clean your unit with a damp cloth and mild dish soap. Do not use abrasive cleaners.
  • To protect the R.O. membrane, the carbon block pre-filter should be replaced every 3 months or 100 gallons of treated water.
  • When not in use for extended periods, your unit should be disconnected, placed in a plastic bag, and stored in the refrigerator.

5. What is the size of the product?

It is as compact as a 16oz water bottle.

6. Can I take this for traveling?

Yes, it can provide filtered water to you in hotels, camping, many places.

7. How is this different from other reverse osmosis systems?

First, we have a unique hook up solution in that it connects to a garden hose faucet. This provides near universal compatibility. Second, we are working to make this very easy to use, so that it is better than alternatives such as bottled water. There is only one compact canister, there is no tank or tap to install, and you can put the whole system in a drawer when you are not using it. The economy factor also sets this product apart. At $79 a year, your Stanford Water System can produce 400 Gallons of filtered water a year.

8. What is the ratio of waste water generated compared to treated water from the Stanford Water System unit? Does this waste water contain all the contaminants filtered out?  

The system flushes away the filtered out contaminants in the waste water. You get about 1 gallon of purified water for every 2 to 2.5 gallons of waste water. This can vary by the amount of water pressure. 

Our funds raised will help us minimize the amount of water needed to flush the contaminants from the system, and allow us to develop additional devices to help you collect the discharged water into your non-edible plants and other safe household uses.

9. What are the benefits of the device getting certified?

There are many water filtration products sold without certifications, however, by getting our device certified by the WQA (Water Quality Association) we are able to take advantage of Government grants to subsidize the cost for lower income areas, where this may be needed most.

About David Schulhof:

David Schulhof is a Silicon Valley entrepreneur with twenty plus years of experience building internet sales and marketing channels for various industries. He co-founded companies like Betty Mills, Dexxa, and Envisions. But now he focuses on solving a more important problem than he ever has before. He wants to make healthy water more accessible to everyone. Once his daughter was born, this became a much more urgent matter. After working with various industry experts, other fellow parents, and water system manufacturers, the Stanford Water System was born.

 

Copyright Living Sunlight, Inc. 2014
Stanford Water System and Stanford Water Purification System are trademarks of Living Sunlight, Inc.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

Some girls will go to school knowing that their uniforms will not be stained

story:
Denis was recently injured during a Gaelic Football match in Raleigh. He received a significant hit to the eye that required two trips to the ER, X-Ray, Cat Scan and multiple follow-up appointments to see an eye specialist. A significant portion of the cost incured was not covered under their health insurance policy. They had to come out of pocket $1800 and it's our goal to help ease their burden by raising as much as we can over the next three weeks. 

Denis and wife Lauren, recently introduced a new member of their family, a baby girl named Clare. We all know that raising a child is extremely expensive and adding in an unexpected medical bill can cause a ripple effect. 

Denis and Lauren have no idea that we are setting this up. Let's all join together, donate whatever you feel comfortable with and help them get back on their feet. 

Thanks, 


Charlotte GAA

story:
What is ASD-DR?

My name is Dawn Marcotte and I have a daughter who was misdiagnosed with ADHD in Kindergarten. she was correctly diagnosed with Aspergers Syndrome in 2nd grade but only because of a chance conversation I had with another parent.

We didn't have any idea where to take our daughter for a diagnosis and treatment so we just got a referral from our family doctor. The specialst we were sent to did not specialize in Autism Spectrum Disorders and so did not diagnose our daughter correctly. 

Unfortunately this problem is all too common. There is no national database available for parents to search to find doctors, therapists or clinics in their area that specialize in Autism. Some states have a partial database available, but it can be hard to find.

I want to change that by creating an online searchable databse of specialists. I want this database to include contact information, specialties and recommendations by families who have actually used that clinic, doctor or therapist. I am thnking of something similar to an Angie's List, but specific to Autism health providers.

This is a huge undertaking and I need help to make the website a reality.

What Do I Need From You?

I need 3 things right now:

1. Donations - See the list below of specifics

2. Help getting recommendations. I can only recommend the doctors and therapists we have used for our family. I need lots of people to send me their recommendations. Here is a link to a form where people can submit their recommendations. http://eepurl.com/AVoY1

3. Spread the word. If you can't donate I understand. I know how finanically draining raising a child on the spectrum can be, however you can share this project with others who may benefit from the website. 

My goal is $2000 so that I can:

Pay a programmer to create the website - $540

Puchase the domain name - $15

Pay for WebHosting for the first year - $800

Pay to crowd source gathering specific information - $460

Pay a graphic artist to create a logo - $100

The items are listed in order of importance. If I don't get all of the money I can still launch, it will just take longer for me to gather the information myself. 

If I happen to raise more money I will use it to purchase needed items for our local school - they have a fabulous program and I want to ensure it continues. 

This website is so important for families with kids on the Autism Spectrum. It will save them time and effort - 2 things these families don't have a lot of. The website will also have lists of web resources for families. Often parents feel isolated and alone - we are not alone, but having other adults who understand the difficulties is essential to staying sane.  I want to create a database that lists support groups and social media sites. 

I also plan to provide links to resources recommended by parents and families.

This is a website that has been needed for a long time.

The Impact

As a contributor to this site you will help ensure that these kids get the help they need sooner. Studies have proven that Autism can be treated and early intervention is key. Delaying a correct diagnosis may mean no access to services. A delay of even a year can make a huge difference in the life of these children and their families. 

We are one of the lucky families. We happen to live in a city with some of the best Autism specialists in the country. While our daughter was not diagnosed correctly until she was in 2nd grade she was recieving services through the school in Kindergartend and firts grade. The autism program in our school is fantastic (Thank You Miss Courtney) and our daughter learned a lot. However we were not able to get her into additional therapies until we had that medical diagnosis.

Once we did we added some additional social skills, behavioral therapy, physical therapy, speech therapy and sensory integration therapy to her schedule. She has blossomed into a smart, funny, loving 14 year old who is looking forward to a career as a fiction writer. 

This is my first campaign to raise funds as I have self funded my other website, www.thingstodowithkidsmn.com

Please help me make this a successful campaign.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with others on your social media of choice, through email or just telling a friend. 

It is vital to get the word out to as many people as possible, not only to help fund the site, but to get as many recommendations as possible to help parents make the most informed choices about medical care for their children.

Thank you so much for your help.

1. Donations - See the list below of specifics
2. Help getting recommendations. I can only recommend the doctors and therapists we have used for our family. I need lots of people to send me their recommendations. Here is a link to a form where people can submit their recommendations. http://eepurl.com/AVoY1
3. Spread the word. If you can't donate I understand. I know how finanically draining raising a child on the spectrum can be, however you can share this project with others who may benefit from the website. 
My goal is $2000 so that I can:
Pay a programmer to create the website - $540
Puchase the domain name - $15
Pay for WebHosting for the first year - $800
Pay to crowd source gathering specific information - $460
Pay a graphic artist to create a logo - $100
The items are listed in order of importance. If I don't get all of the money I can still launch, it will just take longer for me to gather the information myself. 
If I happen to raise more money I will use it to purchase needed items for our local school - they have a fabulous program and I want to ensure it continues. 
This website is so important for families with kids on the Autism Spectrum. It will save them time and effort - 2 things these families don't have a lot of. The website will also have lists of web resources for families. Often parents feel isolated and alone - we are not alone, but having other adults who understand the difficulties is essential to staying sane.  I want to create a database that lists support groups and social media sites. 
I also plan to provide links to resources recommended by parents and families.
This is a website that has been needed for a long time.


The Impact
As a contributor to this site you will help ensure that these kids get the help they need sooner. Studies have proven that Autism can be treated and early intervention is key. Delaying a correct diagnosis may mean no access to services. A delay of even a year can make a huge difference in the life of these children and their families. 
We are one of the lucky families. We happen to live in a city with some of the best Autism specialists in the country. While our daughter was not diagnosed correctly until she was in 2nd grade she was recieving services through the school in Kindergartend and firts grade. The autism program in our school is fantastic (Thank You Miss Courtney) and our daughter learned a lot. However we were not able to get her into additional therapies until we had that medical diagnosis.
Once we did we added some additional social skills, behavioral therapy, physical therapy, speech therapy and sensory integration therapy to her schedule. She has blossomed into a smart, funny, loving 14 year old who is looking forward to a career as a fiction writer. 
This is my first campaign to raise funds as I have self funded my other website, www.thingstodowithkidsmn.com
Please help me make this a successful campaign.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with others on your social media of choice, through email or just telling a friend. 
It is vital to get the word out to as many people as possible, not only to help fund the site, but to get as many recommendations as possible to help parents make the most informed choices about medical care for their children.
Thank you so much for your help.

story:
PROJECTION, SENSUALITÉ, CORPS, COULEURS, LUMIÈRE, SENSATIONS

Nous sommes les finissantes en design et stylisme de mode dans le cadre du  baccalauréat de l’UQÀM. Depuis trois ans, nous avons acquis suffisamment  de connaissances pour réaliser des collections de fin d’études. Des «Fashion Film» seront conçus à l’image de  nos collections. Celles-ci, seront présentées lors de  l’événement mode de l’École supérieure de mode de Montréal.

Notre budget restreint ne nous permet pas de financer un événement à la hauteur de nos ambitions.  Nous avons réellement besoin de  votre aide. On vous remercie infiniment d’encourager la relève de jeunes créateurs montréalais.

 

SENSATION, LIGHT, PROJECTION, COLORS, BODY, SENSUALITY

We are the graduates of the bachelor degree in fashion design at UQAM. For the past three years, we have acquired the knowledge to create our final collection, which will be showcased in a fashion film.  Our student budget, which is restricted, doesn’t allow us to show you what we are capable of. Therefore, we’re soliciting your support.

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous recevrez / What We Need & What You Get

Nous avons besoin de 7000$ pour créer les vidéos modes. Tous les fonds serviront à la réalisation et à l’organisation de ces «fashion films».

Tous les montants sont bienvenus

Toute personne qui versera un don, verra son nom affiché sur la liste de remerciements lors de l’événement mode.

100$

Vous recevrez un foulard personnalisé confectionné par les finissantes.

500$

Vous recevrez un foulard personnalisé, une boîte de truffes au chocolat et une invitation pour l’événement mode. 

1000$

Vous recevrez une boîte de truffes au chocolat, un carré de soie, deux invitations et un remerciement spécial lors de l’événement mode.

 

We need $7000 to create seven fashion films. All the funds will be used to make and organize the movie.

 

All donations are accepted

Everyone who will contribute, will have their name mentioned in the programme during the event.

 $100

You will receive a personalised scarf made by the graduates.

$500

You will receive a personalised scarf, a box of chocolate truffles and an invitation to attend the event.

1000$

You will receive a box of chocolate truffles, a silk square, two invitations and we will also give you a special mention the day of the event.

 

S’il vous plait, partagez la page et passez le mot. Merci de nous aider à atteindre notre objectif. Merci beaucoup !

Please share this page and spread the word. Thanks for helping us achieve our goal. Thank you!
