story:
Smart Hound™ technology has been featured in

 

Bed Bugs in the Elderly Care Community: There is a 33% chance that any given senior citizen will enter a nursing home facility and a greater than 50% chance that he or she will live in some form of assisted or independent living facility. Nursing homes account for 18% of all Bed Bug infestations!

Bed Bugs love to live, breed, and feed in multi-unit dwellings - this is why elderly care facilities have been hit so hard. Odds are you know someone that has been or will be affected by the growing bed bug epidemic in Senior Care Facilities. 

Our Mission:  To use our technology - Smart Hound™ - to preserve the wellbeing of senior citizens by continuous, precision inspection for bed bugs and other pests harmful to human health BEFORE they become a problem for your friends - your family - yourself.  Early detection is key to quick and successful elimination. 

Little has been done to curb the rise of Bed Bugs due to embarrassment, lack of knowledge, and apathy. Our dedicated and professional team needs YOUR help to FIGHT FOR OUR SENIOR CITIZENS! 

Our Plan:  With your help, we will begin the process of eliminating bed bugs from Senior Living and Senior Care Facilities. In the greater Raleigh-Durham (Triangle Region), North Carolina area alone, we have identified 127 facilities that would benefit from our services. With a successfull Indiegogo campaign, we will work with 20 of these facilities and begin FREE scanning twice each over a two month period. Our staff will personally travel to these facilities and work with their employees and residents to determine if and where bed bugs are present. Depending on the wishes of the individual facilities, we can accomplish this openly or discretely (without the public or residents aware of our presence). We believe that this free service for that time period will put in motion a future model for helping Senior Care Facilities across the nation.

As stretch goals (see below), we will increase the number of facilites serviced and we will provide free units to a specific county health department in New Jersey that has shown great interest in becoming our beta tester for Smart HoundTM. (Name withheld for privacy.) 

Your contributions will enable us to create more Smart HoundTM units, rear and train enough Sensor Bugs™ to populate each unit, travel to at least 20 Senior Care Facilities around the greater Raleigh-Durham Triangle region, run tests for beg bugs, compile reports for each facility, and work to move Smart HoundTM to the national stage so that everyone can benefit from bed bug elimination! 

Join the Smart HoundTM movement in putting an end to the uncertainty and difficulty in detecting bed bugs in Senior Care Facilities – a need is out there… and you can help provide the solution:  

Smart HoundTM 

Testimonials and News: 

According to McKnight’s Long-Term Care News & Assisted Living on August 10, 2012, reports from the University of Kentucky show that “nursing homes account for about 18% of all bed bug infestations.” See More » 

"We've had some concerns before, but not to this degree," she said. "We feel it (bed bug infestations) has gotten out of hand." -Wanda Marino, assistant director for social work at DSS. See More » 

“…given the difficulties of recognizing the problem and of detecting bed bugs, I hope that city agencies will become more proactive — especially when it comes to housing for senior citizens…They need to know that they may not feel any bed bug bites or see any bed bugs…First, many people with bed bugs do not react to bed bug bites. Others will react but not see bed bugs. Fewer will react to bed bug bites, see bed bugs, and report them.”- Stephen Kells, University of Minnesota (Entomologist: Bed Bug researcher) See More » 

"Nowadays people travel all over the world and visitors come in...It is impossible to determine the point of origin." – Gerald Wingate See More » 

"People are moving in and moving out...I think that is where they come from. …What you want to watch for is reoccurrence." – Gill Meadows See More »

SMART HOUND™ WILL SOLVE THE PROBLEM WITH YOUR HELP!

 

INTRODUCTION

Smart Hound™ is a biology-based technology capable of detecting a large number of chemical agents in an effort to preserve human health. For this project, we are focusing on detecting bed bugs (specifically in elderly care facilities) and future goals of detecting breast cancer. Keep scrolling down to read about the future of DISEASE AND CANCER  DETECTION as well as our stretch goals. And don't forget the perks! Pics of our PERKS ARE AT THE VERY BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE.

 

THE PROBLEM - Bed Bugs are bad news. Really bad news.

If you are reading this, then you have blood flowing through your veins and bed bugs want a drink. There is a good statistical chance that they will get the opportunity at some point. Bed bugs are equal opportunity feeders. They do not care if you are Democrat or Republican. They do not care if you are in the 1% or the 99%. They do not care if you are staying in the one-star or five-star hotels. They do not care what nationality, race, or religion you are. If you have blood, they want some. 

Bed bugs can wait for a long time without feeding– months if needed – and hide in a variety of hard to reach places such as mattress seams, wall outlet boxes, headboards, movie theater seats, car seats, office carpet, suitcases, and so on. 

While we are having fun with this project, the impact of bed bugs on people is no laughing matter – especially those who are defenseless against these insects like the baby in the picture below and some of the elderly in retirement or care homes.

 

 

Current Methods for Bed bug Detection are Limited and Expensive

Determining if bed bugs are in your home requires extensive and expensive inspection either by humans or dogs, both of which must be trained professionals.

Availability: The most limiting factor of current inspection techniques is that they cannot be performed all the time. It is not practical for you to have a trained exterminator inspect your hotel room prior to every hotel visit, or inspect your apartment every week in case bedbugs have crawled through the walls or down the hall from a neighbor. Smart Hound™ has the potential to allow you, elderly care facilitiy staff, hotel staff, or apartment superintendents to scan frequently – even daily!

If we find that consumers want the ability to monitor for bedbugs on a frequent basis and we roll out a consumer-ready version, Smart Hound™ will be a fraction of the cost. BUT WE NEED TO HEAR FROM YOU THAT CONSUMERS WANT OUR SOLUTION…which is described in the next section.

 

SMART HOUND™ TO THE RESCUE – An Unexpected Solution

We are using Sensor Bugs™ - small, harmless, flying insects that are indigenous to the United States – to literally sniff out bedbugs – and much more! We have proven in the lab that Sensor Bugs™ can smell and respond to bed bugs, termites, fungus, explosives, drugs, and all kinds of chemical markers. In fact, in some tests they went head to head with trained dogs and beat them repeatedly.

Since Smart Hound™ can identify chemicals in the range of parts per billion, and in some cases parts per trillion, its detection ability is as good as or better than a dog giving the consumer the ability to detect as good as a dog – in the palm of your hand. And we put 5 Sensor Bugs™ in every cartridge which means it is like having 5 trained dogs in the palm of your hand. If one has a false positive or false negative, there are 4 more to back it up!

 

The Benefits

The electronic Smart Hound™ device that holds the Sensor Bugs™ is portable, easy to use and we believe will positively identify infestations before they get out of control. This can lower extermination costs and increase efficiency by focusing on the specific location where the bed bugs are located. By targeting the right location and only the right location, treatment will be faster and reduce the amount of pesticide used (a good thing for exterminators). It would also reduce the amount of residual pesticide in a home (a good thing for homeowners). We believe Smart Hound™ could have tremendous impact if widely used!

1 - Give people peace of mind that they do not have bed bugs in their home / apartment / hotel room.

2 – Help eliminate bedbugs from a wide area (e.g. an entire city) if many people were scanning for bed bugs at once.

3 – Allow facility operators to ensure their multi-unit dwelling is bed bug free (this would also reduce lawsuits).

4 – Increase exterminator business because people are actively seeking out infestation on a routine basis.

The Smart Hound™ program used to determine bed bug presence.

 

How It Works- Incredibly Simple, Incredibly Elegant Advanced Technology

The Sensor Bugs™ are trained in our lab (so they are pre-trained before you receive the cartridge) to associate food with the scent we want them to detect. We use a small plastic cartridge that contains 5 Sensor Bugs™. They gather around an air inlet in the cartridge when they detect the scent they are trained to. The Smart Hound™ device automatically detects this movement. The current prototype can be plugged into a USB port on any standard PC. The next generation version will have a built in microprocessor.

The two videos in the Gallery (see Gallery tab at the top of this page) show our Sensor Bugs™ in action! The first video shows the Sensor Bugs™ wandering around as bugs do. They are searching for food - notice how their search is fairly random. Air is continually flowing through an inlet hole in the middle of the cartridge - but the Sensor Bugs™ are not taking any notice.

In the second video, the scent the Sensor Bugs™ are trained to is introduced into the air flow. See for yourself that as fast as 5 seconds it is very clear that the Sensor Bugs™ cluster around the air inlet. This movement is automatically detected by the Smart Hound™ technology that is holding the Sensor Bug™ cartridge.

 

And it's not just for bed bugs...

Given the device's unique ability to detect even the smallest chemical signatures, Smart Hound™ can be used for more than just household pests and bedbugs. In the future, our vision is for customers to order cartridges as needed to detect mold or mildew, air contaminants, toxic chemicals, or peanut contamination in food, or any number of other applications.  We are always open to customer suggestions regarding applications we have not considered!

 

A FUTURE AFTER INDIEGoGo

Since the Sensor Bugs™ only live a couple of weeks and are good for a few days when they arrive ready for use, our vision is that the future Smart Hound™ offering will be an online ordering service that will allow our customers easy access for the detection of bed bugs and new cartridges for other things like termites, mold, etc.  So a detection cartridge filled with pre-trained Sensor Bugs™ will only be a mouse click and overnight shipping away.

This will be particularly useful for travelers who may want to pack a Smart Hound™ device for when you arrive at a hotel in say New York or San Francisco. You could simply get online and order a Sensor Bug™ cartridge to be delivered to the hotel where they are staying. The package would be waiting for you at the front desk when they arrive. You can scan your room and then rest easy knowing no bed bugs are in the room...or run far away from the bed bug-infested hotel if you find them! That is our future vision and we are starting with you! We need to know the public wants this technology available! And the only way we will know is if you pledge today!

 

Cancer and Disease Detection

A growing body of medical research shows that dogs, African pouch rates, bees, and yes, Sensor Bugs™ can detect a myriad of diseases by smell - such as melanoma (skin cancer), tuberculosis, colorectal cancer, and others.  Our estimates show that for current laboratory diagnostic tests that cost around $10,000, the Smart Hound™ system could reduce that cost to less than $100. A lot of work remains to refine processes and run tests in a clinic setting, but we believe we are about to see the start of a diagnostic revolution through the use of Smart Hound™. Rest assured we are exploring this area carefully. A strong showing here on IndieGoGo will help accelerate our plans in the disease detection arena as well. 

 

We Need YOUR Help!

We have approached the hotel chains and we have not received much interest. So we decided to ask consumers – the crowd – YOU! If you would like the ability to scan for bed bugs. The way to give us your “yes” is to pledge NOW! We need financial support to help take the prototype to the next level with new molds and microprocessor-based computing instead of a laptop. We also need some field testers - MEANING YOU!  If you pledge at the Research Assistant Level and above, we will provide you with all the tools you need to conduct research and report back to us. This includes a Smart Hound™ beta device and cartridges to test for bed bugs in a location of your choosing.  Whether you use it in your own home, apartment complex, a local nursing home, business, etc., the data you collect and report to us will help Laboratory Z bring the Smart Hound™ technology to the consumer market. NOTE – A REQUIREMENT TO BE PART OF THE RESEARCH TEAM AT THE RESEARCH ASSISTANT AND ABOVE LEVELS IS THAT YOU AGREE TO SEND US THE RESULTS OF YOUR TESTING WITH NO RESTRICTIONS ON USE. THIS IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT FOR US TO MOVE THE PROJECT FORWARD AND WE SINCERELY APPRECIATE YOUR HELP!

 

STRETCH GOALS - SPREAD THE WORD!

Tweet, Post, Like us on Facebook,“LinkedIn Us” (we’re not sure how to say that last one as a verb!), email your friends – or go old school and call someone or talk about us over coffee!

As an additional reward for your zealotry in fighting the bed bug menace, we offer these stretch goals and rewards:

STRETCH GOAL 1: $150,000 – when we reach $150,000 all Research Assistant Level and above supporters get an additional bed bug sensing cartridge at no additional cost. In addition, we will increase our Free Senior Facility scanning to 25 facilities.

STRETCH GOAL 2: $250,000 - Insects for everyone! If you have pledged at Corporal Level or above, you will receive one free, gently used Sensor Bug™ (yes – it will have already passed on). In addition, we will increase our Free Senior Facility scanning to 35 facilities.

STRETCH GOAL 3: $400,000 – At this level, we will provide Smart Hound™ units to elderly care facilities to a previously indentified county in New Jersey that has shown great interest in searching for bed bugs. This will be at no cost to the facilities, the county, or the state. We will take care of all the costs and scanning. For the time being, we are withholding specifics of the county for privacy reasons.

 

ABOUT LABORATORY Z

Laboratory Z at Bennett Aerospace is a laboratory of innovation intended to mold cutting-edge ideas into realities that are at the forefront of technological evolution. The innovators of Z focus on projects with a short timeline from concept to creation for rapid impact and maximum societal benefit. Z does not limit thinking or imagination. Z encourages creativity and experimentation. Z sees no limits only opportunities.

 

 

 

REWARDS (located along right-side of page)

PLEDGE NOW AND PICK A REWARD! Here are the pics of the awesome rewards we are offering! As stated above, a requirement to be part of the research team at the Research Assistant and above levels is that you agree to send us the results of your testing with no restrictions on use. This is critically important for us to move the project forward and WE SINCERELY APPRECIATE YOUR HELP!

Corporal Level

Sergeant Level

Master Sergeant Level

Bottom view may not display correct color.
Bottom view may not display correct color.
Bottom view may not display correct color.

Lieutenant Level


Limited Edition Bennett Aerospace Mug. MADE IN THE USA! LIMIT OF 100.

Q&A

Q: How long do the insects live?

A: Sensor Bugs™ live for approximately 2 weeks. If we chill them down in a refrigerator, they can live much longer. That is why we plan to ship them chilled if needed.

Q: Are Sensor Bugs™ dangerous?

A: No. Sensor Bugs™ are harmless. Entomologist carry them into kindergarten classrooms and let them crawl all over the kids' arms to show off interesting insects.

Q: Do I have to touch the insects?

A: No. You would only touch a plastic cartridge that contains the insects. We are still deliberating on if the cartridges should be clear (so you can see the Sensor Bugs™) or closed in so the insects can not be seen.

Q: Is “Sensor Bug” their real name?

A: “Sensor Bug” is not their original name – they have a scientific Latin name that is difficult to pronounce – so we gave them a name. It was either “Earl” or “Sensor Bugs” so we went with Sensor Bugs™.

Q: Will we be able to get refill cartridges in the future?

A: We hope to offer the units to the consumer in the future. But that is dependent on if we get enough response from the public to justify starting a product line where we offer the Smart Hound™ technology directly to consumers. If we do offer them to the consumer in the future, we will ensure that units you receive as part of the experimental team will also work with future cartridges.

Q: What do we do after we have used the Sensor Bugs™?

A: You can set them free if they are still alive. They are indigenous to the United States. If they have died, you can discard them in the trash. In the future we hope to be able to recycle the cartridges.

Q: Where do you get your Sensor Bugs™?

A: Our team rears them. They are going extinct in the wild. In 10 years it is highly likely these insects will only exist in captivity.

 

DETAILS FOR PLATINUM SPONSOR

TRAIN A SENSOR BUG!!! – WE ARE TYPING IN ALL CAPS BECAUSE YOU DESERVE THE RECOGNITION AT THIS ELITE OF THE ELITE LEVELS! You will receive Platinum Level Sponsor Recognition with your name and logo of your company (again – family crest will work as well!), plus everything in the Gold Sponsor level, PLUS a trip for two to Cary, North Carolina (from the lower 48 States only and Sensor Bugs can only ship to the lower 48 States at this time). We will pick you and your guest up from the Raleigh-Durham International Airport, provide you one hotel room for two nights THAT WE WILL PERSONALLY SCAN FOR BEDBUGS. The Director of our Advanced Technology Division will provide you a brief on the company and our other research endeavors. Plus--here's the exciting part--you’ll also get a chance to train a real live Sensor Bug!! You’ll receive local lab tours and have dinner on us along with the Bennett Aerospace CEO and/or President.

Current Methods for Bed bug Detection are Limited and Expensive
Determining if bed bugs are in your home requires extensive and expensive inspection either by humans or dogs, both of which must be trained professionals.
Availability: The most limiting factor of current inspection techniques is that they cannot be performed all the time. It is not practical for you to have a trained exterminator inspect your hotel room prior to every hotel visit, or inspect your apartment every week in case bedbugs have crawled through the walls or down the hall from a neighbor. Smart Hound™ has the potential to allow you, elderly care facilitiy staff, hotel staff, or apartment superintendents to scan frequently – even daily!
If we find that consumers want the ability to monitor for bedbugs on a frequent basis and we roll out a consumer-ready version, Smart Hound™ will be a fraction of the cost. BUT WE NEED TO HEAR FROM YOU THAT CONSUMERS WANT OUR SOLUTION…which is described in the next section.

 
SMART HOUND™ TO THE RESCUE – An Unexpected Solution

We are using Sensor Bugs™ - small, harmless, flying insects that are indigenous to the United States – to literally sniff out bedbugs – and much more! We have proven in the lab that Sensor Bugs™ can smell and respond to bed bugs, termites, fungus, explosives, drugs, and all kinds of chemical markers. In fact, in some tests they went head to head with trained dogs and beat them repeatedly.
Since Smart Hound™ can identify chemicals in the range of parts per billion, and in some cases parts per trillion, its detection ability is as good as or better than a dog giving the consumer the ability to detect as good as a dog – in the palm of your hand. And we put 5 Sensor Bugs™ in every cartridge which means it is like having 5 trained dogs in the palm of your hand. If one has a false positive or false negative, there are 4 more to back it up!


 
The Benefits
The electronic Smart Hound™ device that holds the Sensor Bugs™ is portable, easy to use and we believe will positively identify infestations before they get out of control. This can lower extermination costs and increase efficiency by focusing on the specific location where the bed bugs are located. By targeting the right location and only the right location, treatment will be faster and reduce the amount of pesticide used (a good thing for exterminators). It would also reduce the amount of residual pesticide in a home (a good thing for homeowners). We believe Smart Hound™ could have tremendous impact if widely used!
1 - Give people peace of mind that they do not have bed bugs in their home / apartment / hotel room.
2 – Help eliminate bedbugs from a wide area (e.g. an entire city) if many people were scanning for bed bugs at once.
3 – Allow facility operators to ensure their multi-unit dwelling is bed bug free (this would also reduce lawsuits).
4 – Increase exterminator business because people are actively seeking out infestation on a routine basis.

The Smart Hound™ program used to determine bed bug presence.

 
How It Works- Incredibly Simple, Incredibly Elegant Advanced Technology
The Sensor Bugs™ are trained in our lab (so they are pre-trained before you receive the cartridge) to associate food with the scent we want them to detect. We use a small plastic cartridge that contains 5 Sensor Bugs™. They gather around an air inlet in the cartridge when they detect the scent they are trained to. The Smart Hound™ device automatically detects this movement. The current prototype can be plugged into a USB port on any standard PC. The next generation version will have a built in microprocessor.
The two videos in the Gallery (see Gallery tab at the top of this page) show our Sensor Bugs™ in action! The first video shows the Sensor Bugs™ wandering around as bugs do. They are searching for food - notice how their search is fairly random. Air is continually flowing through an inlet hole in the middle of the cartridge - but the Sensor Bugs™ are not taking any notice.
In the second video, the scent the Sensor Bugs™ are trained to is introduced into the air flow. See for yourself that as fast as 5 seconds it is very clear that the Sensor Bugs™ cluster around the air inlet. This movement is automatically detected by the Smart Hound™ technology that is holding the Sensor Bug™ cartridge.
 
And it's not just for bed bugs...
Given the device's unique ability to detect even the smallest chemical signatures, Smart Hound™ can be used for more than just household pests and bedbugs. In the future, our vision is for customers to order cartridges as needed to detect mold or mildew, air contaminants, toxic chemicals, or peanut contamination in food, or any number of other applications.  We are always open to customer suggestions regarding applications we have not considered!
 
A FUTURE AFTER INDIEGoGo
Since the Sensor Bugs™ only live a couple of weeks and are good for a few days when they arrive ready for use, our vision is that the future Smart Hound™ offering will be an online ordering service that will allow our customers easy access for the detection of bed bugs and new cartridges for other things like termites, mold, etc.  So a detection cartridge filled with pre-trained Sensor Bugs™ will only be a mouse click and overnight shipping away.
This will be particularly useful for travelers who may want to pack a Smart Hound™ device for when you arrive at a hotel in say New York or San Francisco. You could simply get online and order a Sensor Bug™ cartridge to be delivered to the hotel where they are staying. The package would be waiting for you at the front desk when they arrive. You can scan your room and then rest easy knowing no bed bugs are in the room...or run far away from the bed bug-infested hotel if you find them! That is our future vision and we are starting with you! We need to know the public wants this technology available! And the only way we will know is if you pledge today!
 
Cancer and Disease Detection
A growing body of medical research shows that dogs, African pouch rates, bees, and yes, Sensor Bugs™ can detect a myriad of diseases by smell - such as melanoma (skin cancer), tuberculosis, colorectal cancer, and others.  Our estimates show that for current laboratory diagnostic tests that cost around $10,000, the Smart Hound™ system could reduce that cost to less than $100. A lot of work remains to refine processes and run tests in a clinic setting, but we believe we are about to see the start of a diagnostic revolution through the use of Smart Hound™. Rest assured we are exploring this area carefully. A strong showing here on IndieGoGo will help accelerate our plans in the disease detection arena as well. 
 
We Need YOUR Help!
We have approached the hotel chains and we have not received much interest. So we decided to ask consumers – the crowd – YOU! If you would like the ability to scan for bed bugs. The way to give us your “yes” is to pledge NOW! We need financial support to help take the prototype to the next level with new molds and microprocessor-based computing instead of a laptop. We also need some field testers - MEANING YOU!  If you pledge at the Research Assistant Level and above, we will provide you with all the tools you need to conduct research and report back to us. This includes a Smart Hound™ beta device and cartridges to test for bed bugs in a location of your choosing.  Whether you use it in your own home, apartment complex, a local nursing home, business, etc., the data you collect and report to us will help Laboratory Z bring the Smart Hound™ technology to the consumer market. NOTE – A REQUIREMENT TO BE PART OF THE RESEARCH TEAM AT THE RESEARCH ASSISTANT AND ABOVE LEVELS IS THAT YOU AGREE TO SEND US THE RESULTS OF YOUR TESTING WITH NO RESTRICTIONS ON USE. THIS IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT FOR US TO MOVE THE PROJECT FORWARD AND WE SINCERELY APPRECIATE YOUR HELP!

 
STRETCH GOALS - SPREAD THE WORD!
Tweet, Post, Like us on Facebook,“LinkedIn Us” (we’re not sure how to say that last one as a verb!), email your friends – or go old school and call someone or talk about us over coffee!
As an additional reward for your zealotry in fighting the bed bug menace, we offer these stretch goals and rewards:
STRETCH GOAL 1: $150,000 – when we reach $150,000 all Research Assistant Level and above supporters get an additional bed bug sensing cartridge at no additional cost. In addition, we will increase our Free Senior Facility scanning to 25 facilities.
STRETCH GOAL 2: $250,000 - Insects for everyone! If you have pledged at Corporal Level or above, you will receive one free, gently used Sensor Bug™ (yes – it will have already passed on). In addition, we will increase our Free Senior Facility scanning to 35 facilities.
STRETCH GOAL 3: $400,000 – At this level, we will provide Smart Hound™ units to elderly care facilities to a previously indentified county in New Jersey that has shown great interest in searching for bed bugs. This will be at no cost to the facilities, the county, or the state. We will take care of all the costs and scanning. For the time being, we are withholding specifics of the county for privacy reasons.
 
ABOUT LABORATORY Z
Laboratory Z at Bennett Aerospace is a laboratory of innovation intended to mold cutting-edge ideas into realities that are at the forefront of technological evolution. The innovators of Z focus on projects with a short timeline from concept to creation for rapid impact and maximum societal benefit. Z does not limit thinking or imagination. Z encourages creativity and experimentation. Z sees no limits only opportunities.
 
 
 
REWARDS (located along right-side of page)
PLEDGE NOW AND PICK A REWARD! Here are the pics of the awesome rewards we are offering! As stated above, a requirement to be part of the research team at the Research Assistant and above levels is that you agree to send us the results of your testing with no restrictions on use. This is critically important for us to move the project forward and WE SINCERELY APPRECIATE YOUR HELP!
Corporal Level

Sergeant Level




Master Sergeant Level


Bottom view may not display correct color.


Bottom view may not display correct color.


Bottom view may not display correct color.



Lieutenant Level

Limited Edition Bennett Aerospace Mug. MADE IN THE USA! LIMIT OF 100.









Q&A
Q: How long do the insects live?
A: Sensor Bugs™ live for approximately 2 weeks. If we chill them down in a refrigerator, they can live much longer. That is why we plan to ship them chilled if needed.
Q: Are Sensor Bugs™ dangerous?
A: No. Sensor Bugs™ are harmless. Entomologist carry them into kindergarten classrooms and let them crawl all over the kids' arms to show off interesting insects.
Q: Do I have to touch the insects?
A: No. You would only touch a plastic cartridge that contains the insects. We are still deliberating on if the cartridges should be clear (so you can see the Sensor Bugs™) or closed in so the insects can not be seen.
Q: Is “Sensor Bug” their real name?
A: “Sensor Bug” is not their original name – they have a scientific Latin name that is difficult to pronounce – so we gave them a name. It was either “Earl” or “Sensor Bugs” so we went with Sensor Bugs™.
Q: Will we be able to get refill cartridges in the future?
A: We hope to offer the units to the consumer in the future. But that is dependent on if we get enough response from the public to justify starting a product line where we offer the Smart Hound™ technology directly to consumers. If we do offer them to the consumer in the future, we will ensure that units you receive as part of the experimental team will also work with future cartridges.
Q: What do we do after we have used the Sensor Bugs™?
A: You can set them free if they are still alive. They are indigenous to the United States. If they have died, you can discard them in the trash. In the future we hope to be able to recycle the cartridges.
Q: Where do you get your Sensor Bugs™?
A: Our team rears them. They are going extinct in the wild. In 10 years it is highly likely these insects will only exist in captivity.
 
DETAILS FOR PLATINUM SPONSOR
TRAIN A SENSOR BUG!!! – WE ARE TYPING IN ALL CAPS BECAUSE YOU DESERVE THE RECOGNITION AT THIS ELITE OF THE ELITE LEVELS! You will receive Platinum Level Sponsor Recognition with your name and logo of your company (again – family crest will work as well!), plus everything in the Gold Sponsor level, PLUS a trip for two to Cary, North Carolina (from the lower 48 States only and Sensor Bugs can only ship to the lower 48 States at this time). We will pick you and your guest up from the Raleigh-Durham International Airport, provide you one hotel room for two nights THAT WE WILL PERSONALLY SCAN FOR BEDBUGS. The Director of our Advanced Technology Division will provide you a brief on the company and our other research endeavors. Plus--here's the exciting part--you’ll also get a chance to train a real live Sensor Bug!! You’ll receive local lab tours and have dinner on us along with the Bennett Aerospace CEO and/or President.

story:
As everyone knows. We lost a very special friend this past friday. Sully Sanchez & her sister Suzette have been two sisters that ive known since i was about 15 or 16.  

 
im at a loss & very destroyed to know that sully has passed i hate to speak much about it. but as you can see here on the left she was carrying her child that was nearly going to be birthed within the month of November. thankfully that beautiful creation was saved. and is recovering. 
 
please help me help her family have nessary funds to not only for her child to have chance. but for her spirit and soul to be at peace.

story:
Welcome

Welcome and thank you for visiting our fundraising campaign. We'd like to thank those who contributed and joined us for Vinyasa in the Vineyard, a fundraising event to support yoga classes for Veterans. The event was open to everyone in the community, held July 28, 2013 in Preston, Conn.

Participants enjoyed a morning practice with mats surrounded by rows of vines and breathtaking views of the Connecticut countryside, connecting with body, breath, mind and the community. The gentle 75- minute vinyasa yoga class was led by All Hearts Center instructors Carol Klammer, Christine Jablonski and Cheryl Hughes. Blackwolf Drumming was offered by Eagle Feather, a Native American and U.S. Veteran, accompanied by Singing Willow. 

Those who wanted were able to balance their practice with a wine tasting after the vinyasa, led by the experts of Preston Ridge Vineyard immediately following the class. Participants were encouraged to enjoy additional live music, provided by Preston Ridge Vineyard, as they casually visited with one another, immersed in the spirit of the day, the beauty of the countryside.

The first Community Vinyasa in the Vineyard for SECT!  We are excited to announce that combined donations through Indiegogo and the event raised funds of nearly $1400.00.  This will provide the opportunity to offer a fully paid scholarship for 10 veterans for a 10- week program of Mindful and Sensitive Yoga for Soldiers, 20 mats, DVDS and booklets.  Thank you everyone, your generosity will give others an opportunity to step forward.

Mindful and Sensitive Yoga- a new program as an outreach to our servicemen and women. Self- connect, options, visceral and concrete.  No sanskrit or assists.  This yoga provides the opportunity for others to learn self- coping skills.  Fight or flight- the sympathetic nervous system can take control over a person when sudden dramatic, negative and dangerous experiences occur. This approach to yoga allows the participant to self- connect to themselves, allowing the parasympathetic nervous system to re- enage.  For more information on Trauma, PTSD, visit military@mentalhealthscreening.org .

Questions? Contact: Hughes.ce5@gmail.com 

Future events soon to be planned!

How Your Contribution Helps

Donations will support scholarships for individuals who have experienced Trauma while in active duty service to attend Trauma–Sensitive Yoga sessions. 
Suggested Donation: $10.00*- combined donations as of 10 Aug 13 are nearly $1400.00

*Donations will support scholarships for our servicemen and women to attend "Mindful and Sensitive Yoga sessions".

What is Trauma-Sensitive Yoga?

  • A guided and structured practice; consists of a safe environment with no physical assists, minimal disruption, maximum consistency with peer support, empathy
  • Reconnect to your body- learn to develop self- awareness (cognitive, somatic); relate to self; cultivate and regulate coping strategies; alternative strategies to respond to physical sensations that may cause pain, distress and/or anxiety
  • Develop tools to respond with self- control- effective and independent choices
  • Adaptation of yoga practice as needed within the students parameters- acquire body-based knowledge

What We Need & What You Get

There is no minimum amount to donate. All donations are valuable! For those who would still like to contribute, donatations will supports and include:

  • Warrior I donation of $25.00 will come with a mood ring and information on Trauma, and Mindful Sensitive Yoga
  • Warrior II donation of $120.00 will sponsor a Veteran for a 10-week session + a $20.00 Virtual Gift Card to Andi and Ani
  • Warrior III donation of $225.00 will sponsor two Veterans for 10-week sessions + a $50.00 Virtual Gift Card to Andi and Ani with two guest passes to All Hearts Center

Key Elements of Trauma-Sensitive Yoga

  • Somatic awareness
  • Effective coping skills
  • Self-regulation and reconnection

The primary goal of Trauma-Sensitive Yoga is to provide students a guided and structured practice that allows them to reconnect to and eventually feel safe in their bodies. Successful adaptation to repeated exposure to adversities in life involves learning to relate to and regulate their bodies in ways that subsequently involve effective coping skills, body awareness and can lead to a healthy recovery. Healthy recovery involves the rebuilding, restoration, or instillation of physical as well as psychological capacities and competencies that have been derailed, delayed, or underdeveloped as a consequence of exposure to negative circumstances in life.

story:
Please help Michelle Mosier Nelson get to the Mayo Clinic. 

My sister-in-law, Michelle, was diagnosed with hemiplegic migraines about 10 months ago.  Hemiplegic migraine is a rare, neurological disease that causes stroke like symptoms when attacks occur.  After several doctors and numerous failed treatments, Michelle has an appointment at the Mayo Clinic.  She has to be there for at least 7 business days. 

Michelle is a wife and mother of six wonderful children. Those who know Michelle will tell you that she is an incredible mother.  She bakes bread every day for her family, cooks the most amazing meals, and does great activities with her kids.  About a year ago, all of this changed. 

Michelle was taken to the emergency room, with symptoms of having a stroke.  She was diagnosed with Bell’s palsy, but the diagnosis was changed to hemiplegic migraines two months later.  Her headaches are debilitating.  On a good day, she is able to get out of bed. She recently went to the grocery store and was excited that she was able to make it half way through the store, without her wheelchair or cane, before her tremors started. 

Michelle’s symptoms are getting worse, with the “attacks” becoming more frequent and lasting longer.  She has a headache every day.  Michelle’s face droops on the right all of the time, but is worse with an “attack.”  When she has an “attack”, her right side becomes paralyzed and she is unable to talk.  She and her children have developed their own sign language, so they can communicate during an attack.  Sometimes the “attack” affects both sides of her body.  My brother, Michelle’s husband, told me that during an attack, sometimes the only way she can answer yes or no questions is by slightly moving her hand one direction for “yes” and another direction for “no.”  That is all she is able to move. 

Michelle’s trip to the Mayo Clinic is going to be expensive, with hotel, food, transportation, medical co-pays and other expenses.  I have estimated $3000 to be the minimum amount needed for Michelle’s visit at the Mayo Clinic, excluding medical co-pays and expenses. 

Any assistance given to them will be greatly appreciated.  If you are not able to contribute financially, please pray for Michelle and her family.  Hopefully, Michelle will get the treatment she needs at the Mayo Clinic and she will once again be able to bake bread and play with her kids.

story:
My name is Tanya Hall. Every morning I go to whec.com to read up on the local news. This morning I came across a story about a mother and wife Leisha Yosol whom has been diagnosed with stage 3C beast cancer. On top of that her husband has just lost his job. Now she has to worry about how she is going to pay her bills and mortgage along with taking care of her 2 children while trying to battle her cancer. I am a complete stranger, I have never spoke to this woman or have I ever met this woman before however, I feel compelled to try and help her. After reading her story I started to brainstorm thinking to myself who can I call that might be able to help me start to raise money for this woman. Then I thought to myself wait a minute the guy that helped the bus monitor by raising all that money and this is where I ended up on this website. So today my goal is to pay it forward and help a complete stranger save her home, help her all I can and hopefully give her some sort of peace of mind so she can fully concentrate on getting well. Please help me help Leisha. You can also see her story at whec.com however I have copy and pasted the story below.

Have a blessed day to all and thank you in advance for your help.

 

Leisha Yosol was diagnosed with Stage 3C Breast Cancer and to make matters worst she found out only after her husband lost his job and their health insurance. This made life very difficult for the couple and their two young children. High medical costs have made it tough for the family to keep up will bills. But Leisha now has a chance to win $10,000 from an online contest. Remax's "What Moves You" contest awards the prize to the story that receives the most votes. Yosol so far has over 5,000 votes and is one of the top stories. But she is still in need of some more help her win. She sat down Tuesday night with Lia Lando to discuss her story and talk about the contest and how the money could help save her house.

story:
Denise was involved in a hit and run motorcycle accident on Friday 6/29. She is a hard working, loving mother and partner who was smiply out for a summer ride, but quickly became the victim of vicious road rage.

After loosing her youngest daughter in 2009 to a brain aneurysm and very recently recovering from an appendicitis, she was out on just her second ride of the year when this horrific accident happened.

She was thrown from her motorcycle into a ditch, breaking both of her ankles and left leg. She will be unable to walk for atleast 3 months. Determined as she might be, she is going to be in physical therapy for months and no promise she will be able to return to work as a waitress anytime soon.

Here is the full news story: http://www.kirotv.com/videos/news/months-of-rec...

 
We are doing everything we can to make sure her transition is smooth and she has a comfortable recovery at home. Any help is much appreciated, even just sharing this campaign with your friends and family.
 
Thank you SO much for allowing us to share Denise's story! God Bless

story:
Our Story

I am Shelby's little sister, Shayna. My family and I live in Broomfield, CO. We live a normal, fun and carefree life for the most part. Recently, our world has been flipped upside down and we are in need of help. My family and I are creating this fund because my brother, 24, is currently struggling with germ cell cancer, a form of testicular cancer, for the third time. He has been struggling since he was 19 years old. He has undergone many surgeries and recently suffered a seizure which lead to the discovery of a cancerous brain tumor. After a successful brain surgery, the doctors have found that the cancer has returned to his lungs as well. He now needs high-dose chemotherapy treatment and a stem cell transplant to save his life. We recently found out he will have a total of two stem cell transplants and the treatment will last at least 5 months. Each chemotherapy treatment and transplant cycle will be three weeks, for a total of 6 weeks hospitalization. The doctor recommends outpatient care if possible for these three weeks which would require someone to care for Shelby 24/7 and visit the clinic every single day to check his counts. This treatment will be very difficult on his body and he has been forced to move back in with my mom because he will be unable to work. Due to his inconsistent income, piles of previous and current medical bills, and need for in-home care, Shelby will lose his home.Our family will struggle to earn enough money to pay for the in-home care, prescriptions, co-pays, rent, food and bare necessities that my brother will need. My single mother, brother's girlfriend, my husband and I, miss many days of work over the course of the treatment to care for my brother and get him to his numerous appointments. My brother is very optimistic and in order to maintain his spirits, my family and I need to provide him with the care he deserves and the basic comforts of life. If you are able, we are asking for any help that you can give to us. 

The Impact

We are not just trying to pay Shelby's medical bills, this money will have a direct impact on how we are able to take care of him. If we do not receive help, it is very possible that my brother may not receive in-home care if he needs it. He may have to stay inpatient throughout the 3 week treatments. Shelby does not sleep well in the hospital and is not often allowed to be as active as he wants. He is an active boy and is basically miserable in a hospital.  The doctor told us that the more he is active and comfortable, the better he will do, but this will require someone taking more than six weeks off of work. For this to be possible we need your help. 


What We Need & What You Get

Regardless of the amount of money we earn, ALL of it will go to Shelby's treatment expenses.  Our goal is to cover rent, food, and medical expenses during this treatment to ensure Shelby can be comfortable and receive the best care and love in the world at home.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, please, Share this fund with everyone you know! Our goal is to provide the necessities for Shelby so that he does not have to think twice about anything but his survival. Shelby has been so strong and the love he has received from friends, family and strangers have helped him thus far, please help us if you can.

story:
Our Story:

The picture we have provided above will be our "Opt In" box on the first page of our actual membership site. It allows people that may not be ready to join to receive a Free downloadable DVD that explains about Tai Chi and about how the website works.

My name is Kara and I'm working with Morris, and his cousin Mike to develop an online membership website that teaches self healing through Tai Chi.

Tai Chi began as a Martial Art roughly 300 years ago and at first was used as a means of self defense. Over time different students of the original founder began to develop various forms of the art depending on their personal interest based in different schools of philosophical thought. The most familiar school of thought is Taoism and it teaches people how you can create inner peace even while the world around you is in chaos.

Eventually Tai Chi became more widely known as a means of exercise for the body and mind. There are many different schools of Tai Chi but they all teach a mind body connection toward health and wellness.

Our Tai Chi Master has 30 years of experience and teaches a form of the art known as Yang Style Tai Chi which is the most popular and widely practiced form in the world today.

I have lived with severe chronic pain since I was 11 years old which means I have now dealt with chronic pain for 30 years. Most of my medical conditions were inherited and other pains are from injuries. A few of my conditions are endometrioses,interstitial cystitis, degenerative disc disease, osteoarthritis,chronic kidney stones and a herniated disc at L5/S1.

Morris, has also lived with chronic pain for over 30 years. He was in a motorcycle accident where his wrists, knees, arms and ankles were broken. His discs were compressed and his skull was fractured. On top of this accident years later he was injured at work while lifting a heavy object that caused his lumbar disc to herniate and later fully blow.

Mike, or as he's also known by 'Maui Mike', has been a student of Tai Chi for over 30 years and has been a Tai Chi Master for the last 5 years. After Mike and Morris reconnected at a family event Mike taught Morris and myself about the awesome health benefits of Tai Chi and it has changed our lives!

Because Morris and I have lived with the trials of chronic pain for decades we know all too well how constant pain interrupts a persons quality of life and how it can alienate a person leaving them feeling hopeless. This is why we have all decided to share our experience with Tai Chi and why we want other people to be able to have easy access to Tai Chi lessons and a supportive community.

The site will offer lessons of 15 to 20 minutes delivered weekly to each members mailbox so that every member will be able to download lessons at their own pace. The cost will be $20.00 per month for individuals and we'll offer group discounts.

The health benefits of Tai Chi are not just for people that suffer from pain and illness but it is also a great way to stay in excellent physical shape! We'll also be giving tips for staying clam at work, before an important meeting, for those that have a difficult time falling asleep and much more.

Tai Chi health benefits have been studied by many different hospitals and other various medical institutions. Notably, the Mayo clinic studied the health benefits of Tai Chi and they concluded that a regular routine of Tai Chi exercise can reduce inflammation, lower blood pressure, ease depression, reduce anxiety and much more.

We have also developed the Tai Chi site to help people like my mother who was diagnosed last summer with Early Onset Alzheimer's. My mother also suffers from chronic pain. We want to reach people like my mom who can greatly benefit from staying active and by eating a healthy well balanced diet. So, along with offering weekly downloadable Tai Chi lessons the site will also have a section that offers free nutritional information which helps to reduce and even abate cognitive decline as we age.

As soon as we are able we plan to donate funds for helping low incomes families pay for expenses in relation to things such as Adult Daycare or Home Care, Assisted Living and other expenses involved with taking care of a loved one with Cognitive disorders.

The Impact:

The Weekly Tai Chi lessons will help people that suffer from physical illnesses, depression, anxiety and other ailments by teaching people that even just a few minutes a day can change the way they feel physically and mentally and that their overall health can greatly improve. By making Tai Chi easily accessible to a lot more people we hope the impact will be that there will be many more people that will be a lot more healthy.

Most people that are disabled either with chronic pain, chronic illness, depression or precognitive decline disorders are limited by their ailments and are often unable to access transportation on a regular basis. By providing people with the ability to easily access Tai Chi lessons at home on their computers we will be able to reach a large group of people that would not otherwise be able to participate. We will put the Ability back into disability!

We feel confident that we will be able to help many people to get off the sofa and to start exercising which will improve the quality of their lives. Through a regular routine of Tai Chi pain can be lessened, self esteem and confidence can improve and inflammation can be reduced, blood pressure can be lowered, as well as many other health benefits.

Our site will also help raise awareness for Alzheimer's and Chronic Pain by working with established non profit organizations.


What We Need:

We need a variety of software products, camera and lighting equipment and other various items as listed below:

1. Adobe Photoshop  2. Theft Protection Software   3. Membership Software/List Machine Pro. 4. FB Bam

5. Amazon S3/Bucket Commander/plus usage (for proper video streaming)

6. We also need a Chromakey Green Screen with lights and light stands and background software.

7. Professional Camera and accessories.

8. Security deposit and first months rent for a studio space.

9. Advertising cost.

10. What ever money may be left after these needs are met we will use the funds to add a "Members Room" on the website where people can send private messages to each other for support and a "Live Chat Room".

If we are unable to reach our entire goal we will forgo the studio rental and use a room in our house. However, our house is very small and we will have to take everything down and put it back up everyday. This can also put equipment as risk of being damaged.

No matter how much money we raise will still plan to go forward with the site. The site may take longer to develop but we will not disappoint anyone who is kind enough to donate to our dream. We will keep everyone up to date on our progress in a timely manner.

All "perks" are based upon the "life" or length of time the website is actually up and running live on the internet. We plan to run the site for many years to come, hopefully decades. Therefore, "Lifetime Membership Perks" are with regard to the lifetime of the website.

What You Will Get:

Aside from having a wonderful feeling because you've helped make our dreams, of helping people to live healthier lives, a reality you will receive various benefits/perks depending on donation amount.
We offer:
* A unique hand written thank you card, made by a local Maine artist, mailed to your house. Or an electronic thank you card if you prefer.
* FREE membership to our Tai Chi website for particular lengths of time depending on the donation amount.
* Recognition/Thank You on our website, our FB pages and Twitter.
* 50% discounts to extend your membership.
* Free downloadable DVD about Tai Chi and nutrition to help you eat better and live healthier overall.
* Free Isotonix health supplements that support the immune system. 
* When donations are made to Alzheimer's Research (and other charities) your name will be included as someone that made the donations possible.
* Free ready made Websites with Premium Plug'ins, 30 articles, Free Domain and Hosting for one year and monetized with "ClickBank" and "Adsense". If you do not understand these terms or what it means to have a website like this Please feel free to contact us for more information at endopain@live.com or morrismurphy@morrismurphy.com Subject Line: *Indiegogo website question*
* Recognition by thanking you as a sponsor on our website
*Advertisement for you or your business on one or two of our sister sites. 
* When our Tai Chi site is live we will offer an Affiliate program. You can advertise our membership site and receive 100% commission on the first 10 customers you sign up and 50% commission on every member that signs up via your link or links (eg. via your advertisement).


Other Ways You Can Help:

You can also help by sharing our campaign with your family and friends. Please use the "Share Tools" on our campaign page to post to your Face Book and Twitter accounts. We plan to put up You Tube clips so you'll be able to share our Tai Chi and Nutritional tips on your social networks.

Thank you so very much for reading this entire campaign. I know it was long and we greatly appreciate your time! Please join us in making our dream of helping people to learn how to manage their pain, illness and anxiety in order to live a more fulfilled life. You can feel great knowing you played a huge role in helping others to feel better.

story:
Caring for Carol - A Grave for our Mother

Carol Nordvik was a single mother raising three children for nearly twenty years, Jeffrey, Kelsey, and Katie. She loved her children so much, that she worked at the school her own kids went to, so she could watch them grow up.

In early 2007 Carol was diagnosed with lung cancer. Devistatingly, life was tough enough for a single parent raising three children, and now there was a mountain of medical bills on top of it. Carol was given 3-6 months to live.

Despite doctor's estimates, Carol fought to survive for her children. By early 2008, it had progressed to the point where she had to quit her job to persue more agressive treatments to survive. By the middle of the year, she was in bed everyday in agonizing pain from extensive chemotherapy treatments.

Surprisingly, the treatments and experimental drugs started working, and the cancer was slowly fading. By the end of the 2008 she was back on her feet, her hair was growing back, and she was counting her blessings. She even became engaged to a new man in her life.

Then, a terrible infection caught up with her, one that all the doctors had somehow missed. The infection attacked her weakened immune system, and made her so weak that the cancer was able to spring back to life, and completely take over her body within days. Carol immedietly went back into the hospital on December 1st. She passed away on December 7th, in the early morning hours with her family around her.

Her children, who were just out of high school themselves, lost her home, vehicle, and everything to pay off the debts and expenses left behind. When it was all said and done, there wasn't enough left to bury her.

She remains cremated in an urn, but her children have no place to visit, no place to pray to and speak to their mother. Her children have no grave to bring flowers to on her birthday.

After a long battle with the life insurance company, they paid out her life insurance policy to a feuding relative, who spent the money on a car instead of helping her children to bury their mother.

What We Need

While her three children struggle to survive on their own in apartments and low-end jobs, every attempt to raise money in efforts to bury her has stalled.

  • Estimates show $1200 would cover all costs and expenses of the burial, grave site, and purchase of the gravestone.
  • Any leftover funds would be donated to Relay For Life, which our mother had walked in for several years in support of her friends and eventually herself.

The Impact

Carol's family extended out past just her three children. there are dozens of family members, cousins, and a fiancee who would love to have a place to share their memories and prayers with their mother.

Our mother loved the outdoors, planting her own gardens yearly, and she deserves more than to be kept inside a vase. Please help us get our mother back outside with nature that she loved, and grant her children and family a place to visit her.

Further Information About Carol

Carol's Obituaries are not difficult to find. She was a resident of Grand Island, New York since her children were born.

An online Obituary can be found at http://www.rhoneyfuneralhome.com/display.asp?ID...

story:
AS SEEN IN

 

 

Bleeding from minor cuts for many people is no joke!  Do you or someone you know, experience bleeding that is sometimes hard to get to stop?  It seems to go on forever.  This stubborn bleeding can be a pain.

AllaQuix™ may be the answer for you.  AllaQuix™ is a high performance gauze that is specifically designed to stop bleeding quickly, even in people that normally have trouble stopping bleeding. 

AllaQuix™ uses the same medical technology that is used by hospitals, ambulances, and the military to stop bleeding quickly.  The FDA has cleared AllaQuix™ and now we are bringing it to the general public.

We are launching AllaQuix™ right now.  This is the opportunity to get the peace of mind of knowing that you can now stop bleeding quicker with AllaQuix™.  To get AllaQuix™ out to a lot of the people that can benefit from it, we are offering special discounts.

For $5, you can get 2 AllaQuix™ wound dressings.  This is a great way for you to try AllaQuix™ yourself and see how well it works.  This is a great value that is available only until June 5th.

Buy AllaQuix™ for yourself so you are prepared when stubborn bleeding happens.  Pass this information on to your family and friends, so that they can be prepared too.

Our Mission is to Give People Peace of Mind and Freedom.

This difficult-to-stop bleeding from minor cuts can be stubborn.  When it happens, it does not seem serious, but it sure is a nuisance!

Nuisance Bleeding causes people to stop doing the things they love.  People give up gardening, cooking, woodworking, fishing, working in the garage, playing sports, and the list goes on.

If Nuisance Bleeding has changed your lifestyle (or a loved one), please share your story with us by taking our confidential survey.

Nuisance Bleeding should not stop people from doing their favorite activities, or even shaving.  With your help, we are going to change that!

Nuisance Bleeding is ignored by the medical community.  People are not given the right tools or information they need to stop the bleeding more quickly and on their own. 

We need to get AllaQuix™ into the hands of people that require a professional-grade wound dressing that can stop this stubborn bleeding, or Nuisance Bleeding, quickly.   There are many people that this fits as we discovered that:

1 in 3 adults can have difficulty with getting a simple cut to stop bleeding.

If you or someone you know is one of these people who sometimes experiences this stubborn bleeding:

  1. Claim a perk to get AllaQuix™
  2. Try AllaQuix™ next time bleeding from a minor cut won't stop
  3. Tell us how AllaQuix™ worked for you

 

Nuisance Bleeding is not just a “nuisance,” it is a big deal.

There are millions of people in the U.S. that are at risk of Nuisance Bleeding.  Why?  Some of these people are born with a genetic condition, such as a bleeding or clotting disorder.  Others are taking medication that puts them at risk.  One of every three adults in the U.S. are taking prescription blood thinners (such as Coumadin, Plavix, and Pradaxa) or taking daily aspirin for heart health.  These drugs work well at stopping clots in the body, but one of the side effects is that they do not allow the blood to clot at a cut in order to stop the bleeding.  Minor cuts can bleed and bleed and bleed.  That is a nuisance – but this nuisance can become a serious medical problem. 

Since this bleeding is hard to stop, tens of thousands of people go to the Emergency Room every year because of a simple cut!  That is a hassle.  Not only that, but this trip to the ER can cost more than $800. Several hours and $800 for the privilege? No Thanks.

That is not the worst of it.  People are taking blood thinners or daily aspirin to protect their health, so it is important for them to keep taking their medication.  More than 10% of these people stop taking their blood thinner because of Nuisance Bleeding!  That can lead to disastrous consequences, including hospitalization, heart attack, stroke, and even death.  Suddenly the video about Bob and Jane is not quite so funny. 

A journal from Mayo Clinic tells the story of a man that got frustrated with Nuisance Bleeding when he nicked himself shaving.  He stopped taking his blood thinner.  He ended up in the hospital for the second time in a month to have another stent placed.  Nuisance Bleeding can have serious consequences, but most people don’t know about it or know how to handle it.  Your support will help people take charge of their health and live better. 

 

More Information on AllaQuix™

AllaQuix™ is medical-grade gauze made from chitosan.  This is not ordinary gauze, but it is an active hemostat, which means that it helps stop the bleeding from a cut, even when the body has a hard time doing it itself.  Ordinary gauze, tissues, or adhesive bandages just absorb blood and protect the wound. 

Chitosan wound dressings have been used in hospitals and the military to stop bleeding fast, even in people that have trouble stopping bleeding.  Now we want to take this advanced technology directly to people who need it to stop Nuisance Bleeding.

For more information on AllaQuix™,

www.allaquix.com

Your pledges, comments and support mean the world to us.

Thank you for helping us spread the word and help people

STOP NUISANCE BLEEDING NOW!

 

For more information on Nuisance Bleeding,

www.nuisancebleeding.com 

 

  

 

AllaQuix™ is marketed by Inspiration Medical Technology, Inc.

People deserve quality healthcare information and products.  With a combined 100+ years experience in health care, our team sees a large gap in the system: people are expected to play a greater part in their health care, but they are not equipped to do so. People deserve straight talk and professional-grade medical products.

 

 

This is the Inspiration Medical Technology Team

Stephen Miller

A college psychology class introduced me to Maslow’s hierarchy of needs and that has changed my life.  If people do not have their basic needs met, then they cannot focus on issues beyond them – they cannot help others and be a positive world citizen.  This has stoked my motivation to help people solve problems with their basic needs. 

This motivation has led me to start Inspiration Medical Technology.  I am putting my twenty-plus years of life science experience into the team to solve basic health problems, which are getting in the way of people living life to the fullest.

I currently live in the Twin Cities, where I am an active member of the youth athletic association and my church.  I have given back to the community over the years through charitable organizations such as Rotary Club, Big Brothers, Junior Achievement, Iringa Microfinance, and Compassion International.

www.linkedin.com/in/millerlse/

 

Patrick Donohue

Everyday I am motivated to educate people so they can save time and money in healthcare and finance.

I reside in Eden Prairie, Minnesota with my wife Anne and three children.

I am dedicated to actively giving back to the community. These activities have taken different forms over the years from traditional volunteering with groups like Habitat for Humanity, The Girls Club of Omaha and hundreds of hours and a few gallons of blood to the Red Cross. More recently, my community activities have primarily been with DesignWise Medical, Minneapolis Rotary, the CFA Society of MN and mentoring with the University of MN Carlson Enterprise Fund.

My long-term interests for giving back to the community include providing financial education to children and adults so they can be financially independent.

www.linkedin.com/in/patrickedonohue

 

Jim Hartman         

I have spent 30+ years in executive roles with a variety of companies including 17+ at a medical device firm.  I am currently board chair of DesignWise Medical, a non-profit dedicated to the creation of child-appropriate health products that allow them to live life to its fullest and also serve on the board of Metro Meals on Wheels. I also serve on the boards of two publicly traded companies and enjoy using my management experience to assist start-up firms. 

www.linkedin.com/pub/james-hartman/3/76a/3b6

 

Phil Kading

I bring to the team a wealth of business development experiences within the payer and health plan segment.  I have spent my career with UnitedHealthcare, Optum, and The Burchfield Group.  I am also a board member of DesignWise Medical, a non-profit dedicated to the creation of child-appropriate health products that allow them to live life to its fullest. 

www.linkedin.com/in/philkading

 

Nick Lipetzky

I bring marketing, brand and digital strategy to the team.  My driving purpose is to liberate information from old thinking. I was involved with many enterprise websites including LendingTree.com.  I lead digital strategy at BBDO.  Currently I am a co-founder of Traffik where we help to make marketing useful.

www.linkedin.com/in/nicklipetzky

 

Eric Schaefer

I am a healthcare strategy and business development leader with deep experience in the provider and hospital space.  I am a mentor and advisor to a number of early-stage life sciences companies, as well as a founding member of Health 2.0 – Twin Cities.

www.linkedin.com/in/ericeschaefer

 

Steve Charbonnet

My contribution to the team is my experience in legal aspects related to finance and general corporate counsel as I have advised many life science companies.  I also teach corporate finance at William Mitchell College of Law and have authored several articles and lectured on various business and finance issues.

www.linkedin.com/pub/steve-charbonnet/2/703/32a

For more information on Inspiration Medical Technology,

www.inspirationmedtech.com
story_txt:
AS SEEN IN

 


 
Bleeding from minor cuts for many people is no joke!  Do you or someone you know, experience bleeding that is sometimes hard to get to stop?  It seems to go on forever.  This stubborn bleeding can be a pain.
AllaQuix™ may be the answer for you.  AllaQuix™ is a high performance gauze that is specifically designed to stop bleeding quickly, even in people that normally have trouble stopping bleeding. 
AllaQuix™ uses the same medical technology that is used by hospitals, ambulances, and the military to stop bleeding quickly.  The FDA has cleared AllaQuix™ and now we are bringing it to the general public.

We are launching AllaQuix™ right now.  This is the opportunity to get the peace of mind of knowing that you can now stop bleeding quicker with AllaQuix™.  To get AllaQuix™ out to a lot of the people that can benefit from it, we are offering special discounts.
For $5, you can get 2 AllaQuix™ wound dressings.  This is a great way for you to try AllaQuix™ yourself and see how well it works.  This is a great value that is available only until June 5th.
Buy AllaQuix™ for yourself so you are prepared when stubborn bleeding happens.  Pass this information on to your family and friends, so that they can be prepared too.

Our Mission is to Give People Peace of Mind and Freedom.
This difficult-to-stop bleeding from minor cuts can be stubborn.  When it happens, it does not seem serious, but it sure is a nuisance!
Nuisance Bleeding causes people to stop doing the things they love.  People give up gardening, cooking, woodworking, fishing, working in the garage, playing sports, and the list goes on.
If Nuisance Bleeding has changed your lifestyle (or a loved one), please share your story with us by taking our confidential survey.
Nuisance Bleeding should not stop people from doing their favorite activities, or even shaving.  With your help, we are going to change that!
Nuisance Bleeding is ignored by the medical community.  People are not given the right tools or information they need to stop the bleeding more quickly and on their own. 
We need to get AllaQuix™ into the hands of people that require a professional-grade wound dressing that can stop this stubborn bleeding, or Nuisance Bleeding, quickly.   There are many people that this fits as we discovered that:
1 in 3 adults can have difficulty with getting a simple cut to stop bleeding.

If you or someone you know is one of these people who sometimes experiences this stubborn bleeding:

Claim a perk to get AllaQuix™
Try AllaQuix™ next time bleeding from a minor cut won't stop
Tell us how AllaQuix™ worked for you
 
Nuisance Bleeding is not just a “nuisance,” it is a big deal.
There are millions of people in the U.S. that are at risk of Nuisance Bleeding.  Why?  Some of these people are born with a genetic condition, such as a bleeding or clotting disorder.  Others are taking medication that puts them at risk.  One of every three adults in the U.S. are taking prescription blood thinners (such as Coumadin, Plavix, and Pradaxa) or taking daily aspirin for heart health.  These drugs work well at stopping clots in the body, but one of the side effects is that they do not allow the blood to clot at a cut in order to stop the bleeding.  Minor cuts can bleed and bleed and bleed.  That is a nuisance – but this nuisance can become a serious medical problem. 
Since this bleeding is hard to stop, tens of thousands of people go to the Emergency Room every year because of a simple cut!  That is a hassle.  Not only that, but this trip to the ER can cost more than $800. Several hours and $800 for the privilege? No Thanks.

That is not the worst of it.  People are taking blood thinners or daily aspirin to protect their health, so it is important for them to keep taking their medication.  More than 10% of these people stop taking their blood thinner because of Nuisance Bleeding!  That can lead to disastrous consequences, including hospitalization, heart attack, stroke, and even death.  Suddenly the video about Bob and Jane is not quite so funny. 
A journal from Mayo Clinic tells the story of a man that got frustrated with Nuisance Bleeding when he nicked himself shaving.  He stopped taking his blood thinner.  He ended up in the hospital for the second time in a month to have another stent placed.  Nuisance Bleeding can have serious consequences, but most people don’t know about it or know how to handle it.  Your support will help people take charge of their health and live better. 
 
More Information on AllaQuix™
AllaQuix™ is medical-grade gauze made from chitosan.  This is not ordinary gauze, but it is an active hemostat, which means that it helps stop the bleeding from a cut, even when the body has a hard time doing it itself.  Ordinary gauze, tissues, or adhesive bandages just absorb blood and protect the wound. 
Chitosan wound dressings have been used in hospitals and the military to stop bleeding fast, even in people that have trouble stopping bleeding.  Now we want to take this advanced technology directly to people who need it to stop Nuisance Bleeding.
For more information on AllaQuix™,
www.allaquix.com

Your pledges, comments and support mean the world to us.
Thank you for helping us spread the word and help people
STOP NUISANCE BLEEDING NOW!
 
For more information on Nuisance Bleeding,
www.nuisancebleeding.com
