story:
WHY THERE IS AN URGENT NEED FOR A BETTER CPR TRAINING MANIKIN

According to the American Heart Association (AHA), there are more than 300,000 victims of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest each year in the U.S.  However, less than 8% of these victims survive.  Bystanders rarely volunteer to help, because their CPR skills are too often poor and they are afraid of hurting the victim.  According to the AHA, our beta test participants, and many others, CPR training has been ineffective due to the lack of realism of the CPR manikins used.  CPR manikins have not changed much since CPR was first introduced some 50 years ago.  Studies have also shown that health professionals and emergency personnel often perform CPR poorly for lack of adequate training and recall.

In addition to a lack of realism, today's CPR manikins are also inadequate because they fail to support the AHA's 2010 guidelines, which now focus on the quality of chest compressions as opposed to airway and breathing issues (more on this below).

WHY THE NEW HCR CPR MANIKIN WILL BE SUPERIOR TO THOSE CURRENTLY IN THE MARKETPLACE

HCR's patented "human chest dynamics" device that will be built inside its CPR manikin has been carefully researched and engineered.  The combined manikin and device has been trademarked "Chest Compression Charlie" (we just call him "Charlie").

First of all, Charlie provides the realistic feel and sound of the tearing of cartilage and the breaking of ribs.  "Never heard of this" you say?  That is because it has historically been ignored in CPR training.  However, the AHA and others, including our beta test audience (especially the firefighters), state that these effects are a common occurrence.  The NIH states that rib cracking etc. effects (which occurred in 94% of their sample) are commonly under investigated and, therefore, are not reported.  This replication of cartilage tearing and rib cracking is not offered by any other CPR manikin (thus the patent).

Since CPR training typically excludes these key chest dynamics, firefighters have told us that the "tearing and cracking" sounds can scare bystanders to such an extent that they stop performing chest compressions--defintely not the thing to do.

What else does Charlie do that is unique?  The AHA has stated that quality chest compressions (the now widely recognized key to survival) need to be at least 2 inches deep, delivered at a suggested 100 lbs of thrust, and performed at the rate of 100 compressions per minute.  As discussed in more detail below, Charlie is the only CPR manikin that will satisfy all of these guidelines. 

Studies at the University of Pennsylvania and elsewhere have shown that the human chest, once compressed, does not just pop back into place (as represented by so many of today's CPR manikins).  In reality, the recoil of the chest is "damped" as opposed to being linear.  Charlie has been purposely designed to replicate such dynamics of the human chest during CPR (see graph below).

HERE IS A COMPARISON OF CHARLIE'S FEATURES TO THOSE OF THE FIVE OTHER MANIKINS MOST SEEN IN THE MARKETPLACE:

(1)  Charlie will provide audible feedback when chest compressions achieve a depth of at least 2 inches (AHA guideline).  Only one of the other 5 manikins provides this sort of feedback, but at a depth of less than 2 inches.  Charlie's replication of the feel and sound of rib cracking etc. provides additional evidence that chest compressions are being done properly while also facilitating longer recall of the necessary psychomotor skills.

(2)  Charlie will provide a soundtrack of the Bee Gees "Staying Alive" (used by AHA in its training videos) to set the proper pace to achieve the AHA guideline of 100 compressions per minute.  This feature will also result in more ingrained psychomotor skills and, thereby, improved recall.  Such a pacing feature is not found in any other CPR manikin, although 1 of the 5 manikins does provide some guidance with compression rate.

(3)  The ability of Charlie to replicate the nonlinear rebound of the chest during CPR provides a superior CPR training experience, because it provides an additional realistic hurdle to being able to achieve the AHA guideline of 100 compressions per minute.

(4)  Charlie also brings more realism to CPR training, because it requires 100 lbs of thrust (as suggested by the AHA) to achieve the proper chest compression depth consistent with the proper chest compression rate.  2 of the other five CPR manikins require a thrust of only about 50 lbs and 3 require thrusts ranging from 78 to 84 lbs.

 

AND SO...

As a result of its unique and groundbreaking features, Charlie will enable CPR trainees (both bystanders and professionals) to learn CPR faster, to learn CPR more effectively, and, as a result of the more intense "feel and sound" experience, to remember it longer.  This much more realistic training experience will give trainees the confidence that they will actually be able to save lives...and more lives will be saved.

The HCR team and many others believe, given (1) the recent change in emphasis by the AHA to the importance of quality chest compressions versus breathing issues and, (2) the previous lack of realism of CPR training, that thousands of people throughout the world will need to be retrained.  With your help, HCR and Charlie will be able to play a significant role in this effort.

 

WHAT NEEDS TO BE DONE TO MAKE THIS A REALITY?

The first version of HCR's patented "human chest dynamics" device has been beta tested by AHA and Red Cross directors and training personnel, fire departments, hospitals, and others.  Based upon the positive feedback and suggestions received (see beta test comments below), HCR is currently designing and building the second and refined prototype of the device.  Once this occurs and our $50,000 goal is achieved, HCR will build a final manufacturing prototype of Charlie.  We have also set a stretch goal of $80,000, which if achieved, will allow us to to manufacture an initial small run of 25 units and sell most of them to the already enthusiastic beta test audience.  We will also use a few units for promotional purposes, initiate key marketing steps, and attend key trade shows.  These initial sales and market exposure should position HCR to raise additional funding to get Charlie into the marketplace either through licensing the patent or via direct manufacture and sale.  We need your help to achieve these milestones (see below).

A FEW OF THE BETA TEST COMMENTS

Fire Department Medical Director - "Gentlemen, that's just how it should feel.  I think you guys have something here."

From Training Directors and Personnel - "Compression force and rebound feel quite accurate."  "It usually requires multiple compressions to crack through the ribs in a victim; the device does a good job simulating that."  "Would upgrade today if available."

 

OUR TEAM

Dan May, President and Founder  Dan was a lifeguard and water safety instructor for the American Red Cross and taught CPR to new lifeguards.  This experience, combined with his experience of administering CPR to a victim, made it clear to him that there is a need for more realistic CPR training manikins.  In 2009, Dan filed a patent application for a new CPR training device and started sketching the first prototype.

Bob Fick, Chief Operating Officer  Bob has an MBA and spent over 25 years as a chief financial officer of fast growing private and publicly traded technology companies, including leading several turnarounds.  Bob also provided management consulting services for ten years as business analyst and director for the Small Business Development Center in Tucson, Arizona.

Larry Bramlett, Chief Engineer  Working with Dan, Larry has been responsible for the engineering design and development of the HCR "human chest dynamics" device and manikin torso.  Larry has over 39 years of experience as a design engineer, engineering manager, and project manager, and has managed up to forty engineers and designers in contiguous technical efforts, including significant projects for Citicorp and NCR.

Wayne Truax, VP Sales and Marketing  Wayne spent over 24 years in the beverage industry where he rapidly progressed from route sales supervisor to general manager.  While leading his organization, Wayne developed a reputation for creating marketing strategies that frequently led to setting new sales records.  He was then recruited to manage the startup of a new coffee enterprise in Tucson, Arizona.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The HCR team has previous experience launching new ventures and realizes that challenges remain before Charlie can enter the marketplace successfully.

Complete Engineering and Design Effort  This effort will soon be completed for the second and more refined and extensive prototype.  The next task will be to convert some of the metal prototype materials to plastic while building the final manufacturing prototypes of the device and the torso manikin and optimizing manufacturing costs.

Identify the Initial Manufacturer and Suppliers and Negotiate Costs  Good progress has already been made identifying suppliers and negotiating costs for many parts.  This will be completed soon.  Selection of a manufacturer will be next.

Complete Initial Sales of Charlie to Key Customers  Initial sales of Charlie will be made to the beta test participants given their positive reactions to the device prototype.  This will result in getting Charlie exposed to some very key players with important roles in CPR training and emergency medical services, including the AHA, Red Cross, and many fire departments.

Additional Funding  Based upon the initial sales of Charlie and demonstrated marketplace demand, we believe that HCR will be in a position to approach professional investors for the next round of funding.  This round will be used (1) to license Charlie's patent to an established manufacturer and marketer of CPR manikins or (2) for direct manufacture and sale.

Additional Funding  Based upon the initial sales of Charlie and demonstrated marketplace demand, we believe that HCR will be in a position to approach professional investors for the next round of funding.  This round will be used (1) to license Charlie's patent to an established manufacturer and marketer of CPR manikins or (2) for direct manufacture and sale.

story:
Peter Gorman got bit really bad by a jungle bug - he might lose his leg, or worse.

Peter needs funds to help pay for medical costs - now.

We've set the goal at $15,000 but we need to exceed that as much as possible!


Peter is a noted and award-winning journalist and adventurer - also a damn good friend, father, brother, guide and simply all-around one of the good guys, and there ain't many good guys left.

For nearly 30 years Peter has been working with Ayahuasca, and in Peru in the deep jungle -- he is a living legend.

Let's keep it that way

This recent trip the jungle sunk its teeth in really, seriously deep and Peter picked up three different staph infections - a flesh eating bacteria - that tore into him and threatened to eat his leg away below the knee. 

As I write this, his leg has been saved - however, he's not out of the woods yet.

Peter is still fighting the infection - battling against it going systemic - throughout his entire body. 

Peter writes: "(It's) ...been in the muscle for six weeks. Been on drip for six weeks. In Iquitos, in the jungle, in Iquitos and here at the hospital and now here at home. I'm about to have an IV as a matter of fact. I've already lost a lot of muscle. I'm trying to keep it from reaching the bone and going systemic."

To witness the severity of the situation you can see an image of Peter's leg here and here



Now imagine that going throughout his entire body.

Let's stop that from happening.

UPDATE ON HEALING PROGRESS

Below are a slideshow and video made by one of Peter's friends - they are graphic - but show the healing process and progress Peter has made - and made so quickly thanks to all your support and good energy.


Peter has come very far but he's still in deep water...

Peter's long-time friend Alan Shoemaker writes:

"Peter Gorman is healing, it's a slow process... he'll eventually need a couple operations, skin grafts. He's strong and stubborn as a mule so he's pulling through this, thanks to his constitution. However, medical bills are what will kill him. Please, maybe you're read this before here and maybe you donated some funds to help. He's extremely grateful for all the help that has been sent his way, whether that was in the form of green energy or in your thoughts and prayers. He's still in deep water medically and financially, please take a look in your heart and in your pocketbook and see what you can do. Thanks!"


"...he has already spent 80 grand... and the two skin grafts, IF the leg is saved, will cost around 15 grand... and the antibotics he needs now and everything else, nursing care at home for a month, etc... so yes, this will bankrupt him easily... We can help. Please."


Peter needs funds to help pay for medical costs - now.


Peter is a strong and modest man.

He's been bit and ripped and rocked before - but he needs our help. 

Let's help

As many of you know, Peter occasionally takes small groups of guests out to experience real magic and profound healing and life-changes - way out in the deep green.

When out there, Peter asks the Universe and the Spirits and God and whoever to send all the bad things his way - so that his guests can remain safe.

He's the ultimate jungle body gaurd.

He's put himself in harms way so many times - and so many times he's been a man of steel, stopped time, grabbed the bullet, turned it into a feather.

But this time... this time... that bad-news bacterial bullet got him good.

This time WE need to be his body guard.

Right now WE need to jump in front of it all - with a strong and awesome financial shield.

Let's do it, let's help.

Now - as soon as possible - in any amount - big or small.


Peter's the kind of guy who takes care of everyone. He's a giver.

He takes care of a huge extended family in Texas and Peru - probably around 20 people - with their emergencies, their bills, their troubles - he's done this for years without question.


This Facebook page has been set up to connect and get updated on the situation.


Please donate any amount big or small.


Regarding Perks & Rewards?

Right now - who knows...
If possible we'll figure something out.


The big reward is for Peter, his family and friends and that he, and they, can all keep walking tall.


Thankyou

story:
Thank you to all whom have donated and helped me meet my goal. Please know that although I've met my goal all other donations going forward will go towards helping me afford the high cost of juicing, eating an organic diet and my monthly living expenses until I am well enough to work again. Thank you again & God bless.

Hi there,

Thank you very much for taking the time to read about my campaign. Please feel free to watch my video it explains my situation. Below you can find more details. For those of you that haven't watched the video here's an outline of my situation and what my campaign is all about.

My name is Anna Alexopoulos, I am 28 years old and I live in London, Ontario, Canada. For the past year and a half I've been fighting cancer. After 13 painful months, 4 different hospitals and 2 cities I was finally diagnosed with Cancer. I went from specialist to specialist literally begging for help. All the doctors I had, would not listen to me or even follow the proper procedures of testing me for cancer. I was simply told that the mass that was found on my cervix which was causing me to hemorrhage constantly was part of my natural anatomy and that I needed to go home and let my body heal. The doctor would not even do a biopsy of my tumor and I had no idea at the time what procudure to ask for. I simply trusted the Doctors. When I asked for a second opinion they refused saying that I did not need one because I was healthy aside from my constant bleeding and pain and they refused to book me another appointment at St. Michael's Hospital. The doctor that first saw my tumor but refused to even give me a biopsy of the mass is currently a teaching Doctor at St. Michael's Hospital in Toronto, Canada.

My family doctor in Toronto and the specialists I was seeing offered me no professional help nor compassion. I was struggling to even work at this point, I was so desperately ill and could not stop the bleeding. I decided to go home for a visit to my hometown of London, Ontario. I ended up having to see a walk in clinic doctor and had to lie about my past doctors and say that I just started having my symptoms because I found that when Doctor's heard that I've been bouncing around from specialist to specialist I think they felt that I was lying or there was nothing truly wrong with me and wouldn't even have a look at me or test me. 

The walk in Doctor from there sent me to see a specialist in London Ontario and after 2 biopsies of the mass it was discovered to be Cervical cancer. A few months later I had surgery at Sunnybrook Hospital, Toronto. During the surgery they discovered that I was stage 3 and the Cancer had spread to 2 lymphnodes and 18 lymphnodes along with my cervix had been removed. 24 hours after my surgery I was sent home from Toronto to London with a blood count of 64 out of 120 and a full blown infection. Four days after surgery I was admitted to London Health Sciences Center where I received 2 units of blood and 72 hours of intervenus antibiotics. My acting surgeon in London told me he was surprised I didn't die at home. The surgeon that did my operation would not return any of my calls nor would his secretary.

As soon as I was strong enough to eat again and walk again I started Pelvic Raditaion. They wanted to start me off with 1 external radiation, 2 internal radiations and 2 types of chemotherapy (cisplatnim & F5U) Because I was so ill and weak from the stress and complications we decided to start off with 28 rounds of external radiation. After 20 rounds my radiation oncologist terminated my treatment due to complications. My only option now for treatment is alternative holistic cancer treatment. 

My family has been supporting me for the past year as best they can but it's been extremely difficult for them. My mother is a single mom of 5 kids so we've never had money and my father is retired and 82. All my siblings have exhausted their resources trying to help me and I've received no help from the Government of Canada. I just got another denial letter in the mail after requesting help. Please know this campaign was an absolute last resort for me and I appreciate all thoughts and prayers. God Bless & Thank you. 

What's Next for Anna?

- After countless months of research I've decided to combine several of the most popular and proven holistic treatments for cancer. I am also waiting to see a top holistic doctor in Toronto whom is renowned for treating cancer patients and people with degenerative diseases. His fee and cost of additional medications and testing is extremely expensive. An average visit can run up to $600 with fee, medications and any additional testing that is required. 

- I'm also doing the Gerson Therapy at home. A general summary of it is a plant based organic diet that requires organic juices multiple times a day to constantly detoxify the body. The equipment and produce for this therapy costs about $2,000/mth. I cannot afford to do the entire treatment so I'm living off the plant based diet,  no caffine, no refined sugars or processed foods and juicing once or twice a day because I can't afford the product for the traditional 13 juices a day. 

Reference: https://gerson.org/gerpress/the-gerson-therapy/ also see this reference regarding the high costs of Gerson therapy  http://www.thewellnesswarrior.com.au/2011/07/the-real-price-of-gerson-therapy/


- Rife Generator. It's a holistic German built machine that is used to send frequencies through the body which is used to fight cancer. Reference: http://www.rifeenergymedicine.com/rifefaq.html

-Hemp Oil - Please see site for more information. www.simpson-oil.com 

All the funds raised will go directly to paying for my treatments, maintaining my Gerson therapy which I have recently stopped because my juicer broke and I can't afford a new one. It will also go to paying for my holistic specialist appointments and transportation. Please know that every cent will be honoured and go directly where it is needed and if you can't afford to donate I ask that you please share this campaign. 


Sending you Light & Love. 

Sincerely,

Anna Alexopoulos

alexoanna@gmail.com

story:
I'll be brief. I have dental bills upcoming. Roughly $10,000 worth of Dental work needs to be done. I'm a nearly 30 year old man with a job, a car, a house and mortgage, and bills. Lots of bills.

I make 32k a year. Nearly half that goes to my mortgage. Most of the rest goes to my bills, food, and existing loans. I don't have much money to spare. My chances of a raise are pretty much Nil, as the company had a company wide salary cut this year. I'm looking for other employment, but that's not a sure thing.

That's why I'm turning to IndieGogo. I need money, and I was hoping that the people of the internet might be charitable. I can't really offer much of anything in return- though I'll try and come up with some incentives- but I also don't expect much from this project. If I  get donations, I'll be happy. make my initial goal, I'll be overjoyed. If I get $1000, I'll be amazed. If I make anywhere NEAR $10,000, I will be flabbergasted. But there's no way to find out if I don't do it.

Please, everyone. Be kind. Donate a dollar. Spread the word.

And thank you. So much.

Hey all, Camp is trying for some great improvements. A simple one we can raise money for quickly is a Gaga Ball Pit. This is a great game that has been played at camp in make shift pits, but a permanent one would be AMAZING!

I think we can raise the funds in just 45 days. Let's do it. 

More perks to come...

story:
The Problem

Caregivers need help. The number of people becoming caregivers is rising every day, in every community. It is estimated that 90 million Americans are providing care for loved ones who are chronically ill, acutely ill, or suffering the limits of old age. One study reports that there are 43.5 million individuals caring for someone with Dementia or Alzheimers alone. In addition, there are over 3 million Registered Nurses and around 1 million doctors in the USA. When we add nursing assistants, therapists, technicians, chiropractors, acupuncturists, clergy, advocates and many more - we are talking about a really large number of caregivers.

Being a caregiver is hard. The difficulties of being a caregiver can become a burden, often carried in silence, wherein the needs of others override the need for self-care. This opens the door for neglecting one’s own mental, emotional and physical needs. This state of depletion, not only puts the caregivers health at risk, but can also impact the quality of the care they are providing. Taking time out for self-care is essential.

How We Are Helping

Our purpose is to inspire caregivers to recognize and embrace self-care as fundamental to their role.. If we can bring a ray of light into their days, if we can inspire deep breath moments, moments that help them constantly renew themselves on their journey, we will have done a good thing. It is important to recognize the work of caregivers, to bow in gratitude and to give them an opportunity to remember to take care of themselves.

The Book – The Dance of Caring

We have written an inspirational book that offers caregivers an opportunity to reset, breath and connect to self and purpose. It reminds the caregiver to invest in self-care with the knowledge that this is indeed not a selfish act, but one that renews their capacity to perform with compassion and love.

This book is a unique look at the world of caregiving and the importance of self-care explored through the lens of the Native American Hoop Dance, a dance centered around healing and a deep understanding of the shared human experience. It is our hope that this book may assist caregivers in becoming expansive in their own being, so that when they give care, they do so from a place of abundance, strength and inner harmony.

Self-Care Events – The Dance of Caring

We have designed both on-line and in-person events that offer caregivers a place to renew themselves, learn and practice self-care, and bring forward practices that can be integrated into their daily lives.

Why We Need Your Support

The Dance of Caring book is ready to go to print. In small volumes the cost per book is prohibitive, severely limiting access. To make the book affordable, so that as many caregivers as possible can benefit - we need to print in large volumes – which is beyond our reach without financial help.

The programs we have designed are ready to be implemented. We need some funds to implement them and get the work out. Our vision is to create programs that can be easily integrated into the lives of caregivers.

Beyond Money – Get Involved - Here Are Some Ways

  • Share this with others who can help spread the word
  • Let caregivers know that you care
  • Support a caregiver, so they can take some self-care time
  • Gift copies of the book to caregivers who need some inspiration
  • Sponsor a caregiver to a Dance of Caring online or in person workshop

A Note About Our Teams Work

Kathy Douglas is a nationally recognized Nurse Leader with relationships with leaders at top nursing organizations across the country. She has worked with Dance of Caring co-author Sara Moncada on previous projects, one of the most notable being the successfully creation and launch of the film NURSES If Florence Could See Us Now. Four years later, this heart-felt documentary continues to perform internationally in both the individual consumer and educational markets, and is available on Netflix, iTunes, Amazon, at Barnes and Nobel and more.

Eddie Madril is a nationally known Native American speaker, cultural artist, professor and guest lecturer working at universities across the country. With a growing community of indigenous groups from across the globe in partnership with strong relationships in the academic arena, Eddie is uniquely positioned to help bring awareness of this work to national Native American communities and beyond. He is also a host of the Bay Native Circle radio show on KPFA and can reach audiences through this following there.

Authors Bios

Eddie Madril, MA

Eddie is a member of the Pascua Yaqui tribe of Southern Arizona and Northern Sonora Mexico. He holds a MA in American Indian Studies/Ethnic Studies from SFSU, is the founder of Sewam American Indian Dance Company and is a representative of his culture as a dancer, singer, educator, playwright and filmmaker. He is currently a professor at San Francisco State University and has presented as a guest lecturer across the country on a variety of Native American issues at Tufts University, Stanford University, St. Mary's College, and Dominican University, among others. He has been an invited presenter for national organizations such as the ANCC National Magnet Conference (speaker), ONS Oncology Nurses Society (keynote speaker), and World Arts West's arts education program People Like Me. He sits on the board of World Arts West as well as on the Board of Directors for the Friendship House Association of American Indians, a drug and alcohol rehabilitation center in San Francisco.  He is a host on the radio show Bay Native Circle on KPFA. In 2011, he was recognized by KQED as an American Indian Bay Area Local Hero in recognition of his volunteer work in the community.

Sara Moncada

Sara has a unique and extensive background working both within the healthcare arena on a national level and also as a cultural artist. She has guest lectured at many educational institutions in Native American studies and has performed native dance and spoken to audiences representing the Native American community both here and abroad. Sara is Co-Founder of Wise Women Circles, a women owned and operated inspirational project/film production company. She was previously the Managing Director for the not-for-profit Institute for Staffing Excellence and Innovations and On Nursing Excellence, an organization devoted to inspiring and strengthening the effectiveness, recognition and well-being of nurses world-wide. In addition to her corporate work, Sara is an artist and educator. She is the Program Director for Sewam American Indian Dance, an organization that specializes in sharing the music, dance and arts of Native American culture across the country in both education and theatrical arenas. As a healing arts practitioner she is certified in massage therapy and Jin Shin Jyutsu, focused on whole-system wellness. For more than 15 years, her practice included work with children, athletes, dancers and the elderly with projects that range from investments in on-going wellness, to individuals working with serious illness or large health projects.

Kathy Douglas, RN, MHA

Kathy is a nationally recognized nurse leader, filmmaker and entrepreneur.  She appeared on the cover of Nurse Leader magazine in 2014 as Leader to Honor.  She has been on the executive team of several start-up companies, served on the editorial board of Nursing Economic$ magazine and founded the not-for-profit Institute for Staffing Excellence and Innovation.  Among her film projects, she directed the internationally distributed film NURSES If Florence Could See Us Now, a tribute to the profession and The Song Within Sedona, an exploration of the wisdom of everyday women. Kathy is a registered nurse (RN), holds a Masters Degree in Health Administration from UCSF and is a graduate of Stanford University Business School, Executive Program. She is a two-time cancer survivor living in Northern California, approaching each day with gratitude and deeply enjoying her grandchildren, Ellie and Parker.

What We Need

We are raising money to do the first printing run of books and launch the first on-line and in-person workshop events.  Other levels of donation are listed so you can see what we can accomplish with even more funding.

self-care explored through the lens of the Native American Hoop Dance, a dance
centered around healing and a deep understanding of the shared human
experience. It is our hope that this book may assist caregivers in becoming
expansive in their own being, so that when they give care, they do so from a
place of abundance, strength and inner harmony.
Self-Care
Events – The Dance of Caring
We have designed both on-line and in-person events that
offer caregivers a place to renew themselves, learn and practice self-care, and
bring forward practices that can be
integrated into their daily lives.
Why We Need Your Support
The Dance of Caring book is ready to go to print. In small
volumes the cost per book is prohibitive, severely limiting access. To make the book affordable, so that as many
caregivers as possible can benefit - we need to print in large volumes – which is
beyond our reach without financial help.
The programs we have designed are ready to be implemented. We
need some funds to implement them and get the work out. Our vision is to create
programs that can be easily integrated into the lives of caregivers. 
Beyond Money – Get Involved
- Here Are Some Ways

Share this with others who can help spread the
word
Let caregivers know that you care
Support a caregiver, so they can take some
self-care time
Gift copies of the book to caregivers who need
some inspiration
Sponsor a caregiver to a Dance of Caring online
or in person workshop

A Note About Our Teams
Work
Kathy
Douglas is a nationally recognized Nurse Leader with relationships with leaders
at top nursing organizations across the country. She has worked with Dance of Caring co-author Sara Moncada on
previous projects, one of the most notable being the successfully creation and
launch of the film NURSES If Florence
Could See Us Now. Four years later, this heart-felt documentary continues
to perform internationally in both the individual consumer and educational
markets, and is available on Netflix, iTunes, Amazon, at Barnes and Nobel and
more. 
Eddie
Madril is a nationally known Native American speaker, cultural artist, professor
and guest lecturer working at universities across the country. With a growing
community of indigenous groups from across the globe in partnership with strong
relationships in the academic arena, Eddie is uniquely positioned to help bring
awareness of this work to national Native American communities and beyond. He
is also a host of the Bay Native Circle radio show on KPFA and can reach audiences
through this following there.
Authors Bios
Eddie Madril, MA
Eddie
is a member of the Pascua Yaqui tribe of Southern Arizona and Northern Sonora Mexico. He holds a MA in American
Indian Studies/Ethnic Studies from SFSU, is the founder of Sewam American
Indian Dance Company and is a representative of his culture as a dancer,
singer, educator, playwright and filmmaker. He is currently a professor at San
Francisco State University and has presented as a guest lecturer across the
country on a variety of Native American issues at Tufts University, Stanford
University, St. Mary's College, and Dominican University, among others. He has been an invited presenter for national
organizations such as the ANCC National Magnet Conference (speaker), ONS Oncology
Nurses Society (keynote speaker), and World Arts West's arts education program
People Like Me. He sits on the board of World Arts West as well as on the Board
of Directors for the Friendship House Association of American Indians, a drug
and alcohol rehabilitation center in San Francisco.  He is a host on the radio show Bay Native
Circle on KPFA. In 2011, he was recognized by KQED as an American Indian Bay
Area Local Hero in recognition of his volunteer work in the community.
Sara Moncada
Sara
has a unique and extensive background working both within the healthcare arena
on a national level and also as a cultural artist. She has guest lectured at
many educational institutions in Native American studies and has performed
native dance and spoken to audiences representing the Native American community
both here and abroad. Sara is Co-Founder of Wise Women Circles, a women owned
and operated inspirational project/film production company. She was previously
the Managing Director for the not-for-profit Institute for Staffing Excellence and Innovations and On Nursing
Excellence, an organization devoted to inspiring and strengthening the
effectiveness, recognition and well-being of nurses world-wide. In addition to
her corporate work, Sara is an artist and educator. She is the Program Director
for Sewam American Indian Dance, an organization that specializes in sharing
the music, dance and arts of Native American culture across the country in both
education and theatrical arenas. As a healing arts practitioner she is
certified in massage therapy and Jin Shin Jyutsu, focused on whole-system
wellness. For more than 15 years, her practice included work with children,
athletes, dancers and the elderly with projects that range from investments in
on-going wellness, to individuals working with serious illness or large health
projects. 
Kathy Douglas, RN, MHA
Kathy is a nationally recognized nurse leader, filmmaker and
entrepreneur.  She appeared on the cover of Nurse Leader magazine in 2014
as Leader to Honor.  She has been on the executive team of several start-up
companies, served on the editorial board of Nursing Economic$ magazine and
founded the not-for-profit Institute for Staffing Excellence and Innovation.
 Among her film projects, she directed the internationally distributed
film NURSES If Florence Could See Us Now, a tribute to the profession
and The Song Within Sedona, an exploration of the wisdom of everyday women. Kathy is a registered nurse (RN), holds a Masters Degree
in Health Administration from UCSF and is a graduate of Stanford University
Business School, Executive Program. She is a two-time cancer survivor
living in Northern California, approaching each day with gratitude and deeply
enjoying her grandchildren, Ellie and Parker.
What We Need
We are raising money to do the first printing run of books
and launch the first on-line and in-person workshop events.  Other levels of donation are listed so you
can see what we can accomplish with even more funding.

story:
Hi my name is Bryan, and I’m a 23year old former collegiate athlete playing both football and running track. My goal in life is to serve my country as a Special Forces operator in the United States Navy, but a couple months ago that dream got delayed. I completely tour my ACL and ripped the rest of the ligaments in my knee, anybody who follows sports knows that a torn ACL is an automatic 1 year of inactivity after the date of surgery. This injury came at the most inopportune time, the spring of my final year of school right before the start of my last track season; this is not where the problem lies. The problem is now that I’m done with school, I have 100K in student loans on top of an expensive knee surgery, I can’t get a job until I’m back on my feet and I definitely can’t follow my dream of joining the military until about this time next year when my knee is finally healed.

During my treatment the therapist uses a (stim) machine to fight muscular atrophy and deep venous thrombosis which is blood clots due to inactivity, but the treatment is only done on the leg that had surgery, my idea is to buy a Muscle Stimulator (stim machine)  for the rest of my body. I’m growing week while I recover. With all my student loans, surgery bills and inability to work right now, I just can’t afford any new expense!

Compex Sport Elite Muscle Stimulator = $849.00

Compex Easy Snap electro pad - 2" x 2", 4 qty =$14.99

 Compex Easy Snap electro pad - 2" x 4", 2 qty =$ 14.99

Total:  $878.98

Any little bit helps I truly appreciate the help. Thanks !!!!

story:
Citizens rule and Big Data drools!!

Hello Everyone! We at JB Webnology Group are a collection of bright minds working toward building sites such as FreeYourMemory.com to create a better online experience for the citizens of this world.

We are currently tackling the Vendor Relationship Management, Customer Relationship Management, and Personal Relationship Management sectors to house these items all in one place. Yes we know that sounds like a lot and it is, but once we get it all in order, you will get to enjoy what we hope will become a very useful Life Management Platform.

Our Mission

Our mission is to provide a Platform that allows the average Business Owner to efficiently and affordably communicate with those who Support them, while empowering Citizens to manage those Vendor Relationships, for a more personalized Advertising experience.

Our Beliefs

We believe that every Citizen has a right to be both a Customer and a Vendor. The problem is Advertising is too costly for most of us to be both, so we mostly get stuck being consumers to a few large Vendors. Well all of that is about to change, and not only have we made it possible for the little guy to get his message out to the world, we’ve done much more than that.

Current Problems (That we plan to solve)

  • No easy way to Remember Events, Promotions, Ads, etc.
  • Advertising is currently built around Global and not Local, which is where we step in.
  • Current Customer Relationship  Management (CRM) systems  try to “capture” people’s data and use guess work.
  • Facebook Ads and Google Adwords  do not help build “Relationships” between Consumers and Vendors.
  • Analytics on most Advertising platforms are confusing.

 

The Breakdown (This is pretty much for the Business Side)

(Vendors) will want to create an Announcer/Venue on our site.

They will be given a "Support Us" button on their display on our site. (API's for websites will be available soon)

Once they have an Announcer or Venue, they are ready to make Announcements.

Any Announcements (The Advertisements) that they make can be placed in "Our Community" for other members of our site to "Remember", or if they have "Supporters" they have the ability to push Announcements directly to those Supporter's “Memory Bank” (like an email inbox/calendaring system, but much smarter).

Well it is pretty simple really! The holy grail of Advertising is having others "Remember" what you are promoting, right?

So lets say you are promoting a 25% Off Jeans in July Sale! Well you most likely want to start promoting this sale at least a month early so you can get as many people in, to save a little money as you try to off-load those jeans from inventory. Each person that sees your Announcement will be able to click "Remember This" and keep up with it in their Memory Bank.

This means anytime they go into their Memory Bank(inbox/calendaring system) between the date they Remembered your promotion and the date it expires,that "25% Off Jeans in July Sale!" is going to be slowly, but surely working its way into the members vision. All Announcements on Free Your Memory are time sensitive and can be sorted  "chronologically" if that is the sort option that is chosen. (Much better than email, and all expired Announcements are deleted automatically.)

 

Precise Analytics (unlike clicks or impressions)

Announcement Tracking Terms

  • Unaware: Number of members who have not yet viewed your Announcement.

  • Aware: Number of members that have opened the Announcement.

  • Not Interested: Number of Members that chose to [Forget It] before the courtesy window.

  • Withdrawn: Number of Members that have Remembered, then chosen to Forget it before it expires.

  • Undecided: Number of Members that are Promoted or Recommended to, but have not Remembered the Announcement after the courtesy window expires.

  • Remembered: Number of Members that are currently Remembering the Announcement.

 

How do we Charge? (Our site has more info.)

On our site we allow you to purchase "Credits" in different package amounts. Credits cost only 10 cents.

Credits are only taken when:

  • A Member finds your Announcement in our Community and decides to Remember it.
  • A Supporter receives an Announcement in their Memory Bank and decides to Keep it, or they become "Undecided" due to non action on their part.

(Either way the Announcement stays with a person and is usable until the event expires.)

Basically for $5 dollars you could have 50 people Remember your (party, performance, promotion, etc.)

We do not charge for clicks, impressions, or anything like that. We do not believe you should have "Credits" taken unless a real service is provided, such as an Announcement that stays with a person and is usable until the event expires, as stated above.

 

How Citizens Rule (The Personal Side)

On Free Your Memory your privacy is our top priority, and Big Data isn't going to like it. All those Cookies they use to track your every move, all those attempts they make to get you to see their Ads!

It's a no brainer in our opinion that citizens will choose to Remember what they want to Remember and there isn't much you can do about that.

 

Your Privacy Options

Public Supporter:

  • Profile Picture is shown under Supporters area and Announcements can be tailored and sent directly to each one of these Supporters individually.

Anonymous Supporters:

  • Anonymous- This adds a count to the Anonymous Supporter tally of an Announcer/Venue, and no identity is shown.
  • Announcements cannot be tailored to these individuals.

 

What the Future Holds

 "Vendor Request"

These are what some are calling "Intentcasting" and we understand that one thing has to be built at a time. This is definitely a part of our vision for what the site is to become, but words we live by are: "One day at a time"

 

About the Team

My name is Jason Barker and I am the Creator and CEO of the project. I have 10 yrs of technology experience under my belt, with many different specialities ranging from Installing Talking Bus systems all over the United States to setting up City Surveillance Systems for police stations throughout North Carolina. My lead developer and CTO is Geoffery Reiss, with 25+ years of database/application design & programming experience. Our (very part-time) front end developer/UI genius is Natasha Votypka with 15+ years of experience.

 

Here is our story and how you will be helping!

I personally have 19 months of R & D in this project, boot-strapping it the whole way, growing my team through Craigslist ads and pure determination, and loving every minute of it. Our biggest problem is and always has been lack of Capital!!  Investors are very hard to find and even harder when they are continuing to throw Big money at Big Data or these CRM sytstems that like following us around.

My team has taken on the risk with me and they have been working without compensation right along side me for months. My front end developer, Natasha has to work so much elsewhere to feed her family and pay her bills that our development of Free Your Memory is slowed tremendously. I am having to take side jobs to continue paying hosting fees, laywer fees, living costs, etc. My lead developer/CTO, Geoffrey is having to work part-time as well.  Basically as you can see we are all spread thin and could really use your help!

Your contributions give us:

  • The opportunity to work together more, which would allow for more focus and TLC to be put into our platform.
  • More Confindence about the strides we are taking in building this platform, and the real impact it could make in people's lives.
  • Better chances at making this Platform an enormous Success, and taking it to the next level...

Feedback is Very Important to Us!!

  • Please tell us what you think about the Idea!
  • Tell us how you could use something like this for your business or personal life!
  • Tell us how it could be better!
  • Tell us anything we could work on, as we are very hungry for Feedback!
  • Please ask us questions!

 

Now to the Prizes! (We believe Our Platform is the real Prize!!)

"Remember This" T-shirt:

 

 

 Free Your Memory Handouts:

We have a few (Example Handouts) below for you to choose from that we will include your information in, that way you'll be ready to go when the time comes. Tell us what number Handout you like (#1,#2,#3,#4), tell us what info you want included in the blank spaces, excluding ID which we will provide for you. Next just look for them in your mailbox!

 

Example Handout #1

Example Handout #1 Filled out with your information

Additional Handouts below (#2,#3,#4 in order)


 

Announcement Credits:

"Credits" are to be purchased by Announcers/Venues planning to make Announcements to the Public or, to their Supporters. Announcers/Venues can gain Supporters without making an Announcement, but cannot make an Announcement without purchasing "Credits".

story:
If you're not Kenyan, being chased by wild animals, or Meb there's only one 

reason to run 26.2 miles....CHARITY!


Well I'm obviously not Kenyan, being chased by animals (contrary to the 

picture), and my name is Matt McCoy....SO in conjunction with running the 

120th Boston Marathon April 18th, I will be running on behalf of the Jumpstart 

Foundation.


                  


Jumpstart is a nationally recognized charity that trains college students and 

community volunteers to teach and mentor the impoverished youth around 

the nation. Jumpstart allows children from low-income communities to start 

on an even playing field, by helping them to develop the language and literacy 

skills needed to prepare them for school and lifelong success. 


 


I care about this cause enough to get on the struggle bus yet again 

and destroy my body for a another marathon, so join up with me and 

donate money to a cause that helps kids around the nation get off the 

struggle bus and on the success train!


If you would like to help me raise money for this cause just pick a donation 

level or give whatever amount you feel inclined to give. All funds received up 

to $7500 go directly to the charity, and anything after that will be used to 

help with race fees, travel, and other expenses associated with the marathon. 

So don't be afraid to make it rain like we're dancing for a college education, 

and if you do not want to receive a perk simply donate and you'll be 

appreciated just as much!


And now a bonus message from myself and 2016 American Heavyweight 

Olympian, and sign language specialist Cam Awesome!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Hayden! I am a 21-year-old college student attending Ferris State University. I am currently studying Biology with a minor in Psychology, but am eager to study Higher Education/Student Affairs in graduate school. I am an RA on campus, the president of our LGBT organization and when I'm not studying, I love to play ukulele, sing, craft, work out and hang out with my friends. I also happen to be transgender. 

I started testosterone hormone replacement therapy about three months ago and have legally changed my name. I am very excited about taking these steps to "become" me!

One thing I need to get done soon is have surgery on my chest so it can look like that of a man's. I have detailed some of the many medical problems that occur in my every day life with a size 40M chest in my video. This procedure is expensive and often not covered by insurance. 

This is why I need your help! I know many of these crowd funders exist for top surgery-- but that is why I have offered many incentives for donation. Think of these incentives as a little "gift" I can give back to you for your generous contribution for my well-being. I like to think I'm pretty crafty and a little creative, so these items are mostly hand-made by myself. 

I only ship in the US!

What I Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown of my surgery costs so you know where the money is going:

$5975 for the surgery

$180 for storing my belongings over the summer

$973 for my parents and I to stay at New Beginnings Retreat

Perks available:

  • Ask me a question!
  • A set of three stickers



  • Mystery sharpie drawing
  • Hand-made Puzzle Pride Rings and Bracelets (or other LGBT related symbols such as the equal sign)
  • Writing
  • Art commissions 
  • T-Shirts

  • Coasters

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to use Indie GoGo's share tools! Spread the word if you can't contribute.

I have detailed some of the many medical problems that occur in my every day life with a size 40M chest in my video. This procedure is expensive and often not covered by insurance. This is why I need your help! I know many of these crowd funders exist for top surgery-- but that is why I have offered many incentives for donation. Think of these incentives as a little "gift" I can give back to you for your generous contribution for my well-being. I like to think I'm pretty crafty and a little creative, so these items are mostly hand-made by myself. I only ship in the US!   What I Need & What You Get Here is the breakdown of my surgery costs so you know where the money is going:
$5975 for the surgery
$180 for storing my belongings over the summer
$973 for my parents and I to stay at New Beginnings Retreat
Perks available:


Ask me a question!
A set of three stickers








Mystery sharpie drawing
Hand-made Puzzle Pride Rings and Bracelets (or other LGBT related symbols such as the equal sign)

Writing
Art commissions 
T-Shirts



Coasters



    Other Ways You Can Help Please feel free to use Indie GoGo's share tools! Spread the word if you can't contribute.

story:
Short Summary

Most of your online data is held in datastores of privately owned companies, with obscure privacy policies. What about getting back control, and keeping your data in the safety of your kitchen, while still reaching it from anywhere in the world? What about communicating with your friends in private and secure way, without disclosing it to anyone but the real recipients?

I want to create a Raspberry Pi based box and an Android™ application that lets you do just that. The set up should be trivial for non-technical people, and you can reach your files, contacts and calendars from your phone, from wherever you may be. The Tor network guarrantees that you don't even expose the location of your precious stuff to the public, yet you find your way to it. In the future, it will also be possible to set up communication channels between compatible devices that cannot be tampered with, and no eavesdropping is possible.

Who am I?

I've worked at a renowned security company for 1,5 years, developing an appliance that targeted the enterprise (not the spaceship, though). I have been coding for almost 10 years now, and have gained professional experience in handling and architecting complex projects, along with some clues about project management. I quit my job, moved to Glasgow to do a degree in Computer Science and Business and Management, and I'm committed to work on high-quality open-source software to support myself.

What I Need & What You Get

I need roughly $35 000 to work on this project for a year, the majority of which I will spend on the perks, and the rest on living costs. If I can't meet the goal, but receive enough funding for a couple of months, I will start the project anyway, and will work on it for as long as I can. For the schedule and the planned features from a technological point of view you should consult the GitHub repository.

What does the package include?

  • Raspberry Pi
  • 32GB SD card
  • case
  • wall brick
  • 1m patch cable
  • stickers

How does it look like?

In collaboration with the wonderful guys at ModMyPi, I am happy to tell you that your KitchenSync box will look absolutely stunning beside your router. A picture is worth a thousand words, so here you go. Fitted with a KitchenSync logo, your device will sport this cool case when it gets to your door.

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

In case I don't reach the desired goal of $35 000, I'm going to work on the project for as long as I can anyway. I'm willing to deliver everybody their perks, but if I collect only a handful of money, that means that I can't work on this full-time, and some delays are to be expected. I'm optimistic about the effort it takes to make a usable product, and I'm convinced that even if I can only work on this project part-time, your perks will be delivered with minimal delays.

The Impact

With the widespread use of smartphones, and the decline of the desktop computer, it is natural that the way you store and access your personal files needed a change. Corporations were built on the simple concept of handling your mail, your personal files, your relationships, and, basically, everything about you that can be expressed in bits and bytes. You don't have to store practically anything on your laptop anymore if you have an active Internet connection, which, chances are, you have all the time in your palm.

The data you upload to such services are stored in huge datastores of those companies, basically magical black boxes, in which you put stuff, and you can retrieve it when you need it. The problem with the magical black boxes is that you don't, and can't know how it works, let alone control what happens in there. You cannot know how your data is handled, and who can access it, and how safely it is stored. Employees of the service provider, or national secret services may interact with your stuff without your or anyone's knowledge or permission.

I've started to abandon the corporate cloud and moved to a virtual private server I rent a couple of months ago. It has been working fine, but lacks certain features I have wanted to implement from the beginning. Thinking about the work to create a system that is suitable for only myself and then document it for technical-minded people is just overwhelming compared to the work that a hopefully one-size-fits-all solution would require to implement.

Thus came the idea of KitchenSync, that will let me and you take our data home, and trust it to open-source, free software, and a box that can be simply unplugged to take it offline. The user experience should be straightforward, portable, and familiar to anyone. Unlike current solutions, you don't have to install software to VPSs, keep your desktop computer running, or tinker with your home router settings so that you can reach it from the outside. All of these should be handled automatically. Using open standards ensures that you're not locked in to using only KitchenSync software for accessing or serving your data.

The KitchenSync simply has to be plugged in to the mains and your router, and with the app on your Android phone that is connected to your home WiFi, you can set it up instantly. From then on, you'll be able to use it just like your Google or iCloud account, wherever you are. All of the KitchenSync related software will be both free of charge, and free to tinker with, released under the MIT license. For technical details and specific features implemented in the different milestones I set, check out the repository on GitHub.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may join and contribute to the project not only through contributing funds, but many other ways as well: contribute code on GitHub, artwork, ideas, or any other way you think would be beneficial for reaching the ultimate world dominanation. If you're not a technical person, I'll be grateful for a tweet, a share, a like, a +1, a mail on your favourite mailing list, or a link pasted to the IRC channel you see fit. Indiegogo provides one-click solutions for many of these, feel free to use them.

What about FreedomBox?

I've only come across the FreedomBox project recently, and still decided I should do a separate solution for a similar problem. The FreedomBox project started a couple of years ago, and as of yet, they did not release any stable-looking bundles. I also think that FreedomBox serves a different purpose than KitchenSync, although I might end up incorporating similar functionality into KitchenSync at some point.

The features the FreedomBox team wants to push into the stable version seem to be more targeted at journalists, and freedom rights activists, where top-notch encryption is crucial. There's nothing wrong with that. My goal, though, is to provide a solution for ordinary people, where they can store their private data, like contacts, calendars, to-do lists and files, and backups, and reach it from either their laptop or their mobile phone wherever they may be, and feel secure about it. I want the whole process to take no effort, and be as convenient, fluid and straightforward as possible.

story:
My name is Margie and I am 66 years old. I have stage four cancer and am trying alternative treatments. After four years I feel I may have a chance to survive long enough to see my granddaughter graduate from high school but only if I get some help paying for the treatments that insurance does not cover. I have exhausted all my savings, my credit and other resources. My granddaughter has Cerebral Palsy and both her parents are in prison because of drug addiction.  Won't you please help me to stay above ground just for a few years? Thank you for your consideration. God bless.

 

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hello.

My name is Jennifer Johnson. I was diagnosed with IHSS, now called HOCM (Hypertrophic Obstructive CardioMyopathy - Heart Disease)  in February of 2011 when I was 5 months pregnant with my son. I am a 30 years old woman, married to my wonderful husband, Robert, with two beautiful children - my daughter Mikayla who is 2 1/2 and my son Malykai who is 1. (Pictured Above)

During the course of my heart journey, since diagnosis, I have found out that I need open heart surgery to have a septal myomectomy and a mechanical mitral valve replacement. Further conversation with this surgeon has made me understand that surgery is needed very soon. In his words, "There aren’t very many cases like you out walking around."

In an extensive conversation with the surgeon, I found out that I need to get my dental work fixed before I can continue with my heart journey. I have neglected my teeth for some time now because of the overwhelming expense of dental work vs the expense of caring for two small children; my kids have always won. I am now in serious need of some pretty expensive procedures. Being on Medicaid and having what they call a "share of cost", bills are stacking up that we don’t have the money for. Now I have to think about paying for my teeth before fixing my heart. I am concerned if I am even going to make it until surgery.

My husband works a low wage job, less then full time, trying to support the 4 of us. He is a very dedicated man who will stop at nothing to make sure he keeps a roof over our head. Most often he works his regular job and then goes off in the evenings to complete side work to make ends meet.

With my current medical standing, it has caused him a great deal of stress about how we are going to afford everything - from dental work needed before surgery and then surgical after-care while he has to work to continue to provide. We have currently hit a major financial road block.

Today to ask for help to get the proper dental work completed so that I can move on with my open heart surgery and continue to care for my two beautiful children who mean the world to me.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Please share this page with anyone and everyone....

Thank you sooooo much for looking.

story:
Simple Actions. Big Smiles.

At The Bam&Boo we believe that simple actions make a difference. Creating products that bring more ecological and social responsibility to the market without incurring drastic changes has always been our main goal! That's why we decided to create The Bam&Boo Toothpaste.

 

The Bam&Boo Toothpaste

Despite the growing trend of ecological products in the market, it is still very difficult to find a natural toothpaste that works like a standard one. With an aluminium package, natural ingredients and cruelty-free production, The Bam&Boo Toothpaste aims to revolutionise.

Shhhh! We have a little secret for you.....The Bam&Boo Toothpaste is not like the others. It will actually leave your mouth feeling clean and with an amazing fresh minty breath ;)

 

A natural, vegan and eco-friendly toothpaste delivered directly to your door.

 

Whenever YOU need it!

With a subscription model, an eco-friendly toothpaste will be delivered to your mailbox whenever you desire. Shipping is free! And guess what? You don't have to worry about your toothpaste finishing when you need it the most. We've got your back! And we’ll make sure your smile will never fade away.

 

Actions speak louder than words

Nowadays, there are numerous brands stating they are vegan or 100% natural. As a sustainable and eco-friendly brand, we decided to certify our toothpaste in order to increase trust among our conscious and mindful community. This way we keep greenwashing off the shelves.

The NATRUE Label 

Following strict requirements, the NATRUE label is already an international benchmark for authentic natural and organic cosmetic products. The Bam&Boo Toothpaste is certified by Natrue as it only has natural, derived natural and nature identical ingredients.

 

The Vegan Society Trademark

The Bam&Boo Toothpaste is also totally vegan and registered by the Vegan Society Trademark. A trademark used on labels worldwide as the authentic standard for products free from animal ingredients and animal testing.

 

One tree a day keeps the climate change away

According to a study from the University of Oxford, trees are the best technology to suck carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and reverse global warming. So, we have embraced this idea with a local environmental organisation, Plantar Uma Árvore (literally Planting a Tree). 

We are very happy to share our commitment to actively compensate the excess carbon generated from our delivery service. It means that we are focused on creating an environmental benefit by removing additional CO2 from the atmosphere. In other words, we are striving to be carbon negative or rather climate positive :)

 

Some of our most loved products

 

Timeline

The Bam&Boo Team

Starting from scratch has never been easy. But it surely makes it more rewarding! The sustainability sector has been growing a lot throughout the years and coping with competition can be quite challenging. However, at The Bam&Boo we have joined the best team to achieve the desired goals and come up with great results. We are extremely grateful for everyone that has been part of this stimulating process, in particular our awesome community. Let's keep smiling together!

Thank you! Obrigado!

story:
Fit in Your Fitness with FlyteBike™
Portable Pedals - Anywhere, Anytime

WHAT IS FLYTEBIKE™?

FlyteBike™ Portable Pedals are the planet’s first truly portable exercise pedals. FlyteBike™ has unique, patent pending design features which separate it from other stationary pedal devices.  FlyteBike Portable Pedals is 3 ½ pounds, folds flat and goes anywhere with you in its own bag.

Unlike other pedal products which are made of heavy steel, with rods that can heat up and burn you, FlyteBike™ has been designed with a Patent Pending lightweight aluminum, which does not conduct heat.

Here's more good news... you'll burn 10 calories for every minute that you gently pedal with FlyteBike™, that's 300 calories in just 30 minutes while sitting at your desk or watching your favorite TV show. Now you can feel great, live longer and get fit, anytime, anywhere.

Here's more exciting news! We're also rolling out FlyteBike Smart Pedal™ sensor and tracking app here at IndieGoGo! Our Smart Pedal™ is a digital IoT (Internet of Things) add-on for use with Corporate Wellness and healthcare discounts, physical therapy, and for tracking personal progress.


                    

WHY FLYTEBIKE™?

Broadway Star turned serial inventor, Robin Palmer, couldn't stand just sitting there for one more minute during her day. She says, "Necessity has always been the mother of my inventions. I asked myself, 'What if I could fit in my fitness during my work day? What if I could prevent cabin fever, blood clots and jet lag right from my seat on an airplane?''

Sitting is the New Smoking. Have you ever added up all the time you spend sitting every day? Most of us sit at work all day and then go home and sit three to four more hours every night in front of a computer, laptop or television screen. It’s easy to see how most people could spend up to fourteen hours a day in a sedentary seated position. Sitting all day has taken a serious toll on our health and bodies.

Has Flying Got You Down? Blood clots affect 900,000 Americans and kill 160,000 of them every year. Flying is a leading cause, due to sitting for hours in cabin pressure, which restricts the flow of oxygen. Palmer says, "Personally, when I hit the 4 hour mark on a long flight, I couldn't stand just sitting there for one more minute and getting up to stretch my legs wasn't always an option. I've done 12 successful test flights where FlyteBiking prevented cabin fever and jet lag! Also, surprising but true: TSA agents have never once mentioned or inspected my FlyteBike bag and flight attendants and passengers don't even notice I am pedaling in my seat!"

It's All About the Blood Flow. Research shows that pedaling is the perfect way to pump blood to your brain and throughout your body. Pedaling for just a few minutes during your day boosts your mood and your metabolism!

Just like strolling on the treadmill desk, the goal is gentle movement to oxygenate your blood. Don't worry, you won't be sweating at work or on the plane... unless, of course, you want to!

FLYTEBIKE IS NEAT™ CERTIFIED

NEAT™ stands for the science of Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis, developed by Mayo Clinic.

WHERE CAN YOU FLYTEBIKE™?

You can feel better, lose weight and live longer by pedaling just minutes a day anytime, anywhere – at work, at home, on the go - even on long flights! ​​

Successful business owner increases productivity at work.
Bestselling author, speaker and success expert, Debra Poneman, loves burning calories while she works.

Stay fit with FlyteBike on vacation


Prevent Blood Clots and Jet Lag on Long Flights

FLYTEBIKE™ FEATURES


 

WANT TO TRACK YOUR PROGRESS AND SAVE MONEY?

FlyteBike's optional Smart Pedals™ have a built-in sensor and tracking app. Health insurance and corporate wellness programs provide discounts for employers and employees who to track their progress.

FLYTEBIKE™ MOBILE APP

With FlyteBike™ Smart Pedals™ and its mobile application, users will be able to track their progress. With exercise tips and calorie tracking, FlyteBike™ users can stay on track with their wellness.

LIFT YOUR MOOD & METABOLISM – ANYWHERE, ANYTIME!

Senior increases her blood flow and energy right at home.
Inventor prevents blood clots in her hotel room after a long flight...

and speeds up her metabolism in the passenger seat on long car rides!

Former Broadway star, Robin Palmer, FlyteBikes while singing her FlyteBike song

OUR PRESS

 

ABOUT US

ROBIN B. PALMER-FOUNDER & INVENTOR

FlyteBike™ Portable Pedals was invented by serial inventor and former longtime Broadway star, Robin Palmer. As Robin Boudreau (her maiden name), Robin played Linda Ronstadt’s little sister in "The Pirates of Penzance," co-starred with David Cassidy in "Joseph & the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat," and sang Memory in "CATS."

Robin also invented My Wake UP Call® Motivational Alarm Clock® Messages and My Good Night Messages™. Now licensed by Audible (Amazon), these messages contain over 100 hours of patented digital content featuring the Dalai Lama and other thought leaders who wake you up to the life of your dreams. (Apps, Mp3s).

Over the past year, Palmer has FlyteBiked at home, at offices around the country, and has enjoyed 12 successful "test flytes” around the world in first class, business and coach.

                                                                Feel Well at Any Age

                                                Boost Your Metabolism on Vacation

                                         Increase Energy & Productivity Right at your Desk

                Burn Calories on your commute, at Hotels & Resorts, Even on Long Flights
 

OUR FLYTEBIKE™ ALL-STAR CREW

The FlyteBike crew combines decades of experience in innovative product development, manufacturing, and health and fitness. Our team includes Dr. Neil Paton, an MIT PhD with 30 aerospace alloy patents who helped to build the US Space Shuttle!

story_txt:
Fit in Your Fitness with FlyteBike™Portable Pedals - Anywhere, AnytimeWHAT IS FLYTEBIKE™?FlyteBike™ Portable Pedals are the planet’s first truly portable exercise pedals. FlyteBike™ has unique, patent pending design features which separate it from other stationary pedal devices.  FlyteBike Portable Pedals is 3 ½ pounds, folds flat and goes anywhere with you in its own bag.Unlike other pedal products which are made of heavy steel, with rods that can heat up and burn you, FlyteBike™ has been designed with a Patent Pending lightweight aluminum, which does not conduct heat.Here's more good news... you'll burn 10 calories for every minute that you gently pedal with FlyteBike™, that's 300 calories in just 30 minutes while sitting at your desk or watching your favorite TV show. Now you can feel great, live longer and get fit, anytime, anywhere.Here's more exciting news! We're also rolling out FlyteBike Smart Pedal™ sensor and tracking app here at IndieGoGo! Our Smart Pedal™ is a digital IoT (Internet of Things) add-on for use with Corporate Wellness and healthcare discounts, physical therapy, and for tracking personal progress.                    WHY FLYTEBIKE™?Broadway Star turned serial inventor, Robin Palmer, couldn't stand just sitting there for one more minute during her day. She says, "Necessity has always been the mother of my inventions. I asked myself, 'What if I could fit in my fitness during my work day? What if I could prevent cabin fever, blood clots and jet lag right from my seat on an airplane?''Sitting is the New Smoking. Have you ever added up all the time you spend sitting every day? Most of us sit at work all day and then go home and sit three to four more hours every night in front of a computer, laptop or television screen. It’s easy to see how most people could spend up to fourteen hours a day in a sedentary seated position. Sitting all day has taken a serious toll on our health and bodies.Has Flying Got You Down? Blood clots affect 900,000 Americans and kill 160,000 of them every year. Flying is a leading cause, due to sitting for hours in cabin pressure, which restricts the flow of oxygen. Palmer says, "Personally, when I hit the 4 hour mark on a long flight, I couldn't stand just sitting there for one more minute and getting up to stretch my legs wasn't always an option. I've done 12 successful test flights where FlyteBiking prevented cabin fever and jet lag! Also, surprising but true: TSA agents have never once mentioned or inspected my FlyteBike bag and flight attendants and passengers don't even notice I am pedaling in my seat!"It's All About the Blood Flow. Research shows that pedaling is the perfect way to pump blood to your brain and throughout your body. Pedaling for just a few minutes during your day boosts your mood and your metabolism!Just like strolling on the treadmill desk, the goal is gentle movement to oxygenate your blood. Don't worry, you won't be sweating at work or on the plane... unless, of course, you want to!FLYTEBIKE IS NEAT™ CERTIFIEDNEAT™ stands for the science of Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis, developed by Mayo Clinic.WHERE CAN YOU FLYTEBIKE™?You can feel better, lose weight and live longer by pedaling just minutes a day anytime, anywhere – at work, at home, on the go - even on long flights! ​​Successful business owner increases productivity at work.

Bestselling author, speaker and success expert, Debra Poneman, loves burning calories while she works.

Stay fit with FlyteBike on vacation
Prevent Blood Clots and Jet Lag on Long Flights
FLYTEBIKE™ FEATURES
 
WANT TO TRACK YOUR PROGRESS AND SAVE MONEY?
FlyteBike's optional Smart Pedals™ have a built-in sensor and tracking app. Health insurance and corporate wellness programs provide discounts for employers and employees who to track their progress.
FLYTEBIKE™ MOBILE APP

With FlyteBike™ Smart Pedals™ and its mobile application, users will be able to track their progress. With exercise tips and calorie tracking, FlyteBike™ users can stay on track with their wellness.
LIFT YOUR MOOD & METABOLISM – ANYWHERE, ANYTIME!

Senior increases her blood flow and energy right at home.


Inventor prevents blood clots in her hotel room after a long flight...


and speeds up her metabolism in the passenger seat on long car rides!

Former Broadway star, Robin Palmer, FlyteBikes while singing her FlyteBike song
