story:
Short Summary

Wrestling Legend Dan Gable said, "Gold medals aren't really made of gold. They're made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts." Shasta Wrestling is committed to shaping our youth into men with  strong character, confidence, a sense of personal responsibility, and an unmatched work ethic.  If you are a wrestling fan, parent, or you have endured the blood, sweat and tears that come with stepping onto the mat to compete, you know that once these traits are embraced,  they can not be unlearned.

The Shasta Wolves Wrestling Team is kicking off the 2nd annual  golf tournament fundraising campaign to help with our travel, accommodations, competitions, and training costs. Last year our loyal supporters helped us meet our goal and earn enough to travel throughout California and Nevada and face the most elite competition. We plan to continue building our legacy this year and put Shasta Wrestling back on the map. 

The 2nd annual Shasta Wrestling Golf Tournament is September 5th, 2015 at Gold Hills Golf Course. As part of the tournament, we will be selling balls for a helicopter ball drop and tee sponsorships ONLINE. Our Helicopter Ball Drop has a grand prize of $1000! See details below. (All contributions are tax deductible and a donation receipt will be provided upon request.) 

How it Works: Helicopter Ball Drop

  1. Shasta Wrestling Supporters purchase  golf balls for $10 each online.

  2. Shasta Wrestling will send you an e-mail with your ball numbers

  3. At approximately 6:00pm on September 5th, golf balls will be dropped from  a helicopter. The first ball in or closest to the hole wins the grand prize of $1000. The 2nd and 3rd balls in or closest to the hole will win  prizes as well.

  4. Contestants do not need to be present to win. Winner will be notified via e-mail and a phone call.

How it Works: Hole Sponsorships

  1. Purchase a hole sponsorships online  for $50 and Shasta Wrestling will put your name, family name, or business on a banner at the tee box.

  2. Purchase a hole sponsorships online  for $100 and Shasta Wrestling will put your name, family name, or business on a banner at the tee box AND you will get 10 balls in the helicopter ball drop

How it Works: Traveling Tournament Sponsorship  ($1000)

1. Select this perk and you will be an official sponsor of one of our out of town tournaments. This year our varsity team is traveling to Elk Grove, Reno, Sacramento, Chico, Gilroy, and Bakersfield. 

As coach and former wrestler myself, I can confidently say that not a day passes when I do not draw upon a lesson or skill I learned in the Shasta High School Wrestling Room.

Alumni Wrestlers and Wolf Pack supporters, last year you came together and helped our young generation of wolves because you remember the glory days in the Shasta Wrestling Room and you see the positive impact Wrestling has on our youth. Please help us out once again, so we can continue to build our program and be a powerhouse in the North State.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT.

WOLF PACK!!!

story:
Short Summary

My friend Sarah is in a very difficult position.  She's 6 months pregnant, has unjustly been terminated from her job, and has lost her home due to uncontrollable circumstances.  She has no parents or siblings. She is residing in a maternity house outside of town, as it is all she can afford.  It was suggested to her that she consider placing the baby up for adoption, which is an unbearable thought. As it stands, she has nothing for Baby Blythe except for a crib and dresser.  

I am able to help her find used and bargain items, as well as lend her a few hundred dollars, but she needs a small nest egg in order to provide for her daughter due in January 2015.  She has a business plan on the back burner that she is eager to implement next summer, once Blythe is a few months old.  The plan contains details, prices, and forms for running her at home daycare.  Sarah was a nanny for several years, so she has the experience and skills to manage a daycare business.

Sarah is ambitious, smart, and energetic.  She has the will to overcome any barrier, but she has hit a very low point, and needs some financial resources. With your help, she can pick herself up and confidently move forward in her life.

What We Need & What You Get

The $3,500 that I am aiming for will be enough for Sarah to:

- place first and last month's rent on an apartment 

- buy necessities for Blythe - diapers, wipes, blankets, and clothes

- buy groceries and other necessities, such as soap,  toilet paper, towels, dishes, cutlery, and pots

- set up a small savings account in case of emergency

- have some start up capital for her business plan

In return for your contributions, I offer my handicrafts.  I make my own bath and body care items, as well as some cosmetics, for my personal use and for friends.  Everything I make is vegan, eco-friendly, usable, safe, and unique.  Please review the perks to see what you can get.

The Impact

The funds raised from this campaign will help save two lives; as a single mother myself, I know Sarah will appreciate your generosity.

Risks & Challenges

The most difficult part of this will be getting the word out and asking potential contributors such as yourself to help out a stranger.  I see where you may think this is a scam, however this is not the case.  If you would like more information about this endeavor or Sarah's situation (within reason, due to confidentiality), I will gladly answer your questions and validate my identity and reasons.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, your support would be just as helpful.  Please share this campaign on your website, blog, and social media channels, and tell your friends and family.  Every few dollars makes a difference.  

Thank you so much for your time and effort.

story:
A Bit about Me

My name is Gary O'Toole. I am a Vedic astrologer, Ayurvedic Lifestyle Counsellor and yoga & fitness instructor. I have taught Ayurveda and Yoga workshops since 1998, combining my knowledge of hatha yoga with Ayurveda and body types. As a Vedic astrologer I have consulted with many clients from all over the world in the last 20 years.  I am an active member of the British Association of Vedic Astrology (BAVA). I will be speaking at the upcoming BAVA conference in 2015 about the contents of a book I have finished writing. 

The book is called Cosmic Bodies: An Ayurvedic-Astrological Guide to Health & Fitness. I have dedicated my life to this work for the past 10 years and I am eager to get this book onto the shelves so that others may benefit from its approach.  

Synopsis of the Book

Cosmic Bodies is a holistic guide to health and fitness that merges the Ayurvedic approach to exercise with astrological insights. The book will give you an understanding of your true nature whilst offering guidance on how best to exercise for your mind and body type. Laid out in a workbook format, Cosmic Bodies offers easy-to-follow steps that can be used to interpret your mind/body type using your Vedic horoscope. You'll be able to develop an awareness of your fitness needs in order to achieve balance, prevent injury and create greater resistance to stress and illness through appropriate exercise and lifestyle habits.

This guide takes the reader from the foundations of all of today’s popular Vedic sciences, i.e., Ayurveda, Yoga and Vedic Astrology, and how these relate to movement in particular right through to the more dynamic influences of 'planetary time periods' and how astrology can be easily applied to your day-to-day life. The planets and zodiac signs are explained in detail, offering advice on appropriate activities and exercises for your sign.

Get ready to meet with the real you on a yoga mat, on the gym floor or in your very own home. Cosmic Bodies will teach you how to gain insight into your unique nature and fitness needs so that you can make exercises work for YOU.

Listen to Vedic astrologer Barry Rosen's recent interview with me about the book: 
https://soundcloud.com/gary-otoole-2/barry-rose...


I Need your Help

I need your help in getting this book through the final stages of production and onto the bookshelves.  By contributing to the production of this book - editing, formatting, illustrations and promotion - you play your part in a very unique approach to exercise and how we view holistic health. You become involved in the evolution of this publication and perhaps even shape its content! 

By contributing to this campaign you receive a copy of the eBook and an astrological forecast for 2015. I am also seeking contributors who would like to have an Ayurvedic astrology reading based on the guidelines presented in the book. Learn how to exercise appropriately for your mind and body type and discover your true self, along with yogic remedies and practices specific to you.

Invite me to speak at your studio, or wellness centre, and all participants receive a copy of the eBook. 

All private readings include a recording of the session to download onto your computer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are an editor, illustrator, or have some ideas you think may help this campaign, I would love to hear from you. Email me at gary@timelineastrology.com.

Help spread the word and be a part of making this book a landmark publication in the fields of Ayurveda, astrology, yoga and fitness.

Share via Facebook, Twitter and Email.

Thank you!

Comments from Recent Clients

Gary's patience, lightness and non-judgmental approach provided an open and relaxed setting for the reading.  The language he used was so clarifying, insightful and helpful. His passion and knowledge of Vedic Astrology is inspiring and I feel more at peace knowing more about who I really am and how the planets truly influence my life.  Thank you, Gary.

MC

Gary's depth of knowledge is unreal. His education in Ayurveda contributes greatly to his understanding. I think Gary has three major gifts to bring to his readings that are not often combined. The first is his intellectual ability and passion for knowledge; the second is the deep compassion and empathy that Gary carries through his work and the third is complete professionalism, in confidentiality and all other aspects. I completely recommend him for anyone wanting to delve deeper into Astrology.

CM

Gary's readings are clear and well stated.  He is very clear on planetary energies and their impact through living a Vedic lifestyle - not just from a theoretically achieved knowledge.

AK

story:
This campaign is over. You can learn more about our products and order iTraq on our web site

www.itraq.com

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

iTraq is a cellular tracking device - the world’s first global location device that can be found anywhere. iTraq determines its location using cellular towers allowing iTraq to be located anywhere in the world where cellular service exists.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

When we were thinking how to design the iTraq the best way, we tried to make a device that is much better than similar devices on the market. So, 

Why is iTraq better?

 

While other location devices claim they can be found anywhere over large distances, the truth is that they are all using Bluetooth wireless technology. 
Why is that important for the user? Bluetooth has a small detection radius (tens, hundreds of feet maximum), which greatly limits its scope of use to household devices, such as keys, remote controls, etc.

 

Since iTraq determines its location using cellular towers, its radius extends as far and as wide as all cellular towers.  This, in turn, allows you to attach iTraq to a bicycle or boat, place it in the pocket of your child, or even  attach it to your baggage, and still be detected even if your baggage travelled to another country or continent.

 

Most other devices that work globally, like GPS technology, are known as very power intensive consumers of battery life.  Even the most recent advances in battery life only allow a GPS device to work several days if not only hours.

iTraq uses Cell-ID technology and lets you adjust how often iTraq should report its location, from a few times in an hour to a few times in a day, and can work up to 3 years without the need to recharge a battery.

 

Most other devices comparable to iTraq are likely to come in very bulky form factors that make it impractical to place or locate.

However, iTraq is as small as a credit card, only slightly thicker - like 5 cards together. It can be placed in a glove compartment of the car or even hidden under the seat of your mountain bike. It can also be hung on the strap or stuck on a flat surface with an adhesive strip that is supplied with iTraq.

 

 

 
Is GPS-level accuracy really needed for these applications? We believe it is not. iTraq allows enough precision to let you know if your child is in school or on a football field, or if your car is at home or in the parking lot. iTraq does not use GPS, but it does use a technology that scans cellular towers that are in proximity to determine its location. The more towers it sees, the more precisely iTraq can determine its location. 

 

 

 

Proprietary software allows  iTraq to stay in sleep mode most of the time - this helps to minimize energy consumption and achieve an amazing battery lifetime.

Depending on the schedule set by user, iTraq wakes up, determines its location by scanning cellular towers in range and transmits data to the server.

Then all the location information is displayed on your mobile phone or on the website.

 

 

 

       

 

iTraq’s Mobile Application allows you to activate iTraq and manage all the iTraqs that you have. Each iTraq can be assigned a name and a separate alarm ringtone. The number of iTraqs that can be tracked and logged in the application is limitless.

For each iTraq you can view the map that contains a history of its locations with time stamps.

You can always check the status of iTraq and its remaining lifetime. Or you can change the frequency of wake-ups, depending on your needs.  

 

 

 

Sometimes it’s important not only to know where the iTraq is but to detect if it has suddenly left the designated area (for example, a boat near the summer house slips its mooring). To this end, we came up with the Guard mode. You can specify the radius on the map and if the iTraq goes beyond this pre-set radius, you will receive an alert on the mobile phone. 

 

 

 

We have completed the Test Board stage which is the first prototype of our device. Our engineers used this phase to connect external peripheral devices to complete the testing, debugging, and power consumption measurements. We have also finished developing the module firmware and completed the testing against the Test Board. iTraq has successfully proven that our concept works and now have the first production release in development mode. 

 

 

 

 

  • Developing Mobile and Web applications
  • Production Tooling
  • Antenna Refinement 
  • Firmware Refinement 
  • Power Consumption Optimization
  • Certifications - FCC, CE, PTCRB

 

 

We are very excited to deliver iTraqs to our first 100 beta testers in August 2015.
We plan to receive feedback about the device and applications, fix them and deliver final iTraqs to everyone in September.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

You can leave your questions on the comments page or send us email to info@itraqtag.com.

Don't forget to like and follow us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/itraqtag to be up to date with the latest information!

Or send us a tweet: @itraqtag

For inquiries regarding Distribution, Retail, and Partnerships please email partner@itraqtag.com

Press, please email press@itraqtag.com for more information. 

 

 

Is this a one-time fee for the iTraq device or there is an additional subscription or fee to track an object?
The fee is all-inclusive. All communication expenses are included in the price, so there is no additional charge for tracking.

Really one-time fee? I really do not understand how it can be one-time fee. There is a SIM Card for GSM communication and feedback, how can that be a lifetime subscription?
Yes, correct, this is a one-time fee. We estimate that iTraq during its life will make roughly near 1500 communication cycles, which it about 3 years of iTraq life for once-a-day report cycle. Based on this estimations we have made an exclusive agreement with our communication provider. So, all these expenses are already included in price and there is not additional charge for the user.

What after 3 years of use or when battery is discharged?
iTraq is sold with communication cost included in price. So, when you buy it, you pay for the device and communication. Battery that runs iTraq is enough for 1500 communication cycles, exactly the same amount of communications cycles is included in price of iTraq. So, when battery is discharged (or cycles are over, that should happen at the same time) you need to recharge both - battery & communication credits. We'll announce the service to RECHARGE iTraq when we pass the beta testing stage. The cost of this service will be less comparing to the cost of a new iTraq.

How can you be sure it works worldwide?
The iTraq will be shipped with GSM SIM card installed on the factory. We have signed an exclusive agreement with our communication provider to service us Globally. That guarantees that iTraq will work everywhere where cellular service exists, which is pretty much everywhere in the world.

Will iTraq work in Japan and South Korea?
There is no GSM networks in Japan & South Korea, so the iTraq will not be able to operate there.

Do you provide the SIM cards?
Yes, iTraq is shipped with SIM card installed on the factory, so you DON'T need to buy your own SIM card and pay for the service.

If I fly back to China, and I have iTraq attached on my backpack in the airplane which is in the sky, would my parents in China still able to find my position in the APP? Then when I land in China, will it work in China too?
iTraq uses cellular operators to determine its location and to transmit the data, so when you are on the plane it won’t be able to scan towers nearby and connect to report its location. However, when you land in China it will be able to detect your location during the next wake-up cycle, transmit data, so your parent will know you arrived.

How can I recharge the battery inside my iTraq device?
The iTraq battery is not rechargeable at this time, but we are creating a service to replace the battery. This service will be announced in June, when our first devices are released.

Does iTraq have GPS or Bluetooth inside?
No, iTraq does not use GPS or Bluetooth technology. It determines its location by scanning cellular towers nearby. This is why iTraq can be located anywhere in the world where cellular service exists.

Is it possible to determine when the polling period starts?
Yes, it will be a possibility to define when the wake-up schedule should be active.

Will there be flexibility to have the tracking every hour for some parts of the day and for it to “sleep” longer in other parts of the day? For example, I have a mother with Alzheimers and I would like to track her every hour in the afternoon and evening, but this information would not be required between midnight and midday.
Yes, it will work exactly as it’s explained above. It will be a very flexible, but easy to understand way to setup and manage wake-up schedules.

I know I can setup up the iTraq to report its location, e.g. once a day 5pm each day. Will I be able to query it whenever I wish, at any moment I am concerned about its location?
No, iTraq is designed the way it’s in a deep sleep mode between wake-up cycles, so there is no possibility to wake him up because it’s not communicating with our servers at this time.

What accuracy does iTraq have in terms of tracking precision?
iTraq will track with enough precision to let you know if your child is in school or on a football field, or if your car is at home or in the parking lot. iTraq does not use GPS, but it does use a technology that scans cellular towers that are in proximity to determine its location. The more towers it sees, the more precisely iTraq can determine its location. In urban areas the accuracy of detection is within a city block.

Is the iTraq device water resistant?
The current version of iTraq will be waterproof enough to resist rain and ambient moisture, but it won’t be able to withstand underwater exposure for long.

This campaign is over. You can learn more about our products and order iTraq on our web sitewww.itraq.com
       iTraq is a cellular tracking device - the world’s first global location device that can be found anywhere. iTraq determines its location using cellular towers allowing iTraq to be located anywhere in the world where cellular service exists.       When we were thinking how to design the iTraq the best way, we tried to make a device that is much better than similar devices on the market. So, Why is iTraq better? While other location devices claim they can be found anywhere over large distances, the truth is that they are all using Bluetooth wireless technology. Why is that important for the user? Bluetooth has a small detection radius (tens, hundreds of feet maximum), which greatly limits its scope of use to household devices, such as keys, remote controls, etc. 
Since iTraq determines its location using cellular towers, its radius extends as far and as wide as all cellular towers.  This, in turn, allows you to attach iTraq to a bicycle or boat, place it in the pocket of your child, or even  attach it to your baggage, and still be detected even if your baggage travelled to another country or continent. Most other devices that work globally, like GPS technology, are known as very power intensive consumers of battery life.  Even the most recent advances in battery life only allow a GPS device to work several days if not only hours.iTraq uses Cell-ID technology and lets you adjust how often iTraq should report its location, from a few times in an hour to a few times in a day, and can work up to 3 years without the need to recharge a battery. Most other devices comparable to iTraq are likely to come in very bulky form factors that make it impractical to place or locate.However, iTraq is as small as a credit card, only slightly thicker - like 5 cards together. story: Fox Lake Wrestling Club is an organization in Fox Lake Illinois dedicated to helping build these youths of our community into better wrestlers as well as better people. We have a dedicated group of coaches as well as a sizable group of hard working athletes. Many of our athletes strive for great things such as IHSA State Titles, Freestyle and Greco State Titles and even the prospect of wrestling at the next level. They are more than willing to work hard to achieve these goals but, in these economic times in a blue collar community it can be difficult to participate in activities such as our trip to Northwestern University's Wrestling camp. It is for that reason that we have started this fund to help these atheletes afford this great oppurtunity. It is our belief that no one who is willing to work hard should have their dreams squashed due to things outside their control.

story:
Short Summary

Haitian Heritage & Friends of Haiti (HHFoH), a registered public 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, has been to Haiti nine times since the devastating 2010 earthquake. During the 2013 trip, we delivered supplies and ran a mobile medical clinic using an ambulance we currently have in Haiti. We treated over one thousand patients in four days. Our experience has shown us first-hand the need for better and greater access to healthcare in rural Haiti.

The "Santé Se Richès" (English translation "Health is Wealth") medical clinic is being built for the rural community of Grand-Gilles, a town in the Grande Riviére du Nord with 60,000 inhabitants.  Grand-Gilles is about 25 miles from the northern city of Cap-Haitien (2nd largest city in Haiti).

What We Need & What You Get

Our current project is to build, operate, and sustain a medical clinic in northern Haiti. The clinic will be built using shipping containers, which will be designed and outfitted locally in the US then shipped to Haiti where they will be assembled.

Haitian Heritage & Friends of Haiti (HHFoH) already owns the land to build the clinic.  We are seeking partners, sponsors (sponsorship packages are available), financial contributions and volunteers. The clinic will be built in different stages. Funding is needed to complete the first phase of the project, which will consist of cleaning up the land and fencing it, purchasing and constructing the 1st shipping container to open at least one of the five planned medical units.  The fund will also be used for water, electricity and staffing for the first 6 months.  
All donations to HHFoH are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.  You will receive an email from us confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can then be used for tax deductible purposes.  For all contributions over $250, an official receipt will be sent to you for tax-reporting purposes after the campaign ends.

The Impact

Haiti with its 10 plus million inhabitants has a life expectancy as low as 47 years for men and 51 years for women. There are 1.6 physicians, 1.9 nurses, and 0.2 dentists for every 10,000 people in Haiti. About 70% of the population live in the mountains and have no access to health care.  For the past 4 years, the Cholera outbreak has killed close to 10,000 people and more than 6% of the population has had the disease.  Presently, the Chikungunya virus (mosquito-borne) is rapidly spreading in Haiti.  About 2,000 cases have already been reported since the outbreak in May of this year.

HHFoH intent is to provide quality healthcare that is nearly free of charge.  Our goal, once the clinic is fully operational, with all the components in place, is to provide healthcare to an average of seven hundred patients per week or approximately thirty-six thousand patients per year.

          

While healthcare needs for those living in the targeted area will be addressed, we will also be creating jobs.  The clinic will be staffed mostly by Haitian local medical and non-medical personnel.  We will work closely with the Haitian community in the rural area as well as partner with the Haitian health department to help us grow long term.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we foresee at the moment is raising the seed money to kick off the project.  It's always difficult to start a brand new project.  Most people are more apt at giving to something that's already off the ground and tangible.  We are offering people the opportunity to be the pioneer in this much needed project and join us in saving lives.  

The best way to address this challenging situation we are facing is by launching this campaign, seeking and applying for grants, partnering with local churches and other organizations, seeking private donors, conduct fundraising activities, etc...

Other Ways You Can Help

Ways to be involved in the project:

  • Team to help construct components of the clinic using the shipping containers
  • Team to travel to Haiti to help with site cleanup and set-up
  • Medical/non-medical team to travel to Haiti to provide medical care at the clinic and support the local Haitian staff
  • Spread the word about this campaign to ALL your contacts "make some noise".  Use Indiegogo share tools and all your social network accounts.  

Special projects/events that groups can organize:

  • An over-the-counter medication drive is a unique opportunity to get involve as they will be greatly needed and used in Haiti
  • In-kind donations and food drive
  • Dedicated fundraising activities

LET'S GET THIS PROJECT STARTED!  WE HAVE LIVES TO SAVE!

story:
Maggie's Story

  

  

     Maggie will be 2 in August. She loves sliding down the slide, playing in the sandbox, painting, reading stories and chocolate cake. She loves feeding the ducks at the park, splashing in puddles and ice cream, especially on warm summer days. She loves to be outside and especially loves riding on her new red tricycle. 

     Maggie has recently been diagnosed with a specific type of cancer that only occurs in children called Neuroblastoma. Neuroblastoma is when cancer cells form in the nerve tissue of the adrenal gland, neck, chest, or spinal cord. Maggie has a tumour on her adrenal gland, which has now spread to other parts of the body. She is in stage 4 and will be undergoing various treatments for the next year and a half to two years. This will include, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, bone marrow transplants, stem cell transplant, and follow up medication. In addition, it will include several trips to the Sick Kids Hospital in Toronto. This little girl and her family have a very tough road ahead of them.

     Maggie’s family are staying positive. Doctors explain that, while there are no guarantees, the hope of her walking out of the hospital in a few years time, cancer free, is a very realistic goal. They also are upfront about the intensity of the upcoming years in terms of her treatment, emotional stress and financial strain. Maggie will need full time round the clock care which will mean at least one parent will not be able to work. She will also need trips to the Sick Kids in Toronto, expensive medications and the list goes on and on. 

     This family is in desperate need of your help in order to help their baby girl get better and grow up to be the person she was meant to be. No amount is too small and every bit helps. Together we can help ease the financial strain associated with caring for a seriously ill child and help the family focus on what is really important, their sweet little girl and making her better. 

 Thank you!

story:
English version below

Patryk Jendruchniewicz pamięta, że wiśnie mają kolor czerwony...

Miał dwa lata z kawałeczkiem, kiedy zdiagnozowano chorobę. Najpierw przechodził chemioterapię. Później była m.in. radioterapia. Był pierwszym dzieckiem w Polsce, które lekarze leczyli tą metodą w przypadku choroby oczu.

Z początku terapia przynosiła skutek. Potem trzeba było usunąć jedno oko, a w lutym 2012 roku drugie. Nie było wyjścia. Nowotwór tworzył już nacieki na mózg. Patryk przed operacją mówił, ze wolalby nie żyć, niż nie widziec. Ale teraz jest bardzo dzielny. Powiedzial tylko ze smutnkiem:  "już nigdy nie zobaczę mamy"

10-latek mieszka z rodziną we wsi Bedlno koło Radzynia Podlaskiego w bardzo trudnych warunkach.

7-osobowa rodzina posiada mieszkanie o powierzchni zaledwie 17 metrów kwadratowych. To niecałe 2.5 metra na osobę! Nie jest łatwo. W małym pokoju mieszka razem z czwórką rodzeństwa. Wciąż potyka się o stojące w pokoju łóżka, nie ma własnego miejsca.

Czego potrzeba najbardziej?

Kiedy spytano Patryka, jakie jest jego marzenie - powiedział, że chciałby zbudować "chatkę" i mieć swój pokój. I łazienkę, której teraz nie ma. Toaleta znajduje się kilkadziesiąt metrów od budynku mieszkalnego

Budowa już się zaczęła, ale rodzinie brakuje pieniędzy. Został do zrobienia dach, instalacja elektryczna, tynki. podłogi, instalacja sanitarna. Koszty to jeszcze ok. 30–35 tys. zł. 
Zbiórka trwa. Niektórzy darczyńcy kontaktują się bezpośrednio z rodziną i przywożą materiały budowlane.

Dlaczego pomoc jest konieczna?

Rodzina Patryka wydała na leczenie wszystkie środki, jakimi dysponowała i te, które napłynęły w formie pomocy.

Osobny pokoj dla Patryka jest tak ważny dlatego, że tylko wtedy odnajdzie  za kazdym razem przedmioty. które pozostawił. Potrzebuje spokoju, uczy sie Braille'a i życia w mroku.

Szybka pomoc ma ogromne znaczenie, a czas nagli, bo dobrze byłoby zakończyć budowę przed zimą.

Wyobrażam sobie zarówno tę radość rodziców Patryka, jak i wiarę jego samego, że marzenia sie spelniają


I pomyślec, ile możemy dać komus w wielkiej życiowej potrzebie - przesyłajac jakies tam 10 zl...

O Patryku w TVP Info

O Patryku w TVP Lublin

 

Patryk przyrzeka, że każdy, kto pomoże mu zbudować jego własny "domek" otrzyma specjalne podziękowanie, które on sam napisze używając alfabetu Braille'a i tradycyjnego pisma

 

 

 W jaki sposób możesz jeszcze pomóc?

  • Powiadom wszystkich ludzi dobrej woli - mail, SMS...
  • Opowiedz o losie Patryka na blogach
  • Przeslij link do kampanii znajomym na FB, MS, YouTube, Twitterze...
  • Umieść link do kampanii na swojej stronie www
  • Mów o tym, jak bardzo potrzebny  jest każdy grosz
  • Poproś o dalsze rozsyłanie INFO o kampanii
 

Ważne

Niniejsza kampania została wyemitowana przez Krzysztofa Erdei przy akceptacji rodziców Patryka -Sławomira i Justyny Jendruchniewiczów
Kontakt:
Sławomir Jendruchniewicz, tel. +48 515 893 914 - dostępny również na stronie TVP Lublin
 
E-mail: slawomir.jendruchniewicz@gmail.com
 
 

================
      English version

Patrick is suffering from cancer that attacked his eyes. his eyeballs were removed. It was the only way to save his life.

Patrick Jendruchniewicz remembers that cherries are red...

He was two years old when the disease was diagnosed. First was the chemotherapy. Later radiotherapy.
He was the first child in Poland, which doctors treated by this method in the case of eye cancer.
 
At first, the results of therapy were promising and effective. Then doctors had to remove one eye, and in February 2012 the second. There was no other way.

The tumor infiltrates already created on the brain. Patrick said before the surgery that he would rather be dead than not see. But now he is very brave. He said only sadly: "I will never see my mom"
 
10-year-old Patrick lives with his family in a Bedlno village near Radzyń Podlaski (Poland) very low quality of housing.

7 seater family owns an apartment with an area of only 17 square meters (approximately 180 sq ft). It is less than 2.5 (26 sq ft) meters per person! It is not easy. In a small room with four siblings. Patrick as that he is blind, has a big issue navigate in a room laden with beds and other furniture. There is no place for him.

 

What is now most needed?

When Patrick was asked about his dream - he said he wanted to build a "cottage" and have his own room. And a bathroom, which now does not exist. The toilet is located nearly 100 meters from a residential building

Construction has already started, but the family does not have money anymore. It is to build: the roof, wiring, plaster. flooring, plumbing. The costs are still about 30-35 thousand PLN(approx. $ 12,000)
Collecting the money lasts. Some donors interact directly with the family and bring building materials.

 

Why our help is so important?

Patrick's family released for treatment all the money available to it and those who received as a gift aid.

A separate room for Patrick is so needed. He needs peace, he must learn Braille and learn how to live in darkness.

Help is needed now. Every day is important. Time is pressing. It would be fantastic to complete construction before winter.

 
About Patrick in Polish TV
 
About Patrick on TVP Lublin
 

There are many giving levels, but we know that even $ 1 helps
This home would mean more smiles for kids.
 
I can imagine the happiness of Patrick and his belief that dreams do come true.
 
 
Patrick promises that anyone who will help him to build his own "small cottage" will receive a special thank you letter, that he will write using Braille and traditional letter
 
 

 How can you still help?

  • Tell all people of good will - mail, SMS ...    
  • Talk about Patrick on blogs
  • Submit a link to the campaign to your friends on FB, MS, YouTube, Twitter ...
  • Place a link to the campaign on your own website
  • Tell everyone how much we need every penny
  • Ask for further distribution INFO Campaig

 

Important

This campaign was published by Christopher Erdei with the approval of Patrick's parents - Slawomir and Justyna Jendruchniewicz
Contact:
Slawomir Jendruchniewicz, Tel: +48 515 893 914 - also available on the website TVP Lublin

E-mail: slawomir.jendruchniewicz@gmail.com

story:
Who is Able Village?

We give every patient access to every provider they need for comprehensive care.

AbleVillage is a platform to connect individuals, families and practitioners in a multidisciplinary way, like never before. Our site helps alleviate and resolve the fear for newly diagnosed families and provides guidance, helpful resources and a network of providers for each of your needs.

We believe that every parent should have access to every sub specialist and resource needed in order to receive the best, most comprehensive treatment available for their child. Unfortunately, every day, children are diagnosed with mental and physical diseases and parents are left with unanswered questions and a lack of guidance in treatment.

For example, imagine your child is diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder. Depending on their individual severity, did you know that the integration of the following specialists would be most beneficial to their care?

  •   Primary Care Physician
  •   Psychologist
  •   Psychiatrist
  •   Social Worker
  •   Behavioral Specialist
  •   IEP (Individualized Education Program) for school
Most do not.

How can you help?

We are in the process of redeveloping our site in order to provide our users with the most up to date information and functionality. By donating, you will help us in development of the following capabilities;

  •   Forums

o  Help connect caregivers to other “parent experts” for exchanges of information and support

o  Connect caregivers to providers through healthcare provider profiles and messaging capabilities

  •   Resource Library
o  Information about each individual diagnosis, medication, treatment options, etc.

o  Comprehensive condition-based checklists and symptoms

o  Video library

o  Glossary of terms and conditions

o  Links to directories of providers based on expertise, education and experience based on your geographic location

  •   Marketplace

o  Links available to purchase any needed electronic therapy or therapeutic services such as day camps

o  Access to books, guides, tool kits and educational tools


Please take a moment to check out our different donation opportunities and perks available to see how you can help make a difference.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate  but want to help? Share our cause with others through education and by connecting with us on our social platforms below.

story:
For the last three years, Therapy Thursday with Wendi Dunford has been one of the most popular segments on The Morning Stream podcast. Now, with your help, we get to expand on what was started there with Wendi and Scott Johnson presenting season 1 of The Therapy Show. If funded, season 1 will include 12 episodes that have the time to explore topics in greater depths than the weekly segments.

 Episodes will focus on topics including:

  • Parenting
  • Addiction
  • Marriage and Relationships
  • Depression and Anxiety
  • Understanding how the brain works
  • And more!

We have some cool rewards to thank you for your support, including posters, note pads, greeting cards and mugs all of which feature art by Scott and helpful tips from Wendi! If things go well, and we reach some of our stretch goals, there could be a season 2 and beyond! If you enjoy Therapy Thursday and have been hoping for more, this is your chance. Help us bring you twelve full episodes of...helping you!

Wow--already at goal!  You are the greatest fans a show could want!  As promised, since we have hit goal so early we are going to go ahead and open up a Stretch Goal for Season 2.

Stretch Goal #1: If we hit $10,000, then a 12 episode Season 2 is a go!

story:
People by the millions are abandoning conventional treatments for emotional, mental and physical issues in favour of dignified, effective alternatives.

Unfortunately, the ability of Ontario practitioners to lawfully offer alternative and natural therapies, family and addictions counseling, as well as traditional spiritual ministering will end in the fall of 2014 if action is not immediately undertaken to have harmful legislative amendments repealed or amended.

Once the College of Psychotherapy is proclaimed and has the power to enforce these amendments, thousands of practitioners will be put out of work, many of whom are women with families who depend on them.

We're not just fighting a big lobby group for Ontario practitioners, spiritual counselors and family therapist’s rights; we are fighting for everyone's right to choose their health care treatment.

These amendments affect anyone who is not a Registered Psychotherapist and who provides any sort of verbal or non-verbal therapy or counselling for emotional, behavioural, thinking, reasoning, social functioning, communication, mental and cognitive issues. The effects will be most severe for those who do not have a Master’s degree or an equivalent, including clergy, hypnotherapy, EFT, Reiki, spiritual, holistic, natural nutrition and NLP practitioners.

The legislative amendments to the Registered Health Profession Act, the Psychotherapy Act and the Psychology Act makes all ‘assessment and treatment’ of human disturbances an ‘act of psychotherapy’. These amendments must be repealed or modified to clarify that psychotherapy is merely one approach to the assessment and treatment of human conditions and disturbances and that it should not be the only option open to the public, many of whom have come to prefer other well-established alternative, holistic and spiritual approaches.

Why People Should Support Our Effort:

Alternative, holistic and spiritual treatment options must remain readily available to Ontario residents without imposition and restrictions. The freedom to choose our path to health and wellness, including our preferred method of therapy and counseling is the hallmark of any democracy and is something worth protecting.

Your support of this fundraising campaign will help ensure all Ontario residents continue to have free choice in treatments and will help prevent Ontario health care services from being monopolized by lobby groups.

The new legislation is open to much future abuse, since it uses undefined terms, such as “psychotherapeutic techniques” and “emotional disturbances”. 

Practically any natural human reaction to life’s bumps and bruises has come under this umbrella and its assessment and treatment has become a ‘controlled act of psychotherapy’ as prescribed by the College of Psychotherapy. This leaves the College in a position to later claim any technique as their own to regulate or eliminate at their discretion.

What We Need

Our minimum requirement is $50,000 by the end of this month. This will allow us to move to the next phase of our action by:

•  continuing to fund the legal intervention with the Minister of Health with the goal of getting these undemocratic legislative amendments repealed.

The Impact of Your Generosity

Donations to this campaign is being used to fund the legal action necessary to preserve the rights of Ontarians to choose their preferred method of health care and to allow holistic, alternative, spiritual and energy practitioners and family therapists and addictions counselors to continue to work without fear of prosecution.

Risks & Challenges

We expect the new Ontario Minister of Health and Long-Term Care will see the injustice in this case and that the Legislative Assembly will do the right thing and repeal these amendments. As of this launching, however, he has not replied.

If the Minister does not respond that he will postpone the proclamation of these amendments, alternative and holistic practitioners, family therapists and counselors of all types risk prosecution under this new legislation. This is clearly a violation of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms of these practitioners and their clients and we will need to pursue legal action. The courts will then have to decide.

Please visit www.stoppsychotherapy.ca to subscribe to important updates and sign the petition at Change.org~  http://tinyurl.com/qxwczo2.

Thank you for your support!

story:
STAYING STRONG SINCE 4.17.09

KEEPING THE FAITH

I would like to tell you about my son, 21 yr old Zach Jackson. At the age of 18, he and a couple friends were enjoying life and hanging out on the Red River when they left to go pick up some other friends.  As they were going to pick up these friends, Zach looked in the rear view mirror and saw a vehicle coming up behind him at a high rate of speed. THIS caused Zach to veer off the road in order to keep from being hit.  His SUV flipped and life changed in the blink of an eye, not just for Zach, but all involved.  Most important lives changed forever. Zach suffers now from a brain stem injury and can not talk, walk or eat, and lives in a nursing home that is strictly geared for the elderly. We are trying to raise funds all the time to help Zach with care that insurance will not pay for, a special vehicle for him, and remodeling our home so when he does come for visits, he is accommodated. We normally have to travel to get him treatments since there is not a Traumatic Brain Injury Rehab Center anywhere near us.  We also have to purchase medical equipment, physical therapy, and supplements for him that insurance will not cover.  When we purchase out of pocket medical equipment, I always look for the floor models or slightly used and demos. We also have to pay for a private room since he is in a nursing home and his severe temperature fluctuations.
Our plan is to drive to Arizona this summer, for further treatments.  In the 3 years since Zach's accident he has shown quite a bit of progress, but he will only continue to progress as long as we are able to travel to the places that are equipped to handle a brain injury like he has.  When we travel there, we will have to pay for the treatments, for our stay at the Ronald McDonald house, gas,  Zach's nutrition and all the things he needs on this trip.
Please help us meet our goal of $5,000 to get Zach out to Arizona. As any mother would, I search for and pray for a miracle everyday.  These treatments are a necessity for Zach's continued progress and well-being. 
WE pray you will join us in our efforts to bring back Zach. I believe that God is working a miracle and that in His time we will see a beautiful story revealed and Zach will tell others of his encounter with Heaven.
We thank you in advance for your donation and ask that you continue sending prayers Zach's way.
If you would like to read more or see pictures of Zach covering the past two years, please join us on Facebook. Zachary Jackson.
Faith, Hope and Love, Zach's Mom~ Dana Johnston

 

I have also had to take out of my retirement to pay for a vehicle for Zach. My husband and I are both retired and will need all the help we can aquire.

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know everyone can not donate, but you can make a difference, by sharing this site

please pass this along. please pray for Zach and his road to becoming a Miracle.

we thank you in advance for what you are doing. remember to share and share.

peace to you,

Dana Johnston
story_txt:
STAYING STRONG SINCE 4.17.09
KEEPING THE FAITH
 I would like to tell you about my son, 21 yr old Zach Jackson. At the age of 18, he and a couple friends were enjoying life and hanging out on the Red River when they left to go pick up some other friends.  As they were going to pick up these friends, Zach looked in the rear view mirror and saw a vehicle coming up behind him at a high rate of speed. THIS caused Zach to veer off the road in order to keep from being hit.  His SUV flipped and life changed in the blink of an eye, not just for Zach, but all involved.  Most important lives changed forever. Zach suffers now from a brain stem injury and can not talk, walk or eat, and lives in a nursing home that is strictly geared for the elderly. We are trying to raise funds all the time to help Zach with care that insurance will not pay for, a special vehicle for him, and remodeling our home so when he does come for visits, he is accommodated. We normally have to travel to get him treatments since there is not a Traumatic Brain Injury Rehab Center anywhere near us.  We also have to purchase medical equipment, physical therapy, and supplements for him that insurance will not cover.  When we purchase out of pocket medical equipment, I always look for the floor models or slightly used and demos. We also have to pay for a private room since he is in a nursing home and his severe temperature fluctuations. Our plan is to drive to Arizona this summer, for further treatments.  In the 3 years since Zach's accident he has shown quite a bit of progress, but he will only continue to progress as long as we are able to travel to the places that are equipped to handle a brain injury like he has.  When we travel there, we will have to pay for the treatments, for our stay at the Ronald McDonald house, gas,  Zach's nutrition and all the things he needs on this trip. Please help us meet our goal of $5,000 to get Zach out to Arizona. As any mother would, I search for and pray for a miracle everyday.  These treatments are a necessity for Zach's continued progress and well-being.  WE pray you will join us in our efforts to bring back Zach. I believe that God is working a miracle and that in His time we will see a beautiful story revealed and Zach will tell others of his encounter with Heaven.We thank you in advance for your donation and ask that you continue sending prayers Zach's way. If you would like to read more or see pictures of Zach covering the past two years, please join us on Facebook. Zachary Jackson.Faith, Hope and Love, Zach's Mom~ Dana Johnston
 
I have also had to take out of my retirement to pay for a vehicle for Zach. My husband and I are both retired and will need all the help we can aquire.

I know everyone can not donate, but you can make a difference, by sharing this site
please pass this along. please pray for Zach and his road to becoming a Miracle.
we thank you in advance for what you are doing. remember to share and share.
peace to you,
Dana Johnston

story:
What am I doing?

My Uncle Larry has prostate cancer, and it won't be much longer that he'll be with us. I really want to donate some money to cancer research in honor of him, but I frankly am not financially capable. I recently had the idea to shave my head in exchange for donations, so that's what I'm here for! After losing someone very important to me to cancer already, and watching my uncle go through the agony that he's been going through for the past few years, I feel very compelled to try to stop this from happening to other people.

I will be donating all funds raised to the Cancer Research Institute.

Why May 22?

My uncle and I share our birthday on May 22. It's been a very special bond for us my whole life, so I think that shaving my head on our shared day would be the perfect day to do this for him. I know that it is a little short notice, but I think it is important.

What you get:

On our birthday, May 22, I will shave all of my hair off and record it as a video for the viewing pleasure of anyone who contributed. Eventually, the video will probably be put online, but I will make sure that only the people who made donations or helped me make this happen get to see it first.

Other possible perks to pick from:

  • A personal thank you note from me, mailed to your address. I am a photography student, so it is very likely that I will actually make some special little cards in the darkroom for these. And they might have cats on them.
  • A copy of the short story "The Girl With The Hair of Nothing". My boyfriend will finally be able to use his writing for something other than unemployment to provide you with a short story that he probably hasn't written yet! He's talented, I promise.
  • A digital print of a portrait of me after my head has been shaved, signed by me. I'm not famous, but this could be a neat reminder of what you helped me do. 
  • A darkroom print of the aforementioned portrait, also signed by me.
  • A streamed video of me fire hooping - after I've shaved my head of course!

And, last but not least:

  • The knowledge that you helped contribute to a great cause: cancer research!

Please help me if you can!

Stretch Goals!

If we get to $750, my brother Davison and our friend Sean will shave their heads too!

At $1,000, our friend Shanaz will do it!

At $1,250, my boyfriend Aaron and our friend Jared will do it!

At $1,500, my uncle's wife Cathy will do it!

At $2,000, his brother-in-law Dave and our friend Skylar (age 9!) will do it!

If we reach these and beyond we will work to come up with something elaborate!

story:
Finally, our Get a Grip on Your Game Golf and Tennis DVDs are about to drop, and they will be hot!   Get a Grip (or better grip) on the games of life! 

If you are among the thousands of students\members that have taken classes or clinics from me over the past 7 years, you know exactly what ‘drop it like it’s hot’ means. LOL.  More importantly, you know how much I love teaching golf and tennis, and seeing instant results, whether you are a beginner or a serious gamer. 

For those of you who do not know me, my name is Ron Carroll and I own Get a Grip America Inc. (dba Play Golf and Tennis), a 10 Step social Golf and Tennis Club started in Chicago in 2005.  I started by offering free golf and tennis class in an effort to figure out the perfect 10 steps, and although I am still searching, I now train over 500 students per year!

WHAT ARE GET A GRIP ON YOUR GAME DVDs?

The goal of my Get a Grip on Your Game DVDs is to create a simple, to the point, easy to follow, understand, remember and (more importantly), employable 10 step, 2 level DVD for golfers and tennis players. 

My Golf DVD will be called Get a Grip on Golf, which will be for absolute beginners or golfers trying to finally break 100, 90 or 80.  This DVD will be constructed based on how you will actually PLAY the game (tee to greens), beginning with the grip, posture, setup, and the golf swing with every club in the bag (wedge to driver).  Lastly, we will address the 10 basic rules of golf, and how to play the game of golf.

Part Two of the DVD will be more advanced, and cover putting, the short game (chipping, pitching..), as well as sand play, bad and uneven lies, how to practice at home and at the range, how to play strategically, tee box strategy, playing the game and more!

My Tennis DVD will be called Get a Grip on Tennis, which will be for absolute beginners or tennis players trying to finally break 2.0, 3.0 or 4.0.  This DVD will be constructed based on how you will actually PLAY the game (baseline to Net), beginning with ready tennis, tennis grips, basic footwork, forehand, backhand, serve,  etc.  We also teach you basic rules and how to keep score, so you can PLAY the game.

Part Two of the DVD will be more advanced and cover more advanced footwork and all-court tennis –  slice shots, block shots, volley shots, drop shots…to the approach game, shots and strategies - running volleys, inside out shots...to net game and more!

PHILOSOPHY AND TEACHING TECHNIQUE

As an instructor, my initial goal is to have students leave the biggest culprits of both sports at the door – mind and muscle.  Golf and tennis are both rhythmic, tempo based, and finesse-type sports, and the golf swing and tennis stroke have a lot in common.     

I teach M&M Golf and Tennis (Muscle-less and Mindless Golf using Memory Muscle and Muscle Memory); Practice methods employ Yoga, Pilates and Zen Golf and Tennis Practice methods.   You will also learn the 1 o'clock or 11 o'clock Golf and Tennis chicken grips, monkey golf and tennis, and other fun, but unforgettable terms.

LINK TO 8 YOUTUBE VIDEOS:  http://www.youtube.com/playgolfandtennis/

LINK TO PHOTO GALLERY:  http://playgolfandtennis.com/GALLERY/gallery.html

LINK TO STUDENT REVIEWS:  http://playgolfandtennis.com/reviews.html

You will have access to an additional 8 golf videos and 8 tennis videos on our YouTube channel by April 1st.  We are working on them now, including tennis videos.

HOW MUCH MONEY DO I NEED? 

$5000  MINIMUM (Just to get the DVD Project up)

1000+ DVDs (Pre t post production, production team\company, editing, cases, cover, etc.), Covers, logos, graphics, website and collateral material,  actors, students, T-shirts, shipping boxes, shipping costs. 

If I raise more...

$10,000  (To get the DVD division going and offer a turnkey support solution)

5000 +DVDs, Getagriponyourgame Academy, GetaGriponyourgame online Academy and Community,  plus remote sing\stroke analysis, baseball caps at $50 or more and DVD placement on Ebay, Amazon, etc.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

LIKE & forward our Growing Golf and Tennis facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/Playgolfandtennis

LIKE & Forward NEW Small Business Start-up and Partnered Growth Facebook page: 

https://www.facebook.com/ChicagoBusinessPartners

DELIVERY DATES:

The DVD's will not be ready in the fall because we have to shoot and edit it over the summer.  However, we have a dozen free golf sample videos up now, and as a supporter, you will have access to up to a dozen more golf and tennis instructional videos by the end of May.  You will also have access to a beta online community, academy and more later in 2013 - and have some content input. PLEASE provide your email address for a link to the private YouTube videos and online Academy...

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or have any suggestions.

Thank your for your support!!!

Ron Carroll (View bio)

CHECK OUT OUR WEBSITE:  http://playgolfandtennis.com

story: Kendall has been in the hospital and the expected recovery is 3-6 months. He is unfortunately uninsured and he is the father of 3 beautiful children, Troy 3, Keira 1, and Autumn 1 1/2 months.  He comes from a large and loving family who have been supporting and caring for him since he went into the hospital. We are doing everything we can to help support his family until he is able to bounce back from this. Hes a very strong person, the strongest that I know and we would like to raise as much money as we can so when he does come back to us he doesn't have to stress about medical bills and can focus on the long recovery and being with his family.

story:
Short Summary

Good day ladies and gentlemen! My name is Christine L. Castillo, and I am a mother of two teenagers. Most of the people who know me would say that I have a big heart. I enjoy being in the healthcare profession so that I may care for people. I enjoy being a dental assistant in which I can see people literally smile for the work that has helped them in some way.

I have been undergoing some health issues in the past year that has me visiting different physicians. Recently they were able to find a major reason for my declining health. With some modifications to my diet, I am able to control some of the symptoms, but it is still costing for doctors’ visits, medications and supplements. Last year in April, a doctor had indicated that my body does not retain iron and that I would need an iron infusion. I could not afford to have the procedure done, and continued to take iron supplements. In November I was diagnosed with having fibroids in my uterus. So many and in different sizes and that the best solution is to remove the uterus. So far I haven't been out of work, but it is due to medications that allow me function. I believe that by having this surgery that I will be able to eliminate all medications and return to myself.

I believe that this surgery will help me to return to a body that doesn't look 4 months pregnant, and constantly feeling worn down and older than what I am. And I believe that I will be able to not worry if this will hinder my ability to be the provider that I have been for my family.

  The funding for this surgery is what insurance is expecting me to provide out of pocket. This is for the surgeon, the hospital room for 1.5 hours, and the anesthesiologist.

For contributing, the first 4 people will receive an IT WORKS body wrap. This is what I will be able to return to after the surgery is completed and I am released from my physician.

The wraps help to tighten and tone skin and to detoxify impurities from your body.

IF YOU CAN NOT HELP.....Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
**Update (5th November): Thanks to your amazing support, we have reached the original goal, of which some $8,000 is already spoken for.  This includes the 6-hour surgery in which a team of 4 surgeons placed three facial implants and one in Caroline's wrist; a five-day hospital stay; all the workups including CT scan, x-rays, examinations; medicines she still takes; and rent and transport within Delhi. (Caroline has a residence far away in another state, not Delhi.) This also includes the mandatory $400 taken by IndieGoGo as their fee. Itemizations and bills will be posted soon.

We will need several thousand more dollars to complete the next steps - dental restoration, an additional corrective jaw surgery, and physical therapy & possible 2nd wrist surgery. 

Caroline's jaws are still wired tightly shut and she remains on a completely liquid diet for the next 2 weeks. Meanwhile, we've uploaded new photos of the restoration in progress here! http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/save-caroline-s-face-teeth-hand/x/3161747?c=gallery**

Original Post:

While walking in India's Himalayan high-altitude Ladakhi desert, trying to avoid a drunken taxi driver who was making threats, Caroline Martin (adventurous solo travel writer, "Sirensongs" blogger, Indian classical dancer, dance scholar, photographer and singer with American Buddhist rock band "The Dharma Bums") fell 5 feet into an unmarked, open rocky drainage ditch, smashing both sides of her lower jaw, right wrist, many teeth, chin, lips, and two ribs. She was alone and had to climb out of the ditch, spitting teeth and blood, then hitchhike to the primitive local hospital.

CT Scans and X-rays in Delhi reveal she will require open surgery on both sides of her jaw, insertion of titanium plates, with the same procedure on her right wrist, plus extensive dental reconstruction, in order to ever function normally again. At the moment, she can barely open her jaw far enough to eat food.

If she doesn't get the surgeries, she could have facial deformity, her jaw will never open properly and her right hand will never function completely, making both Indian dance and typing painful, if not impossible - not to mention normal eating, singing and speaking.

Additionally, the funds must come soon, since waiting any longer would mean having to re-break the bones involved and risk less successful healing.

The estimates we have so far --about $6,500 USD-- encompass only the chin, jaw and hand surgeries. Dental estimates will come about one month later, as they depend on the healing of the jaws. Our fundraising goal of $10,000 USD includes anticipated dental reconstruction plus estimated costs of room and board during Caroline's enforced stay in Delhi.

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q: Why don't you go back to America? 

A: The same surgeries in the USA will cost some five times the amount, and Caroline has no kind of insurance. 

Q:  Why don't you get Obamacare? 

A: Obamacare will not take effect until January 2014, and the surgeries can not wait that long. Also, Tennessee, the state in which Caroline has residence, will not be participating in "Medicaid Expansion" anyway. 

Q: Why was she walking alone at night in the desert? 

A:  Caroline was in a taxi homeward bound at around 9PM.  It became evident that the driver was drunk as he was speeding & swerving, then he stopped the vehicle and began making obscene, violent remarks to her. As many rapes in India now are committed by taxi drivers and other transport workers, she thought it best to get out and walk the remainder home, though she was alone on a dark highway with no lighting whatsoever. (And yes, she had a flashlight, for all the smart asses out there. It doesn't help much in the blinding oncoming headlights.)

Q:  Why don't you arrest the guy?

A:  Efforts are under way to identify the driver and at least charge him with drunk driving. 

Q:  Why don't  you sue the city or something? 

A:  Such efforts in India are generally fruitless and mean years of costly litigation with little to show for it.

Q:  Why doesn't she have insurance? Doesn't everyone in America have insurance? 

A:  Some 27 million Americans have no form of insurance at all.  Many people in European and developing countries aren't aware of this.

If she doesn't get the surgeries, she could have facial deformity, her jaw will never open properly and her right hand will never function completely, making both Indian dance and typing painful, if not impossible - not to mention normal eating, singing and speaking.
Additionally, the funds must come soon, since waiting any longer would mean having to re-break the bones involved and risk less successful healing.
The estimates we have so far --about $6,500 USD-- encompass only the chin, jaw and hand surgeries. Dental estimates will come about one month later, as they depend on the healing of the jaws. Our fundraising goal of $10,000 USD includes anticipated dental reconstruction plus estimated costs of room and board during Caroline's enforced stay in Delhi.Frequently Asked Questions:
Q: Why don't you go back to America? 
A: The same surgeries in the USA will cost some five times the amount, and Caroline has no kind of insurance. 
Q:  Why don't you get Obamacare? 
A: Obamacare will not take effect until January 2014, and the surgeries can not wait that long. Also, Tennessee, the state in which Caroline has residence, will not be participating in "Medicaid Expansion" anyway. 
Q: Why was she walking alone at night in the desert? 
A:  Caroline was in a taxi homeward bound at around 9PM.  It became evident that the driver was drunk as he was speeding & swerving, then he stopped the vehicle and began making obscene, violent remarks to her. As many rapes in India now are committed by taxi drivers and other transport workers, she thought it best to get out and walk the remainder home, though she was alone on a dark highway with no lighting whatsoever. (And yes, she had a flashlight, for all the smart asses out there. It doesn't help much in the blinding oncoming headlights.)
Q:  Why don't you arrest the guy?
A:  Efforts are under way to identify the driver and at least charge him with drunk driving. 
Q:  Why don't  you sue the city or something? 
A:  Such efforts in India are generally fruitless and mean years of costly litigation with little to show for it.
Q:  Why doesn't she have insurance? Doesn't everyone in America have insurance? 
A:  Some 27 million Americans have no form of insurance at all.  Many people in European and developing countries aren't aware of this.

story:
My name is Ryan and I am 25 years old. I have been wheelchair bound for most of my life due to Muscular Dystrophy. For the past 9 years, I have been playing an amazing sport called Power Soccer. Power Soccer is a sport adapted for people in Power Wheelchairs and is played by teams across the United States and around the world. I play for a team called the Tampa Thunder and we have been together for 9 years. We placed 3rd last year at the National Championship and in 2010 we placed 2nd in North America. We have traveled all across the country and even internationally to compete against other teams.

I have set up this campaign to help raise money for a Power Soccer chair, so that I can continue playing this amazing sport. Power Soccer has changed my life for the better, it has taken me from somebody who didn't want to do anything with their life to someone who is a successful college pursuing the dream of becoming a Mechanical Engineer. By contributing, I can continue to play this sport, a sport that I have become so ingrained in. It will continue to boost my confidence to be successful in life.

I'm looking to raise about $8500 in order to purchase the chair I need to be able to stay in competition. All proceeds raised will go to the purchase of the soccer wheelchair.

With this soccer chair, I will be able to continue competing against other teams and try out for Team USA in the next Power Soccer World Cup. It will make it possible for me to continue teaching the sport to others in power wheelchairs and to inspire others to be successful in life.

Any contribution will go a long way, no matter how much. If you cannot contribute, I ask that you get the word out about this. Tell friends and family. Share it with your friends of Facebook or tweet it out on twitter, whatever you can do to get the word out. Lets make some noise out there!

 

Thank you very much for all your help.

story:
Why help Lumiere?

Lumiere was created out of the love for Relay for Life. My wife started with Relay for Life 2 years ago, this being the start of our 3rd year. She had never been to a Relay for Life before but like, all of us, we know someone cancer has touched. 

This year she is on the Relay for Life Committee and was challenged to make Relay for Life not just a walk, but a family fun event. With helping her, I found out that there were NO mascots just for Relay for Life! I did find Mascots for a Care that was at a Relay for Life event and families loved it. 

I got to work on design ideas for a Relay for Life mascot. After about 3 months Lumiere Pierre Luminarie was born! Our very own Luminarie Relay for Life mascot.

I wanted Lumiere not just to be for my Relay for Life event but everyone's! Since his first outing, he has been to many events and Kick-Off Party's. He is getting requests all the time from other teams some hours away from home.

Now Lumiere has been invited to Mascots for a Care in Portland, Oregon. Where they will attempt to break Japan's Guinness Book of World Records for most mascots at an event! Lumiere will be in the Rose Festival Parade and would attract attention from places like ESPN, The Today Show, Ellen DeGeneres and more!

With all of this we would like a more professionally looking one to represent us.


What We Need & What You Get

What we would like for Lumiere is a professionally made mascot to represent us at the Mascots for a Cure.

  • I have found what we feel is the best mascot making company for the price and quality of work.
  • This company has even donated add-on to Lumiere! The ProMo Pack Cooling system, Custom Carrying Bag Set and the Battery operated cooling fan system. Totaling to over $500.
  • To top things off the Mascot Company will match the first 5 - $50 entry fees of the mascots they have made and that are participating in this years event!


  • First and foremost, raise much-needed funds and awareness to save lives from cancer through the Relay For Life movement.
  • For Lumiere's friends that donate $25 will get 

    1) As a thank you, Your name will be listed on Lumiere's Facebook page, Twitter and websites as a donating friend. 

    2) You will also get rights to order as many Lumiere Mascots form our mascot maker as you would like.

  • For Lumiere's friends that donate $100 will get

    1) As a thank you, Your name will be listed on Lumiere's Facebook page, Twitter and websites as a donating friend. 

    2) You will get a custom made Lumiere doll! Limited edition!

    3) You will also get rights to order as many Lumiere Mascots form our mascot maker as you would like.


  • For Lumiere's friends that donate $1,000 well get

    1) As a thank you, Your name will be listed on Lumiere's Facebook page, Twitter and websites as a donating friend. 

    2) You will share Lumiere with us for our events. (YES that means we will ship him to you! To use at your events!)

    3) You will get a custom made Lumiere doll! Limited edition! 

    4) You will get rights to order as many Lumiere Mascots form our mascot maker as you would like.

  • For Lumiere's friends that donate $5,500

    You will be our Full Sponsor of of our new Lumiere Mascot! 

    Your name will be listed on Lumiere's Facebook page, Twitter and websites as our Full Sponsor. 

    1) You will get to have your info on the back of Lumiere for all to see. 

    2) You will share Lumiere with us for our events (YES that means we will ship him to you! To use at your events!)

    3) You will get a custom made Lumiere doll! Limited edition!

    4) You will get the rights to order as many Lumiere Mascots form our mascot maker as you would like.


The Impact

Lumiere's friends at Mascots for a Care, I thank say it best, with there opening words.

Have you ever found yourself speechless when in the presence of someone affected by cancer? Somehow your mind freezes over like a cold winter morning. Your words may freeze up, but deep down inside, you can feel your temperature rising inside as your heart begins to melt for the person. As you stand in silence, you begin searching the recesses of your mind looking for just the right words of inspiration, something up-lifting and optimistic, but yet, nothing remarkable seems come to mind.

Without speaking a word, like pixie dust, mascots bring about a magical presence. Those big, furry, larger-than-life, animated characters full of personality and charm have been engaging the imagination of people for decades. Mascots spark laughter and can provide a lighthearted distraction from the unpleasant realities of life. Now, imagine hundreds of mascots together in one place, fighting for a common cause. Speechless again, correct?

by mascotsforacure.org

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute does not mean you can't help! Working with Relay for Life, we all have learned that sometimes just word of mouth can make a bigger contribution than money! 

Please share this with your friends and loved ones! 

Like Lumiere on Facebook at /LumiereForRelay
