story:
NOTE: we made FeenPhone and are raising more money to improve it. Go here for more info please. Thank you!

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/feenphone-st...

Overview for FeenPhone

The oldest and most powerful form of human communication is one person speaking to another. Spoken audio, in the form of podcasts, audio books and radio, is the most intimate and direct way to get an idea across.

It's also infinitely portable. People can consume audio-only media while riding a bike, driving a car or doing other things, which is not possible (or at least not safe) while consuming video or the printed word.

The Internet has lowered the cost barrier for a worldwide radio show to a price approaching zero. Yet there is one arena where you still need thousands of dollars to approach the audio quality of the corporate media: Doing a live spoken show with more than one host in different geographic locations. Our program FeenPhone will solve that problem, and it will be given away free. 

Why not just use Skype?

Skype isn't truly duplex; when one person speaks, it cuts the other person off. This makes conversations sound unnatural. Even trained radio hosts naturally sometimes talk over each other a little bit, especially at the end of one person speaking and the start of another person speaking. We need software that is duplex so the audience feels like they're in the same room with the people speaking.

Skype, Mumble, TeamSpeak, Blink, etc. all have their uses...general phone calls or gaming teams. But those VoIP programs are not sufficient for doing high quality audio in real time over a distance. They're all made for using crappy mics in noisy locations over varying quality Internet. Therefore, you'll never get stellar sound from any of them. Plus, they all work through a central server, which lowers audio quality and increases latency, audio artifacting and drop outs.

The criteria for making audio for podcasting, radio and remote voiceover are different. We plan to build FeenPhone: a free and open-source program for podcasters, Internet radio shows, filmmakers, voiceover artists and radio hosts that will meet our unique needs. We need a peer-to-peer system designed for very low latency, no drop outs and excellent sound when used in a room with little or no background noise with decent mics over good cable Internet connections.

A decent mic doesn't cost much. We have done extensive on-air tests of many microphones and recommend the $50 Audio-Technica AT2005USB.

 

That mic is loud and clear, has a great pickup pattern for spoken audio, rejects background noise, and even has a tiny bit of built-in compression to reduce peaks and give a smoother sound. It's also plug-and-play so it doesn't require an external USB interface. 

We will be building FeenPhone with that and similar high-quality, low-price cardioid dynamic USB mics in mind. That mic, some blankets hung up to deaden audio reflections, a pair headphones, a cheap streaming server and FeenPhone will enable you to do ultra-high quality live Internet radio shows and podcasts across the miles...Even if your co-host is in a different country. You'll even be able to use FeenPhone to connect to a radio network without additional equipment, should you get syndicated.

We can't believe someone hasn't done this yet. The world needs free and open-source software that does all this.

I started my show, The Freedom Feens, in 2011 as a podcast. I am now syndicated on 25 commercial radio stations. I had to buy a $1400 piece of broadcast-specific gear to be able to connect to the network before I was able to go live. FeenPhone will replace the need for that type of gear.

FeenPhone could also be used to take calls on a call-in show, with better audio quality than Skype, and with much higher quality than phones.

FeenPhone will be given away free, and the source code will be available free for anyone to use, change or develop as they like.

If you've got something to say to the world, the world can already listen. But if your sound quality is substandard, the world isn't going to listen very long or very often. We need to build FeenPhone to allow you, us, and everyone to be able to speak in crystal-clear high-quality audio over a standard cable Internet connection.

PLANNED CRITERIA FOR FeenPhone:

--High quality audio over cable Internet

--Peer-to-peer (NOT through central server) 

--Opus Codec for highest quality

--Switchable to SIP for connecting to standard radio network hardware codec units for syndication.

--Automatically opens port in 5000-5010 range for session, closes port after session.

--Password protected, with different passwords possible for each connecting user.

--Auto-connect (with password) to allow use with automation software / Internet radio networks.

--No noise reduction. (Noise reduction is not needed and will reduce quality of good audio.)

--No-latency encryption, to add security and prevent hijacking of session.

--Text chat (Helpful with troubleshooting, or exchanging show notes during a live show.)

--Very low latency (50-200 ms)

--No creep in latency

--Audio metering and volume control

--Ability to save frequently called IP numbers

--Ability to choose the sound device in and out.

--Mono duplex (Also usable as stereo one-plex for studio-to-tower link)

--Ability to use different settings in each direction (Important if person recording or broadcasting has better Internet connection than remote co-host)

--Platform: Windows. Possibly also a cross-platform browser plug-in to allow calls from those on different operating systems. Source code free for full stand-alone development by others on Mac/Andriod/Linux.

--License: Open Source / Free Software (GNU General Public License.)

--Source code: will be on GitHub.

SUGGESTED SETTINGS FOR HIGH QUALITY LOW-LATENCY TWO-WAY SPEECH:

--Codec: Opus

--Buffer: 80 ms

--Sample Rate: 24,000

--Bit rate: 32 kbit/s (Up to 48 kbit/s, automatically downmix to lower as needed.)

--Quality: Super Wide Band (12 kHz)

Do you also take Bitcoin?

Yes!

1Q3QxoXcX5HYpkqRZ4uHXJXrmZzHehBZVP

Who We Are:

PROJECT LEADER: Michael W. Dean. Talk radio host on Freedom Feens show on Genesis Communications Network. The show is on 25 commercial stations. Michael is a musician, an audio engineer and was creating and sharing spoken audio shows over the Internet in 1998. He was a first-adopter of podcasting, back in 2006.

Michael is also a technical writer for O'Reilly Media:

http://www.oreilly.com/pub/au/3220

Michael was the team leader and head publicist on the MeowBit, FreeSpeechMe and MouseCount software projects. He also does publicity for Bitshares: http://bitshares.org/community/team/

LEAD PROGRAMMER: Derrick Slopey. Derrick runs Alienseed Software. He developed MeowBit and the Silver Calculator App for Windows Phone.

We will also likely be hiring a second programmer. Derrick will oversee this.

WHO BENEFITS?

Media creators and media consumers. FeenPhone will remove the price barrier to making ultra-high quality live collaborative spoken audio, taking it out of the hands of only the ultra-rich.

BREAKDOWN OF WHERE THE FUNDS WILL GO (After Indiegogo takes their cut off the top):

30%: Compensation for programmer Derrick Slopey to allow him to work as much as possible on creating, and then improving, FeenPhone for as long as possible. He will also be the project coordinator for hiring and overseeing other programmer(s).

30%: Rewards for other programmer(s) to help perfect FeenPhone.

25%: Team leader Michael W. Dean to oversee, test, consult, offer usability input and audio expertise, write documentation, do fundraising and publicity, and do general day-to-day cat herding.

5%: Perks and postage for perks.

15%: Misc / prudent reserve for unexpected expenses / legal expenses / extra cloud hosting if we get suddenly slammed with traffic, etc. Will likely all be spent, but if any ends up unspent, it will return to Derrick, other programmers and Michael to fund additional full-time work on FeenPhone.

CAN YOU GET THIS DONE IF YOU DON'T REACH YOUR FULL GOAL?
We are unquestionably dedicated this project. We will work on this as hard as we can with whatever funds we raise. But to really hit it out of the park, $20,000 is what we feel we'd need.

If we pass our goal, we will work longer on this. The more money we raise, the better we can make the software, and the more we can spread it. Widespread adoption of FeenPhone will make the world a better-sounding place.

We are unquestionably dedicated this project. We will work on this as hard as
we can with whatever funds we raise. But to really hit it out of the park,
$20,000 is what we feel we'd need. 
If we pass our goal, we will work longer on this. The more
money we raise, the better we can make the software, and the more we can spread
it. Widespread adoption of FeenPhone will make the world a better-sounding
place.

story:
Neil Johnson, Landscaper, Gardener, Baker and Father, has recently been diagnosed with Cancer. Living and working in the BVI with no health insurance, he was forced to quit his job and return home to Jamaica.  Although more afordable in Jamaica,  treatment  is still incredibly expensive. As well as being sick himself,  some of his children also  have  a condition called Sickle Cell Anaemia. This is a severe blood disorder, where by the red blood cells are sickle shape instead of oval shape.  Many side affects exist,  including chronic anaemia, episode of sever pain, swollen hands and feet, as well as frequent infections.  His children constantly need expensive medication.

Neil has lived in the BVI for several years, working two jobs in order to support his family. He has been a great influence in the community, as well as a loyal friend.

Any help that we can give will be more than appreciated and incredibly well deserved.

story:
The Low Down

We love yoga and we love Indianapolis. So, Alicia Oskay and Alyssa Pfennig are combining experience and passion to open the first wellness space in Indianapolis dedicated to therapeutic yoga practices. 

Embarque Yoga Therapy + Massage will open on November 15 in Broad Ripple (above Nicey Treat) and will offer:

  • Therapeutic Yoga Services
  • Thai Yoga Therapy
  • Swedish, Deep-Tissue + Hot Stone Massage
  • Nutrition Consultations
  • Life Coaching

We would appreciate your support of our endeavour with a contribution to our Indiegogo campaign to help us fund start-up costs associated with the opening of this space. We put together some nice perks as well and would love for you to share with others via email, on social media, etc.

Meet Alyssa + Alicia

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise $5,000 to help cover initial start-up costs, including:

  • Three (3) months rent
  • Rope Wall installation with two stations
  • Furniture (i.e.,, loveseat, chairs, desk, filing cabinet, table for consultations)
  • Thai massage mat, pillows and bolsters
  • Decor (i.e., large rug for waiting area)
  • Administrative Costs (i.e., Mind Body Online, Website, Email)
  • Logo and Business Card Design
  • Printing & Advertising Costs
Perks include jewelry imported directly from Thailand through Monarch Bleu and your choice of personal services from us, all of which also make great holiday gifts for yourself or your loved ones. Scroll down to see all the perks.
Also, even if we don't reach our goal, we'll still use the funds toward expenses listed above.

The Impact

Your contributions will not only support Embarque, but will support the community by making space for therapeutic yoga practices to thrive in Indianapolis. Yoga as a therapy is designed to help heal the physical, energetic and mental/emotional body through relief of symptoms and improved function with special attention to the underlying cause of illnesses. We work with:

  • Physical limitations and injuries, including post-surgical conditions
  • Specific health conditions such as back pain, arthritis, depression and anxiety
  • Pregnancy and post-pregnancy
  • Reducing and managing effects of degenerative diseases such as Parkinson's

Some of the Perks

Lip Balm from Barbeaux Formulaire 
handcrafted in Carmel

Custom Designed Window Decal by DharmaTees
designed in Indianapolis

Handcrafted 5x8 Journal from White Ox Studio
handmade in Indianapolis

Scarves and Tree of Life Necklaces
handmade in Thailand | courtesy of Monarch Bleu

Other Ways You Can Help

Please know that any way you can help is appreciated, even if it's not a monetary donation. Here are some other way:

  • Share our posts on Facebook and Twitter with your friends and family
  • Forward our emails with friends and family
Thank you so much for your support. We look forward to sharing our space with you.

story:
My sister in law, Becky, is one of the most amazingly talented people I've ever met. Give her some fabric and a sewing machine and she'll make you a whole new wardrobe.

Becky was always heavy growing up and was teased relentlessly. Causing her to shy away from people. She dieted, she saw doctors, she did whatever was asked of her but nothing worked. The weight never left her body. Years later, confronted with the possibility of diabetes, she was able to lose 80 lbs. A huge accomplishment! Well, she slowly began to venture out of that shell and trust people again. She did costuming for a local theatre and eventually began working as a behavioral therapist. Things were going great.

Beginning to feel self conscious she looked into getting a tummy tuck. That was where everything fell apart. The day of surgery she was notified that she had been laid off...which meant NO health benefits. Then after the surgery came all the complications and nobody could quite figure out why she was having all the problems.

After countless doctor/ E.R. visits Becky was told that she was in stage 4 kidney failure. She was essentially one step away from dialysis with a life expectancy of about 4 years.

Completely on her own with no health insurance and a dire diagnosis she was strung along through the medical system. From there she moved back in with her parents and has continued to endure health problem after health problem. Including partial blindness and congestive heart failure. Essentially rendering her a complete homebody. Unable to leave the house, unable to see or even properly care for herself.

Her ray of hope has become her personal blog. Up until now alot of friends and family, inlcuding myself, have been completely unaware of the heartache and torment that Becky has endured. I believe that her blog is her way of subtly reaching out for support.

You can read her blog here...where she goes into more detail about her life and health concerns. http://peckinxanth.blogspot.com/

 

I've put together this campaign to help lighten her financial load. As a young woman with no health insurance, unable to receive any sort of government financial/ medical aid ...it has depleted any savings of hers as well as her parents as well as created a nice pile of debt. On top of that without insurance most of the doctors/ procedures and medications she needs are unavailable to her.

 

Let's rally together and do what we can, please. If you're unable to contribute you can also spread the word!! Share this campaign and tell others about her story. You can also share/ follow her blog! Let's make a difference and let her know how much we care for her. Thank you so much!

story:
Send Rosanna on a Healing Journey to Ireland

Those who know Rosanna know what a loving, caring, passionate, and compassionate person she is.  Many are also aware of how gut-wrenchingly hard the past few years have been for her, as her mother has slipped into an as-of-now incurable illness (a rare form of Early Onset Alzheimer's) that has shaken the lives of Rosanna and her family.  Through this sad and frightening ordeal, Rosanna has been there for her mother and has chosen to put all on hold to give her the care she needs.  In addition to caretaking, Rosanna has been contending with bureaucratic hoops of a truly broken medical and social services system that has thus far failed to provide any of the support her mother and her family so urgently need. It has been--and for the foreseeable future will continue to be--a long, lonely, painful road.  This experience has taken a tremendous emotional and physical toll on Rosanna already.

While those of who love and care about Rosanna may not be able to help her in all the ways we wish we could, one thing we can do is shower her with love and support.  Rosanna’s 40th birthday is coming up on September 27!  One of her dreams is to finally be able to go to Ireland to connect directly with a land that she has long held in her heart. For many who know Rosanna and her knowledge, love, and passion for all things Celtic, it may come as a surprise that she has never physically been to her ancestral land.  Well let’s change that!

This is an invitation to all of Rosanna’s friends--and friends of friends and caring folks out there who might stumble across this--to pool our resources together to send Rosanna to Ireland, where she can connect with her roots, as well as connect with herself after far too long of pushing her own needs aside.  Perhaps this healing journey can help Rosanna get the boost she needs to face the next steps of the process of getting her mother the help she requires, while also taking care of herself so she can once again more fully share her art,  activism, and many other gifts with the world.

Please donate what you can, or at least leave some words of encouragement for Rosanna.  And please spread the word about this campaign!

p.s. - For a simple and moving video about Rosanna's mother's condition, see: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e9_dpe9Rbvw

story:
Preface

Hello, My name is Ryan Saleh, co-founder and creator of the HeadDoctor application.  My team and I would like to personally thank you for taking the time to partake in this project. It is something that we take great pride in and think will really help change the state of medical care as it relates to head injuries.

 

The Project

While no head injury should be taken lightly, the real danger is in repeat injuries. Sustaining two or more concussions in a relatively short period of time can be seriously dangerous and has been linked to long term conditions like depression. The only way to effectively prevent these repeat injuries is to have a widely available, easy to use, and highly accurate method of detecting concussions within minutes of sustaining the injury.

 

To date, there is no effective, portable tool for measuring unusual pupil or oculomotor behavior, and as scientific research finds more links between concussions and long-term brain damage, we saw it to be essential to create a tool with these capabilities. Whether you are a football coach, a teacher, or a parent, a tool to help quickly determine the presence of a concussion can save lives and prevent permanent brain damage.

 

Developing this technology is expensive and cannot be completed without funding. At the same time, we feel that this tool should be freely available to the entire world.

 

If we are able to meet our fundraising goals, we will make the HeadDoctor permanently free in the App Store. With this tool on everyone's phone, we believe that we are making the world a safer place.

 

Thanks again,  we appreciate your contribution!

story:
What We Are Doing

Making better river surfing waves everywhere by:

Building the best river surfing wave in the world

Proving surf waves can be easily built anywhere

Testing new waves designs and improving old wave shapes

Sharing the technical details and construction knowledge of our builds so you can build your surf wave better

Go to SurfAnywhere.ca for more information.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $30,000.  Half of that money goes towards the professional hydraulic, environmental and structural engineering of the surf wave and to releasing details technical plans to help others build better waves.  The rest and any extras go towards the construction of the wave which costs about $200,000.  We will raise the rest of the construction money via matching government grants, additional fundraising efforts and donations.  All funds raised whether over, under or the exact amount go towards this project.

The perks are:

Surf Anywhere and ARSA decals

Surf Anywhere T-Shirt (No Ocean Required)

River Surfing Lessons

Surf Trips to some of the best River Surfing Waves

Being an inside guest during the grand opening celebrations

Go to SurfAnywhere.ca for more information.

The Impact

This project will bring amazing surf waves to every river city.  Your contribution creates an open source resource for wave building that will continue to grow and improve.  Your contribution will build the best river surfing wave in the world.

Go to SurfAnywhere.ca for more information.

Why Donate to the Surf Anywhere Project?

Donate to the Surf Anywhere Project because it will work and will spread waves everywhere.

Why will it work?

HISTORY OF DEDICATION

  • Since 2005 we have spent years of concerted effort, broad research, countless time and lots of funds on building a the perfect river surfing wave

PERFECT LOCATION

  • Work is easy and inexpensive because the river shuts off and is empty every night
  • Work will be approved because there is a 25 year history of similar projects in this location

PROVEN DESIGN

  • Design has been working safely and effectively for 40 years in Muenchen, Deutschland
  • Newly built wave in Bratislava, Slovakia successfully uses the same ideas as Surf Anywhere Project

GOVERNMENT AND USER SUPPORT

  • All levels of government have provided conditional support based on theSurf Anywhere Proposal.  The condition is full and professional hydraulic, environmental and structural engineering.  We have the engineers lined up, all we need is the money.
  • All local user groups and businesses support building a wave and the Surf Anywhere Project

RIVER FEATURES ARE BEING BUILT

  • River features are already being built around the world.
  • We will provide the detailed technical information to ensure all of those river features include perfect surf waves.

Go to SurfAnywhere.ca for more information.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are two things we need:

1. Spread the Word as far as you can!

2. Donate!

 

Thank you!

Neil Egsgard, President

Alberta River Surfing Association

story:
May, 22 Katrina Thiessen and Cory Holden were blessed with a beautiful baby girl, Chloe-Mae Rose Holden. Two days later they found out that our beautiful little girl had a bowel obstruction and was taken into exploritory surgery. 

The amazing doctors at St. Lukes found that she had an underdeveloped colon due to the obstruction. They reattached the large intestine to the colon in hopes that the colon could develop and all would be well. 

A week later, Chloe stopped eating again and was taken into emergency surgery. The underdeveloped colon couldn't handle what was being put through it and tore right below the original reattachment site. They had to do an ileostomy, which is where they bring the large intestine and the colon to the surface and have her use a colostomy bag. We were told she would have to have the bag for at least 6 weeks. Until she was older and more capable of handling another surgury and her colon was large enough to handle its load without fear of another tear.

They told Katie and Cory that she would be able to leave the NICU (Neonatal intensive Care Unit) and come home in the mean time as long as she was eating and growing. Unfortunately, Chloe-Mae has been taking two steps forward and one step back. She has gained weight and enlarged the amount she is eating, only to find out that she isn't absorbing the nutrients she needs. 

At this point, Katie and Cory don't know when or if they will be able to take Chloe-Mae home before bringing her back for a third surgury.

As you can imagine, the cost of this terrible situation is weighing heavily on this young couple. Katie, who usually works at the Ada County Courthouse, is applying for temporary disability, but when and if she gets it, it will be only half of her usual pay. Cory, who is a student at BSU, is waiting to be sent out to fight forest fires and is working part time (when they have the work for him) doing construction. 

Katie spends her days split up between taking care of her two and a half year old son, learning new medical procedures she will need to know if Chloe is allowed to come home, and trying to give her new daughter as much love as she can before she has to leave for the night.

We, their family, are trying to get the word out there that they need help! This young family has enough strain on them with learning how to take care of Chloe's special needs and wishing every day that they will get to take her home soon. We are hoping that you can find it in your hearts to help them out. 

Katie has insurance through her work, but her out of pocket debt is expected to be $3000 in medical bills not to mention the bills that are backing up with the low wages they have coming in. We are just trying to help with the medical expences. We can't make Chloe better for them, but we can help take at least one thing off their plate.

Please help my sweet little niece take at least a small amount of stress of her parents.

story:
*We never expected to reach our goal so quickly, as it was a minimal goal we needed to set, this park is in the need of a lot of funding please continue to donate and Thank You!

This lot which belongs to the Port Authority of NY&NJ, it is leased to the Hells Kitchen Neighborhood Association and Clinton Housing.  In the early 90's this park was renovated and with a lock and key provided by the Community you were able to volunteer and plant and sit and watch birds hense named "Bird Park".

With a great team at Cultivate HKNY they are bringing this park back to life.

The propasal is for a Community Park which other parks in the neighborhood will share the same key which you can purchase at the Community Board.  Tables and Chairs for sitting in the park during busy Midtown Lunch Breaks.  Plants, Flowers and more Greenary overall, Paving Stones with also Donated Pieces of art such as sculptures from local artists will also be placed in this park, including a reading section a bin of books that are also donated.

The article provided is from The New York Times and Teresa Mattia a long time resident of Hells Kitchen Neighborhood recently passed in September from Multiple Sclerosis in Memory of her this park will be named after her.  Other parks in the neighborhood share the same values of other notable Hells Kitchen residents (Bob's Park on 35th St. & Alice's Garden on 38th St, also Astros' Dog Run on 39th and 10th Ave.)

Please Like CultivateHKNY on Facebook

 

All proceeds from this fundraiser will go towards the budget of bringing this park back to life. 

Your contributions will cover: Paving stones, benches, picnic tables and seats / chairs, mulch, flowers/plants and tools.  (see attached mockups)

 

(Teresa Mattia, 51 passed due to Multiple Sclerosis in September)

(New York Times Article from 1998 when the Park was open, Teresa Mattia was featured in this article with her son Mario Mattia about how the park was a hangout for the homeless now a park which the neighborhood can enjoy, park been closed for about 4 years now below is photo of current status, its in very much need of all the support!)

*We never expected to reach our goal so quickly, as it was a minimal goal we needed to set, this park is in the need of a lot of funding please continue to donate and Thank You!
This lot which belongs to the Port Authority of NY&NJ, it is leased to the Hells Kitchen Neighborhood Association and Clinton Housing.  In the early 90's this park was renovated and with a lock and key provided by the Community you were able to volunteer and plant and sit and watch birds hense named "Bird Park".

story:
Click here for update video: https://vimeo.com/54751250

 

Brandon's Smile

At 29 years old, Brandon has experienced a lot more than his timid, close-lipped smile lets on. Homeless for six years, Brandon felt the cold and shivered; he suffered the hard ground in place of a warm bed; he endured the shame of downward looks and harsh words from passersby. In short, Brandon is no stranger to difficulty.

But he’s also no stranger to hope.   

A year ago, Brandon found a home, a family, and a new life that surpassed anything he could have expected. But for all that he’s gained, the difficulties of his homelessness have not been completely eradicated.

Malnutrition and lack of hygiene during Brandon’s homeless years have ravaged his teeth, making eating and brushing excruciating tasks. He cannot enjoy a meal or laugh with a friend without the painful reminder of his rotting teeth. His smile continues to affect his entire life.

But he has hope.

Join us as we come together to rebuild Brandon’s teeth, alleviate years of pain and embarrassment, and reinstate his sense of self confidence.

Please help us give Brandon a reason to smile.
